review:
Version longue : https://cabinetdechaologie.wordpress.com/seances/dix-huitieme-seance/the-39-steps-sauver-lame-dhannay/

Version courte : pas vraiment un jeu, plutôt un visual novel au scénario solide puisque tiré d'un roman de John Buchan. La linéarité et la quasi-absence de gameplay n'en font pas un mauvais produit, suivre les aventures d'Hannay est très agréable mais ne vous attendez pas à être sollicité pour autre chose que cliquer pour faire avancer l'histoire. Doublages anglais excellents.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995737236', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1539268539}
review: Je le conseille positivement pour sa qualité d'écriture et de design. Cependant, je préfère dans ce genre de jeu, une histoire narrative où j'ai des choix à faire et que ces choix ont une conséquence. Ce n'est pas le cas dans ce jeu. Je préfère encore dans ces cas-la lire un livre. C'est plus passionnant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104194390', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1537847398}
review:
[h1]Soy mentor en Steam!![/h1]
[url]http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31570421/[/url]

The 39 Steps es una novela visual basada en la novela de misterio/suspense de John Buchan de 1915. La historia y el texto están intactos: poco antes del estallido de la Primera Guerra Mundial, el ex oficial del ejército Richard Hannay se establece en Londres. Su estado mental cambia literalmente de la noche a la mañana cuando un vecino, Franklin Scudder, se refugia en su apartamento y revela que ha tropezado con un complot alemán para asesinar al primer ministro griego y robar los planes de Gran Bretaña para el estallido de la Gran Guerra. Cuando Scudder es asesinado unos días después, Hannay cree que es el próximo. Él huye hacia el campo, esquivando varios intentos en su vida mientras trata de revelar el cifrado que utilizó Scudder para encriptar sus notas sobre la trama alemana.

La versión de The 39 Steps de Story Mechanics combina texto e imágenes para hacer que la historia de Buchan cobre vida. Te mueves de escena en escena, cada uno muy bellamente ilustrado. Los efectos de sonido hacen eco, incluyendo pasos, respiración pesada, traqueteos de trenes y apertura y cierre de puertas. Hay bits animados ocasionales que juegan puntos de trama. Algunos interludios presentan una actuación de voz de alta calidad respetuosa con los personajes de Buchan. Un punto notable es que sus personajes humanos están representados por siluetas. Nunca ves con claridad la cara de Hannay, o la de Scudder, que deberían ser buenas noticias para cualquier persona que no le guste las adaptaciones de libro a película porque estropean la visión del lector sobre los personajes del libro.

Es una maravillosa adaptación que rinde los más altos respetos a su material fuente. Sería genial ver algunos más clásicos de la misma manera.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167801344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1542964410}
review: The 39 Steps está mais próximo de ser um livro digital do um jogo de videogame, ainda assim a experiência vale a pena. O livro é bem escrito e a narrativa é consistente, some a isso as belas ilustrações, a trilha sonora e alguma interação com o ambiente e você tem uma obra única, gostosa de apreciar (não vale jogar com pressa) e que irá te entreter por várias horas. Se você aprecia histórias de suspense e/ou espionagem, sabe aproveitar jogos com um ritmo mais lento e está tranquilo com a ideia de apenas acompanhar o personagem principal, da mesma forma como faria com um livro, recomendo que comece a ler, ou melhor, jogar, o quanto antes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059030698', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1536242774}
review:
John Buchan's short story has stood the test of time, and through its various adaptations on screen and in other popular media it has come to be considered as one of the first (and best) examples of an espionage - detective novel ("shocker" as Buchan liked to call it). 
This digital adaptation worths every click of your mouse (it needs to be said, you won't be doing anything more complicated than this!). Visually, the hand-painted scenes carry the spirit of the book faitfully, and my recommendation is to enjoy this reading of the 39 steps under dim light, preferably in one winter, rainy night sitting. The developers have made a very thorough research in the historical setting of the novel, and a number of collectables during the game can be used as short but very informative references to the social and cultural context of early 20th century Britania on the eve of the 'Great War'. From imperial maps and local Scottish accents to the anti-semitism that unfortunately can be found in Buchan's and many of his contemporaries' worldview, this amazing visual novel will serve as a history seminar to those willing to discover its rich texture. Enjoy it as if every click is the turn of a page, and if you have not done so already try and grab a copy of the book. 
Achievements come naturally as you progress, and will pop up even when you are offline, but collecting and reading both sides of the in-game cards is far more rewarding and entertaining. 
I wish all visual novels were as well-researched, inspired and perfectly executed as this one. 
Highly recommended and I will soon check out the developer's new adventure called 'Beckett'.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970677811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1534802883}
review:
I wouldn't really call this a game, but it is entertaining. 

It's a good conspiracy story, and the illustrations are beautiful. 

Beatable it in just a few hours even if reading/watching all sequences.  Guaranteed 100%.

I played it completely on a tablet and all menus and gameplay were fully functional.

The 39 Steps an interactive multimedia story; kind of a mixture of audiobook, e-book, picturebook and even some short videos.  There are no decisions to be made, you are just watching it play out. Occasionally there is a tracing activity for when the main character does actions within the story, but otherwise it's just clicking between sequences.  If you're into interactive stories then it's worth a play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096942945', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1529653392}
review:
The 39 Steps - Formless Review

Story Mode Completed - Yes
Achievement Completion - 100%

Story: 8/10

Based on the novel, the game has a really strong story which is told through fantastic voice acting. The chapters are broken up in neat segments which makes for easy saving and returning to the game at a later time. The story is gripping though it has it's downfall as you essentially have little choice or interactability in comparison with other point and click story-orientated games. For a game based on a novel, it makes for a great story and an enjoyable journey.

Mechanics: 4/10

Simplistic mechanics, similar to other games of the genre. As the story follows a linear narrative and offers little choice, the mechanics boil down to simple point and click, scrolling through walls of text and occasionally listening to the voice overs. Between reading and dialogue, there's little to do, not much for puzzles or interactability. The game leads you down a rather straigh path though the story makes up for it.

Aesthetics: 7/10

The art style is appealing and easy on the eye. There's not much eye candy or flashy scenes that will have you on the edge of your seat, though combined with the strong narrative, the art work allows for a pleasurable experience which is easy to follow. Nothing too special but definitely a pretty game.

Overall - 8/10

If you can play a game entirely for the story and a simple but enjoyable journey, this game is great. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121219566', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1494081537}
review:
Nice little game made after what i imagine is an interesting book. The voice acting sounds amazingly professional, the music is very good but the best part of the game is the art. It's the most immersive part of the game, it changes around from cut scenes to gameplay and the art fits every situation perfectly
I don't know how much the game follows the books story since I haven't read it, but i wish there were more games made after books like this simply because it feels very polished, like the game knows what it wants, where it wants to go.
The one con i can think of is the price tag, as the game is very short and doesn't have much replay value, I'm a bit slow and it took me 4.5 hours.

review:
Recuerden que Play significa reproducir.

La historia no es mala, pero no es un juego; uno no tiene influencia en los eventos ni en nada. En vez de verte una serie o leer un libro puedes pasarte unas horitas en 39 steps. Eso sí, imprescindible entender inglés, no hay subtitulos en español.

Importante/Requerido
Saber leer/comprender inglés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401112269', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1530731070}
review:
[b]Uma interessante adaptação literária, com assertividade histórica de encher os olhos[/b].

É importante, antes de jogar, entender que não se trata de algo profundamente interativo, e sim de uma tentativa bem-sucedida de aprofundar uma experiência literária por meio de pequenas interações, baseadas em cliques, movimentos com o mouse e objetos que, ao serem examinados, fornecem mais leituras. Assim, se você busca algo com escolhas, desafios e etc., não é aqui que você encontrará.

Além disso, existe a questão do idioma, porque o inglês praticado aqui é por vezes difícil. Quando se trata de escocês então, em que a transcrição ocorre com o sotaque, é melhor tentar escutar, porque da leitura surgirão enigmas idiomáticos.

Ultrapassadas essas considerações, gostei bastante do trabalho feito pelos desenvolvedores. A trilha sonora é envolvente, a história se desenrola rápido e é fácil se envolver na trama de espionagem e reviravoltas. A arte do jogo não é maravilhosa, mas detalhes como fotos históricas, reproduções de jornais antigos, desenhos de mapas antigos e até pequenas animações bem humoradas demonstram a preocupação em ambientar o roteiro e conduzir o leitor ao ambiente narrado.

As dublagens são interessantes, e é muito legal ver uma obra literária aqui na Steam ser transformada num jogo tão cuidadoso com o trabalho de seu autor. Se literatura e história inglesa são temas que te interessam, fica aqui minha sincera recomendação.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1530690283}
review:
Tags: Adventure - VN - Visual Novel 
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Worth a check but not a permanent collection spot. Good characters, well presented, but low interactivity, no replayability and very abrupt disappointing ending. 

Effectively presented historical thriller slideshow with quality voiceovers and sound effects. Very little interactiviity. Short. Ending felt abrupt and unsatisfying.

The 39 steps starts with three or four lengthier chapters, setting up the base of the story. There are enough plot hooks, characterizations and intense quality conversation to hold attention. The dialogue felt credible, historically credible, accents matched. The art was relaxing and transitioned slowly and elegantly between scenes. Very little use of animation was present, but on the rare occasions that it was present, it was done tastefully and it enhanced the experience.

The maps were well done and gave a good grasp of the location of the character along the journeying. However, the social maps, were not so well constructed. The journal was cryptic and decoding it was done through QTE's and a poorly described deciphering method. The newspaper were filled with details but could not be zoomed in comfortably enough to read any of them and summoning the text though the unsatisfying interface often led to seemingly pointless bits of political insight and rivalries being reported on about the paper.

This is meant to turn into some sort of TInker Tailor Soldier Spy scenario with the uncovering of spies, and a lot of disguises, psychological misdirection and the like. The game also has a very faint hint of cthulhu to it, with some of your antagonists being increasingly described as having certain odd quirks of behaviors, uncommon talents and whatnot.

The game ends very abruptly at the end of a chapter as you foil an intelligence leak outside the coutnry using the journal from the intro then the game cuts off to credits immediately. While the game did not leave a ton unexplained, it just did not feel like the buildup leading up to it, slow and detailed that it was, would simply fall flat anticlimactically the way it has.

This, in short, is a more enjoyable game than say Alter Ego. While Alter Ego had decent historical characters, arguably better looking environments, nice fluff art, and equally good if not better voice acting, it also had a lot of pixelhunting, grocery list crossing type detecting sleuth hunts that left you frustrated and in need of a walktrhough. In comparison the 39 steps was much more relaxing. The game might not had been very interactive but it concentrated on what it did and it did well at it. The problem is that it does not feel like a complete package either. While Alter Ego was just rushed out unfinished I am not sure what the deal is with the 39 steps. Perhaps this is in fact a whole story but with the slideshow presentation too many details were cut out from the book and it does not impact the same way. Or maybe it too was cut short. After all the chapters did seem to become shorter and shorter as the game progressed where by the end you just wondered why they even stuck with that structure at all anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028107654', 'num_games_owned': 1215, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1529946079}
review:
故事很棒（当然那是原著小说的功劳），游戏表现力其实一般。

几个缺点：
1. 阅读节奏太慢，太多时间浪费在不可跳过/即刻执行的转场、文字渐入渐出效果上，非常磨叽。
2. 加入了很多额外阅读和交互内容，虽然丰富了互动体验，但比较影响阅读节奏。
3. 分辨率不可调。音量不可调。
4. 操作奇怪。经常容易误操作导致退出或从章节头部开始。

建议感兴趣的还是去看原著小说。

author: {'steamid': '76561198327367911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1529827151}
review:
Wow! An extaordiinary historically accurate spy thirller that is thorougly entertaining and worthwhile to read, a real page turner, equal to anything from Ludlum, Fleming, Clancy. It's "James Bond" meets "Downton Abbey", lol. Probably helped that I'm from South Africa, an old Brttish Empire Colony, with a love for history., and spy novels, so I could relate well. This game and story will rival any Bourne movie today.

Pros - Thrilling graphic novel, great price, historically accurate, superb voice acting, great game mechanics, awesome art and music.
Cons -  Liniar path so no choices, but still a great story with a satisfying plot and game mechanics that makes up for it..

Rreflection and glimpses of a much simpler time when we were also under The Crown (without talking politics, it may have been better if we stayd there, lol.).  Hoping for lots more like this from the devs. One of the best spy visual novels I've ever read. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053495444', 'num_games_owned': 4114, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1529246238}
review:
Looking through a lot of the reviews I think a lot of the people who left negative reviews just aren't into visual novels and maybe weren't aware of what they were when they got into this one. This isn't a typical point & click with puzzles to solve. It isn't a hidden object game or a choose your own adventure story. It is quite literally a novel that has been digitally enhanced with a bit of sound effects, artwork, voice acting, and maybe the occasional mouse "task" like moving it a certain direction or clicking in a certain place. It isn't meant to challenge you, just to engage you more deeply as you read a really great story.

Now for my review:

Pros:
This is the most brilliant way I have seen a visual novel presented so far. I really enjoyed this. I thought it was very well done actually. To other devs who are looking to do a visual novel or as this dev has coined it a "digital adaptation" of thier novel or story, get this and learn from it. This is how you do it right. The art was beautifully done as was the voice acting. There was just enough movement and visualization to not take away from the text, and it wasn't just the reader left clicking endlessly through text like a lot of visual novels. 

At first I was a bit annoyed by the rotation of the mouse to progress the text but once I got used to it I quite liked it. It added a movement and removed the constant drone of clicks from my reading the story. Also, I found that if it bothers you that much you can still click instead of rotate and it will progress you through the same way as if you had rotated, you're just not able to reverse this way. 

The story itself kept me engaged. This is really going to be based on your personal taste. I love a good story about crime and espionage, if you need some romance and teen drama to keep you interested then this probably isn't the tale for you. 

I was very thankful to be able to read what the voice actors were saying, even when we maybe shouldn't have needed to. Some of the words and phrases took me a minute to figure out because the dialects and accents were so strong, but they were very fitting to the story and it just made it work even better, so that isn't a complaint. 

The artwork and visualization mixed with the sound effects were amazing. There was a point where I actually had to grab a blanket and cover up because the dreary London rain had made me chilly even though it's the dead of a hot muggy summer where I live. Really well done.

Cons:
In order to give some constructive criticism I will say that there are times in the story the voice acting echoes and glitches a bit, but other than that I completely enjoyed every moment of it. 

I will say I think the price point is too high. This is probobly the best visual novel I've experiences so far, but the most I've ever paid for one was $5, this at full price is 3 times that. The right audience still might be willing to pay that much for this though...it is really well done. I'm not even sure where I got this from, I'm thinking it was in a bundle of keys I bought or possibly one I traded for in a group I'm in, but I know I would have never paid full price for it and that's a shame because I would have missed out on something awesome had it not come my way through a less expensive route. I would have never been able to justify the cost to myself though knowing the genre, even though it is one I enjoy, having not "played" it first.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995421497', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1528684869}
review:
[b][u]5 Things You Should Know about [i]The 39 Steps[/i][/u][/b]
[b]What Is It?[/b]
This game is actually a book, in digital form.  It's an adventure game of the "no choices to make" variety, so don't come here expecting to [i]do things[/i].  It's based on a 1915 spy/mystery novel of the same name (also made into a movie in 1935, directed by Alfred Hitchcock.)

[b]What's The Best Part?[/b]
It's quite a good read.  If you're looking to get the same feeling out of a video game that you'd get from reading an [i]actual book,[/i] then this is it.  Only with beautiful artwork and decent sound effects mixed in to enhance the atmosphere.

The dialogue spoken throughout the story is fully voice acted - and quite well, I thought - whereas the internal monologue of the main character is just text on screen.  It creates an interesting duality, to listen to some things and read others.

[b]What's The Worst Part?[/b]
The controls, as explained at the beginning, are a bit odd.  Rotate the mouse clockwise to advance the text?  Rotate counterclockwise to go back?  What?  Thankfully, you don't actually have to do that.  You can just left-click anywhere to advance the text, which is much more intuitive.  I'm not sure why the game didn't mention that.

[b]Will I Like It?[/b]
+ Classic spy thriller
+ A contemporary vision of 1914 England (the book was written in the time its story was set.)
+ Beautiful art
+ Decent voice acting

- Weird controls (not sure why they bothered, given the alternate controls make so much more sense)

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]
The 39 Steps is the first in a series of novels by the same author.  Sadly, it doesn't look like any more of them are coming in game form, given that this game was first released in 2013 and nothing new has been heard since.  I would've liked to have seen them, but I suppose I'll have to settle for reading them on paper.

This has been a 5TYSK review. (#0044)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1528311959}
review:
Es ist die Umsetzung des gleichnamigen Spionageromans von John Buchanan aus dem Jahr 1915 als Visual Novel.

Der Roman des Schotten, der es im britischen Weltreich bis zum Generalgouverneur Kanadas schaffte, gilt als Weltliteratur. Zumindest so, wie es in dieser Adaption rüberkommt, kann ich dies nicht begreifen. Für mich ist der Roman eine hanebüchene, billige Geschichte, die zudem den Staub von über 100 Jahren so erfolgreich angesammelt hat, dass es besser gewesen wäre, ihn allenfalls noch literaturhistorisch zu betrachten.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1404546637

Dabei beginnt es relativ spannend mit einem Mord. Aber die Verschwörung, die da aufgedeckt wird, konnte ich bald nicht mehr ernst nehmen. In dieser Geschichte wimmelt es von unglaublichen Zufällen, die der Hauptperson, Richard Hannay, mal so, mal so widerfahren. Selbst in der Einsamkeit Schottlands begegnet er genau immer den Leuten, die von Bedeutung sind. Die fast übermächtige deutsche Agententruppe, die, wie für Deutsche üblich, immer nach einem genauen, finsteren Plan arbeiten, und am Vorabend des Ausbruchs des ersten Weltkrieges wichtige Informationen erbeuten wollen, finde ich ein übles Stereotyp. Aber dieser Plan war so absurd, dass es eigentlich nur für einen Groschenroman gut ist.

Sehr interessant gemacht ist die Darstellung des britischen Lebens von 1914 mit dem Obrigkeitsdenken, dem Gentlemangehabe, dem British-Empire-Überlegenheits-Getue.

Das Buch wurde auch von dem berühmten britischen Rgissuer Alfred Hk. (dessen Name Steam uns nicht schreiben lässt) 1935 verfilmt, wo es aber wesentlich unterhaltsamer zu sein scheint.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1404548065

Wie dem auch sei, ich fand die ganze Sache bald mehr als mühselig. Die wenigen Interaktionen können kaum als Interaktion bezeichnet werden. Man muss vielleicht mal 2, 3 Sachen auf dem Screen finden oder soll Mausbewegungen durchführen.

Künstlerisch haben die Entwickler allerdings eine gute Leistung abgeliefert. Es sind offenbar alles gemalte Bilder von oft sehr schönen Landschaften und Häusern. Aber Handlungen werden nur angedeutet und die Personen sind nur als Schatten dargestellt, was ich nicht so toll fand.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1404547380

Für uns Deutsche anspruchsvoll sind die unterschiedlichsten britischen Akzente, die die offenbar sehr guten Sprecher, an den Tag legen. Meist konnte ich aber gut erahnen, worüber gerade gesprochen wurde.

Die Musik ist recht passend stimmungsvoll.

Die Steuerung ist sehr einfach. Warum man nun aber kreisförmige Bwegungen machen muss, um bei Text zurückzublättern, ist mir ein Rätsel. Vorwäts kommt man glücklicherweise auch mit einem Mausklick.

Es gibt viele Errungenschaften, die alle automatisch freigeschaltet werden.

Pro & Contra:

+ Aufwendig und schön gestaltete Visual Novel

- Eine (wie ich finde) unglaubwürdige, stereotypenbehaftete, angestaubte Geschichte

Wertung: 4/10

Wenn sie den ganzen Aufwand, den sie offensichtlich betrieben haben, auf die Umsetzung einer (für mich) spannenden Geschichte verwendet hätten, würde ich es empfehlen können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099635971', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1527364122}
review: Prepare to experience the original man-on-the-run thriller in a completely new way. This is a digital adaptation of John Buchan's incredible book (inspiration to Ian Fleming's James Bond!). Be transported back to 1914 London, where Richard Hannay finds himself framed for a murder he didn't commit. Now he must escape the Capital and stay alive long enough to solve the riddle of The Thirty-Nine Steps. There are secrets to be discovered, locations to be explored and - above all - an incredible tale to be told in this ground-breaking interactive novel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044687300', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1527157928}
review:
[h1]"I returned from the City on that May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. I had been three months in the Old Contry, and was fed up with it."[/h1]

The 39 Steps — это текстовая игра, с элементами поиска предметов, даже, мы должны брать вещи и рассматривать их. 
Основой для игры послужил роман Джона Бакена, который он написал в 1915-м году. Позже, этот роман был экранизирован Альфредом Хичкоком, известным режиссером той эпохи.
Сюжет рассказывает нам историю канадца Ричарда Хэнни, который приезжает в Англию и знакомится с девушкой, которая представляется, как Аннабелль. Хэнни становится "козлом отпущения", ведь на него скидывают убийство Аннабелль, которая оказывается секретным агентом. От нее, Хэнни узнает секрет "39 ступеней" и начинает своё путешествие по Британии. 
Если говорить про игру, то она очень хороша. В игре очень красивая и атмосферная графика, и прекрасная музыка той эпохи, напоминает трилогию BioShock (для меня все старые композиции - ностальгия по Биошок).
Рекомендовать я игру буду, но только тем, кто не прочь посидеть вечерком и почитать шпионский роман. На момент написания обзора, цена на игру составляет 29 рублей, действует скидка в 90%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369097470', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1561681508}
review:
I was so wrong about this "game". At first, i played a little, for like, 13 minutes and closed it because i got bored. Never played it again. Until a few days ago, when i was really bored, and i wanted something different. I tried this one, and oh boy, i was so wrong about it. After [spoiler]Scubber's death[/spoiler], i was really interested in the story. 
The voice acting is so good. Better than some actual AAA games. The atmosphere, the characters, everything in this game is unique. Something that i have never played, or better said, experinced before. 
I usually don't judge a book by it's cover, but with this one i did, and i quite regret that. 
The game is pretty short, it tool me 6 hours because i read everything in the game. Every dialog, card, or award. It's very interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981907008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1524925441}
review: Great visual novel based on a book from the beginning of the previous century. Nice visual style that makes the most of a limited budget, invigorating soundtrack that gets especially exciting during the "action" set pieces and some of the best voice acting I have ever heard in an indie game. It doesn't have any replay value after you finish it in about 3 - 4 hours. But I would say for 10 bucks, which is the prize of a movie ticket, it is definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994513212', 'num_games_owned': 1969, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1523271794}
review:
[b]PL[/b]
The 39 Steps to warta polecenia dobra gra przygodowa, na podstawie filmu oraz książki o tym samym tytule. Historia w niej jest ciekawe opowiedziana, trzyma w napięciu, jednak to ten rodzaj gier, gdzie dużo się czyta. W grze głównie widzimy malownicze obrazy, ładne grafiki, jednak zdarzają się jej nieraz błędy, choć działa bardzo płynnie, sama dostosowuje się do ekranu. Wersja oryginalna jest w języku angielskim, więc bez znajomości tegoż nie ma co podchodzić, chyba, że w końcu zostanie przetłumaczona. 

[b]EN[/b]
The 39 Steps is a good adventure game worth recommending, based on a movie and book with same title. The story is interestingly told, it keeps you in suspense, however, this is the kind of games where you read a lot. In the game, we see well painted images, nice graphics, but sometimes some mistakes occur, although it runs very smoothly, setting to your screen resolution by itself. The original version is in English, so without knowing it well, there is nothing to try, unless it will get translated into other languages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821821724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1524353633}
review: 感觉就是看故事的一个游戏啊。。看攻略，大部分成就就是看完整个游戏？故事背景是英国，所以画面和对白都高大上。。。我看的都是美剧，好多单词都没接触过，阅读起来有一定难度啊。。不过喜欢追英剧的朋友，应该好一些吧。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198112313168', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1523130122}
review: Неожиданный бриллиант, завалявшийся в том месиве ничтожных поделок, которые нам предоставляет KISS Ltd. Превосходная адаптация классического триллера, поданая в виде интерактивной презентации, не оставит равнодушными ценителей хорошей истории. Точно переданная в малейших деталях атмосфера начала XX века с головой погрузит читателя в эпоху старой Англии и широких просторов Шотландии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144204776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1522946333}
review: If you enjoy interactive, visual novels and pre-WWI espionage, then this game is for you. The story is based on the 1915 adventure novel The Thirty-Nine Steps by John Buchan. The game consists of a lot of storytelling and very little interaction other than clicking to continue. The entire game should take roughly 3-4 hours to complete, with that being said, I personally do not feel that the current $14.99 price tag is appropriate. I obtained the game through a bundle and would have to say that $4.99 would be a more reasonable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022266051', 'num_games_owned': 3243, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1521086710}
review:
[h1]What a great interactive story![/h1]

I thought this was really well done.  It's kind of like part audiobook, part point-n-click, and part Ken Burn's PBS documentary.  It's telling a well-written story with voice actors for all the characters and you read just the descriptive narrative lines.  And while the voice actors read to you, the still scene slightly shifts or characters fade in/out.

And while this may sound boring, it's not.  It's a very intriguing story that is presented in a very simplistic, but appealing way.

There's a few scenes where you also (albeit minimally) interact with the scene.  Such as clicking on the location where the character is proceeding, or clicking on various objects in a room to get more background information on items, events, and characters, all to progress the story along.

Several times, other characters tell stories of events and these are presented as (animated) old-timey silent films complete with the ubiquitous flickering light and smudged filmstrip debris.  Very cool.

[h1]I thought the voice actors were great and I certainly enjoyed listening to this [b]4.6 hr story[/b].  I look forward to more stories presented like this!  8 out of 10.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198029220607', 'num_games_owned': 516, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1520711192}
review:
The developers did quite a good job capturing the atmosphere of the occuring events. The mixture of sound and imagery really makes a great experience, even (or especially) for someone who hasn't read the original book.

The player (reader) most of the time experiences Hannay's inner monologue, (which is seldomly more than one sentence at a time which makes it quite an easy read), the pacing is good and the well thought-out usage of visual effects on some sequences adds up to the experience of Hannay's feelings.
The audio work for dialogues and backgrounds really stands out and may certainly match the quality of a well directed radio drama. There's even been decent work put into stereophony for in- and outdoor scenes, which I really appreciate. The voice actors did a swell job giving their characters specific and recognizeable personalities and the accents sounded really convincing to me (as a non-british/scottish speaker).
Some little audio bugs can occur however, the background audio sometimes loops longer than it's supposed to or (very seldomly) cuts out entirely. It's worth mentioning but not too grave - also, a quick reload of the chapter usually fixes the issue.
The painted backgrounds are pretty decent most of the time and they manage to catch the atmosphere of the ongoing scene. They sometimes vary in quality and even art style and the SFX are nothing to ride home about. But again, it's nothing too dramatic. I respect and appreciate the work put into them.

So yes, I can recommend this. I can say that I normally don't read a lot of books but I got enjoyment out of it. So what's your excuse for not having given it a try yet? ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040494331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1520472138}

author: {'steamid': '76561198399613004', 'num_games_owned': 2739, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1520317960}
review:
《三十九级台阶》，这款游戏是根据名著制作的有声电影类游戏，其实这部作品很早以前就已经出过电影了。这款游戏中的鼠标互动很有趣，画面是一种水彩风格，配上音乐后能明显知道这部作品是悬疑类型。就游戏制作来说，已经算作非常不错的了。
这款游戏中的剧情是一条线走下去的，其中有很多的信息在各个互动中，需要玩家手动点击查看，游戏中也有大量的配音，配音的效果相当完美，光听声音就能够非常直观地感受到人物动作、人物心理，每个人物又有着自己的风格，这是很让人眼前一亮的。
鼠标互动的环节属于由演员拍摄的图片，这个互动看似可有可无，但却能不至于玩家仅仅是看剧情而略感无聊。游戏整体的节奏还是稍微缓慢的。
整个游戏的游玩长度并不长，但可以看出由于要压缩原著内容，还是会有一些瑕疵的。若可以的话，我建议喜欢这类的玩家可以去看看书。
这款游戏没有中文语言，也没有补丁，全程是英语，需要英语六级的水平。但即便如此，我仍然推荐这部作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561197998817967', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1518121827}
review:
This is a sort of interctive... presentation. It's based on the novel of same name and apaprently stays true to original. And, well, that's it, there's the story, and then some extra distractions like ocassional QTE. All dialogue is voice-acted, and the environments and details depicted seem very period-apropriate and well-researched.

I really hated it even though I went trough the whole thing, even if I skipped most of stuff by the second half. See... it's like reading a book. A book with pretty pictures and voice-acted dialogue, which can be neat, but also with some unskippable dramatic pauses, QTEs and screen transition animations. See, while this format may have some potential, probably, I really prefer to read at my own pace, and quite many of the interactive or visual aspects distract from it - imagine if you were reading a book and then instead of just flipping the next page you gotta wait a moment for letters to pop up because it's creator really wanted you to take a moment there for extra drama. It's obnoxious! I would have really appreciated if there was an option to make transitions immediate. That would have made this quite a more enjoyable experience for me, seeing I never got a chance to read the original novel so the plot did grip me,

author: {'steamid': '76561198028057114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1517693575}
review:
Great Voice acting and visual assistance to enhance the story. The sequences with mouse movements can sometimes interfere with the immersion into the story when they are too long, but otherwise it was a great digital adaptation of an old story. This was a fun way to bring it to a different medium and the developers should be proud of the work they have done. 

Overall I greatly enjoyed the story and the experience this visual novel provided.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059551616', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1517210036}
review:
Una novela cinética que adapta de forma fiel el libro "Los 39 Escalones" de John Buchan.

Utilizando varios recursos como arte pintado a mano, narración con actores profesionales y material de la época, esta aventura se transforma en una historia que abarca todos los sentidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3442, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1564740067}
review:
The 39 Steps ist ein Visual Novel, allerdings ein anderer Ansatz als die oft im Stil stark japanisch geprägten VNs, das finde ich sehr erfreulich und passt auch natürlich viel besser zur Buchvorlage die hier bearbeitet wurde. Das Buch ist ein Klassiker, dazu brauche ich nichts zu sagen. Schön finde ich die Mühe die man sich hier für die optische Aufbereitung gemacht hat, die Vertonung und diverse kleine Features aus dem klassischen Adventuregenre. So wie hier aufbereitet könnte ich mehr etliche große Bücher vorstellen. Sehr ordentlich gemacht.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPnvrCMu82k

author: {'steamid': '76561198052327864', 'num_games_owned': 3735, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1516602302}
review:
Interaktive lineare Geschichte rund um die mutmaszliche Verschwörung einer Gruppierung die letztenendes zum Attentat auf Franz Ferdinand führte, welcher letztenendes zum 1. Weltkrieg führt.

Das alles vermute ich weil ich es nicht zuende gespielt habe. (dazu gleich mehr)

Zu Allererst möchte ich erwähnen dasz ich das "Spiel" an sich gut finde. Auch wenn die Interaktionsmöglichkeiten nahezu 0 vorhanden sind und man eigentlich nur klickt und liest, finde ich die Story sehr gut und die Musik stimmig. Grafik ist ausreichend. Die Atmosphäre ist toll, auch wenn ich mit dem Lesen manchmal Schwierigkeiten hätte wenn der Text sehr in Dialekt, z.B. schottisch gehalten war. Aber auch das hat seinen Charme.

Ursprünglich ein klares positiv bin ich aber gerade eben sowas von #%&$&, dasz ich ein negativ gebe. 
Warum? Ich hab meinen Rechner neu aufgesetzt und damit Steam neu installiert. Profil weg. Neuanfang.
NoGo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971196740', 'num_games_owned': 1167, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1561830695}

author: {'steamid': '76561198317143023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1642463746}
review:
This is a creatively presented experience, with much charm, innovation, and variety, but it is NOT really a game (... and it is not the famous Hitchcock movie-Alfred took MANY liberties). You follow the original 1914 novel--an old-fashioned but groundbreaking story about spies and conspiracies and evil foreigners, which captures something of the patriotism, nationalism and idealism of the period, for good and ill. 
Looking for mind-bending puzzles, or deep mysteries or impossibly difficult challenges? Forget it. There is also no obscenity or sex, no exciting jujitsu or preposterous gun fights, and very little violence... and yet there is suspense galore, a sense of threatening doom, and a satisfying conclusion. I loved it. 
If you're in a hurry, you are in the wrong place. My advice? Settle back in a good chair with an adult beverage, savor the author's voice, enjoy the story, follow the characters, and enter into the time--and just enjoy the ride. (On sale, this is an almighty good bargain.) Good triumphs over evil in the end!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141281551', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1495194340}

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1152, 'num_reviews': 650, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1526770627}
review: Runs perfect on ubuntu linux. An emersive narriative experience. More than a visual novel, it is a way to jump into the story with sounds, art, and style. You have got to be in the mood for this type of thing, as this is a serious endeavor. There is a board game called Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective, that give you a map, newspaper, phone directory, to suppliment the story. That experience reminds me of this game. If you want to settle into a cup of tea and dig into photographs and newspapers from an England and Scotland of the 1910s, all of which are woven into an interesting narriative, then you will really enjoy this title. Otherwise (and more probably), you will find this terribly dull. I recommend this to people who are looking for an intellectual experience, but don't feel like picking up a book at this moment. On completing this visual novel, the list of credits rolled on for some time, and I knew that I would never grasp exactly how much effort went into creating this software. Between the hand painted scenes, the very excellent voice acting, the high-res photographs, great mouse-driven gestures, and the well placed chapter checkpoints, the story keeps delivering excellent game assets all the way to the finale. Bravo! Bravo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964248449', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1510759801}
review:
Alkuun varoituksen sana: kyseessä ei ole kyllä oikein millään mittapuulla videopeli, vaan käytännössä tämä on interaktiivinen Valitut Palat -tason lyhennelmä e-kirja.

Eli periaatteessa tässä vaan painetaan nappia, jonka jälkeen tulee tekstiä ruutuun, joka luetaan ja sitten taas toistetaan tätä samaa. Kappale kappaleelta edetään kohti loppua. Tarinankerronnan tueksi on lyöty kasaan läjä taustamaisemia, hahmokortteja, pieniä videopätkiä sun muita. Nää on kaikki ihan kivaa bonusta, mutta tekstiä on välillä vaikea erottaa taustasta, joten se päähomma, eli lukeminen on joskus ihan uskomattoman työlästä ja raskasta hommaa.

Pientä Point & Click -henkeä on luotu peliin sillä, että pari kertaa tarinan edetessä tulee vastaan semmoinen ruutu, missä voi tutkia muutamia esineitä ja asioita. Tämän lisäksi pelissä on muutama pieni minipeli. Tämmöisiä ovat muun muassa lukittujen ovien avaamiset. Niissä käytännössä vain piirretään käsketty kuvio, mutta noh, onpahan jotain tekemistäkin heh heh.

Tarina on siis hyvä ja ehkä tää ois ollut parempi ihan full hd e-kirjana, koska noi interaktiiviset osat on vähän niin ja näin, mutta kyllä tää varmasti tarinan puolesta vois sopia aika hyvin vaikkapa junamatkalle tekemiseksi. Tai sitten vaan ostaa kirjan ja lukee suorilta sen kokonaisena.

Osta jos tykkäät kirjoista ja lukemisesta sekä hyvistä tarinoista, älä osta jos haluat pelata seikkailupeliä.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114355236', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1515946764}
review:
When I first bought this game, I thought it was just a graphics novel adapted from the book. I was wrong, it is much more. It is a totally new take on an already marvelous book. In short, it is a pretty straighforward graphics novel mixing lots of different gameplay mechanics to give a somewhat interactive storytelling experience using rich, vibrant, and elaborate scenes that are true to that period in time. On top of that, a wonderful soundtrack and carefully placed sound effects bring the scene to life. IMO, it is not a perfect implementation of the idea and does have its fair share of flaws, but for a first take, it is very good.

On the plus (+) side:
[list]
    [*] Rich and vibrant scenes with enjoyable sound effects to match. Great attention to detail.
    [*] Scenes have a certain depth to them which can be seen when the camera moves as for example the background moves more than something in the foreground such as a window.
    [*] Collectibles exist that give more information on characters and none can be missed as they are automatically acquired by progressing in the story.
    [*] Scenes that should be voiced are voiced and narration, thoughts and actions are not voiced.
[/list]

On the negative (-) side:
[list]
    [*] Nothing much to interact with except mostly pieces of importance. No short wonder upon meaningless interaction with a seemingly background object, such as either a bird that flies away or a flag that flutters when the cursor is put over them.
    [*] I haven't read all the newspapers in detail, but important storywise, I have only seen one typing "error", or more accurately the word 'in' was repeated once right after it was used. (I was hesitating between putting this in + or -) 
    [*] Stopping to read the collectibles (or cards) is a must as soon as they are obtained as they give useful information to understand the characters as well as a photo of them (the characters are not shown during the story at all, only shadows).
    [*] Personally, I think that the narration should have been voiced. So, expect to read a lot and have a love to read to get through this.
    [*]  Again, personally, the real life photos broke immersion for me and I did not particularly like that, and if one thing should be changed, it's those. But then again, purely my opinion.
[/list]

NOTE (absolutely read before starting):
[olist]
    [*] The game introduces a clockwise and anti-clockwise rotation mechanics for progressing in the story, but left and right arrow of the keyboard works fine and is definitely less frustrating.
    [*] The menu can be quite confusing at first but it really is simple, have some patience. Also, do NOT right-click when it introduces the pause feature during the tutorial, it is frustrating especially as you might skip the tutorial. Feel free to experiment with right-click menu as soon as the tutorial ends and the first event (chapter) starts.
    [*] The Extras menu is confusing and is not just a statistics page. At first, I didn't realise that the options on the left side could be clicked on for further details as it does not look that way.
    [*] When an event ends and you are directly taken to the pause menu, just right-click to move on to the following event.
    [*] Easily put bookmarks (save games) by pressing 'A' at any time and in the bookmarks page, a very convenient % shows how much of the Event had been covered when it was created.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035366682', 'num_games_owned': 1088, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1515368812}
review:
Ce n'est pas vraiment un jeu, cela rentre plus dans l'histoire visuelle. Ici pas de gameplay, on branche son cerveau et on lit. Faut pas avoir peur de l'anglais!

Même si la musique du menu principal prend un peu la tête on apprécie énormement les dessins style aquarelle.
Un tiers des passages se fait en audio avec sous-titres (merci pour l'accent du fond de la campagne écossaise) Certains passages (peu) mettront votre anglais à l'épreuve.

L'histoire en elle même est un thriller qui se déroule en Angleterre et en Ecosse assez sympa.
Comptez une vingtaine de "chapitres" durant chacun 5 grosses minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112953754', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1515353760}
review:
This game is an interesting way to consume a novel, though not for everyone. For some might appeal to boring, for others might be two childish, but for me it was just perfect.

It's a combination of a book, radio theater and adventure game. It looks that the team had put a lot of effort into this project, which is meticulously documented. All the details like the hand paintings to the newspaper cuts will throw you back in London 1914.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118075501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1515218759}
review: An excellent interactive kinetic novel of fictional pre-WWI espionage.  The protag becomes involved in preventing the success of a plot by a group of international conspirators to foment war for their financial and political gain.  This adaptation of the famous 1915 John Buchan book follows its story and pacing which differs from the Hitchcock movie with Robert Donat.  The game was a “page-turner” with good background art, excellent voice-acting, and appropriate BGM.  I wish this development team would bring more classic literature to the video game format.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077378264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1514797303}
review:
This program is not a game - it is an interactive story.  From a user perspective the flow is very linear.  You do not make choices, you only control the flow of events by clicking or making mouse gestures to advance the story.  The story is set in the United Kingdom in the months leading up to the first world war.  The main character is Richard Hannay, whom you follow  as he gets caught up trying to thwart an attempt to assassinate a Greek politician in London.  Events take Richard to Scotland and various other locations in the south of England.

I really liked this digital media story and I do recommend it to others.  The artwork for the locations, especially the Scottish countryside was very well done.  The voice acting is excellent.  The music and sound effects are very good.  It takes about four hours to play through the 19 events.  For your time you are awarded with a Steam achievement for each event and one more for completing the entire story.

I give this interactive story 8 out of 10.  I bought it on sale for 2 dollars and it was worth the money for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095859449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1514304091}
review:
A wonderful game adaptation of the classic story. I adore the artwork in this, it's so beautiful and the eery ambience as you play really sets a scene. This is more of a hands on storytelling than a 'game' as such, you never really have to solve anything yourself but you participate in various scenes in various ways.  Narration is well spoken and the voices fit the characters very well.

A great game if you want to just kick back and enjoy a story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184574539', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1664770038}
review:
I love the story (it's an actual book) of 39 steps.
I was really excited to play this game, i can get as far as the first chapter. and to get past the words you have to move your mousein a circle motion. but this does not always work. i have played this game for a very small timebut i can not advance the game settings make no sence to me.
for most of the time i have played this game i started and restarted the game from the begging. using the right click for pause and not stating that it is also a menu button through me off.
so you click pause it does not pause the game and state itsapused it goes straight to menu where i kept restarting my game.
after a few attempts at this game i have given up on it.
i might try this again in a few weeks. months or when ever and revisit this review but for now i am not interested.
dissapointed as i have ALOT of point and click games and the one i really liked the story of i cant even get into the game due to trying to rember that my right click is pause and i need to click again to click again to unpause and not go back to the first square and resetting my whole game.
i hope this review helps people. please feelfree to tell me if i am able to change my in game settings because that would help me get further than the starting dialog.



I have revisited this game, and using the help i got from comments below i have found it actually easy to get into, it is simple to navigate and the story follows the book so well. 
i have changed this from unrecomened to recomended as i managed to get further into the game, i have just opened the second chapter.
thank you to PhantomEcho327 for your much needed help.
i am happy to say that i left my orignal review as other people might have the same troubles which i fell in with :)
I also found the way to unlock your first door kind of fun, the movements mimick what you have to do with the door in real life, you can now also get a full picture of what the characters look like, i have never seen an image of this book so this was nice to see how you imagin the and how the game has shown them.
you also get text in clear text rather than trying to read joined upwriting on the letters

author: {'steamid': '76561198134259834', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 924, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1512827925}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061442237', 'num_games_owned': 2376, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1510212180}
review:
[h1] Шпионская предыстория [spoiler] Первой мировой войны[/spoiler] [/h1] 

Игра переставляет собой визуальную новеллу. Это адаптация одноименной книги Джона Бакена. Книгу я не читал, о писателе до игры я не знал. Книга была написана в далёком 1915 году, так что претензии к сюжету не принимаются, более того, она стала первой во многом и соответствовала духу времени. 
Сама же игра имеет ряд положительных сторон:
[list]
	[*]Хорошая рисовка
	[*]Хорошая музыка
	[*]Весёлый мультики 
	[*]Хорошее звуковое оформление 
	[*]Не самая плохая история
[/list] 
А вот минус всего один и только для тех кто не знает английского языка. Даже не просто английского, а шотландского английского и британского английского. Эта история изобилует чисто британскими словами и мне пришлось часть времени провести со словарём, чтобы понять фразы героев и смысл происходящего. Благо игра очень неторопливая. 
Есть карточки и игру очень легко добить до 100%. 
Купил я её по скидке, за полную цену будет дороговато.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027663464', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1600188225}
review:
The Thirty-Nine Steps jest ambitną próbą przeniesienia klasycznej powieści szpiegowskiej szkockiego pisarza – Johna Buchana do współczesnych multimediów. Tytuł wyprodukowany został przez niezależne studio Tern Digital, przy wsparciu ze strony instytucji Creative Scotland.
Źródło: http://www.gry-online.pl/S016.asp?ID=20216

Chyba to wystarczy aby opisać grę hmmm.

Nie dla mnie ale dla fanów powieści szpiegowskich którzy znają w stopniu zaawansowanym j.angielski produkcja obowiązkowa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099592540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1574620698}
review:
The 39 Steps is a nice electronic adaption of John Buchans espionage thriller published in 1915.
The story is told accurately in a attractive mix of changing narratives.
The artwork is very artistic and impressive. Especially the short shadow-playing films are awesome. 
The voices of the speakers are adequate and partly in Scottish dialect (dialects can switched off in the main menu).

All in all more an interactive movie than a game (the action is fixed) it offers very nice entertainment for 5 to 8 hours with very lovingly implemented action. For somebody who likes classic literature themes nice and slowly adapted it is surely an insiders tip.

I hope there will be more of such games in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037882235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1458172379}
review:
A good adaptation of the classic novel – but not a game - so if you are the type of person who wants to skip the text to play the next mini-game you will probably think it is boring - because you will have completely missed the point of it being the story that is interesting.
The original book is an adventure thriller and this version stays faithful to the plot (unlike the film versions) and rather than being overloaded with unnecessary and distracting hidden-object/match-3 puzzle elements it sticks to telling the story with just enough interaction to make it feel like you are turning the pages of the novel instead of just watching a video. 
Because it can be read through in a relatively short time and has little replay value the full price is too high, but when it is in the sale it is worth giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139765784', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1511628103}
review:
一部互动小说。作画精美，语言地道，代入感强，没什么好说的。流程大概也就游戏时间这么多，当然我还是一边翻字典一边贴近屏幕认字的。
缺点：时不时会崩溃，影响游戏体验。不过玩最后几章的时候好歹没崩，保住了一个好评。

不知道互动小说应该以什么价位入手。反正打折时能5RMB入，我觉得还行。

author: {'steamid': '76561198184411897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1511905918}
review: halfway through the game/book so far, i found it to be a really relaxing and fun point and click interactive book turned video game.  the story alone made me want to buy the actual book the game was made from.  the story has comedy and suspence to go along with a very fluid progression with great cut scenes and interactive scenes.  i give this game a 10 out of 10.  check it out if you want to just chill and get caught up into a good story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995282543', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1402853830}
review:
This title has been bundled numerous times and also heavily discounted.  Otherwise I'd likely have never obtained it, and that would be a shame.  It's a very worthwhile telling of a very old tale.  One that I remembered from having viewed one of the numerous film adaptations of the story when I was a little kid.

Here it has been lovingly recreated in a reasonably engaging style of VN form.  Great care was taken in its production quality, and for those of you who are capable of trying to immerse yourself in another time and place I commend this as well worth a buck or two when you get it on sale.

One of my favorite genres of fiction, whether in film, novel or game, is world war.  Not because I love the horrors of war, but because it becomes a refiner's fire out of which the character of men and nations shows forth dramatically and on many levels.  This story falls into such a category and lets you step away from the conflicts of today and examine humanity in a less chaotic framework.

review: Walking in the shoes of Richard Hannay is no easy task. One day sitting in London's gentleman's clubs, dining in finest restaurants, fighting boredom with your hard earned cash. The next thing you know is becoming Scotland yard most wanted, tied in a conspiracy, knowing too much and running for your life. Probably one of the best visual novels I have played. Incredible story by John Buchan and well crafted visuals, music and effects. I recommend and hope to see more book adaptations like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158209674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1508903961}
review:
The 39 Steps é um jogo de Point-and-Click onde você tem o papel de investigar os acontecimentos de uma cidade e conta a história de um turista em Londres, que conhece uma espiã e acaba envolvido em um crime que não cometeu. Inspirado na obra literaria de John Buchan's: The Thirty-Nine Steps. 
O jogo possui uma ótima ambientação e é bastante envolvente, possui uma imersão considerável para o jogador e desfruta de uma boa hitsoria.

Pros: (Creio que citei tudo acima)
+Ótima historia
+Alto nível de imersão
+Trilha sonora e efeitos sonoros condizentes com o que está acontecendo
+Possui uma campanha complexa, porém curta. Isso é bom para não cair no ócio.

Contras:
-Uso exagerado de Cutscenes.
-Gameplay lenta e não muito dinâmica.

Recomendo? Sim, porém não com o valor atual (R$24,99) recomendo que espere entrar em promoção.
*Essa é minha opinião, sinta-se livre para discordar ou concordar*

Nota final: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198056921320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1490940530}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1509381135}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Text clicking game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There are 3 different profile slots available.
There is no options available.
There is subtitles which you could toggle.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

The game may look confusing at start but it's really easy game. You will have the option to read the text and you could click it away for some new text. Sometimes you will have to explore around a bit to find more text, or clues which will probaly give you more text. There is almost no actions. Only Texts.. Walls of text.

Interesting story if you pay attention to it.
There are subtitles if you have turned it on.
The subtitles has been voiced-over.
The game plays on low speed.
You are not able to skip cutscenes or dialogues.
It's pretty boring as you will only sit on your chair.. click, read, click and read.
Has different chapters.
Price tag is too high for what the game has to offer.
Low replay value.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]
Sometimes clicking on "continue story" will reset the story.
This is a game? I thought it was a bad movie.

-------------------

I Give this game a 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038587044', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1455567665}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121856929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1507681283}
review: Very interesting, very well made! I Never thought I could truly enjoy a visual novel on Steam, but this was it. I got it for free on indiegala or humblebundle (dont remember) and did not touch ir for a very long time because I realised its not really a game, but a visual novel and I hated each one I tried before on Steam because all of them were same and the stories were all some silly tumblr teenage love story dreams, but "39 steps" is completely different. It has a very deep, serious plot that goes around right before first world war. Yet its not "heavy" and it feels very easy to go through it Visuals are very pleasing and I loved the voice-over parts a lot. Sounds are amazing too. It reminded me of Agata Kristi books about detective named Puaro that I used to read. I would actually pay for this, so yes, its worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022500858', 'num_games_owned': 1038, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1606576600}
review: Um jogo que não é bem um jogo, imagine que você está lendo um livro, mas além da sua imaginação você tem o apoio de sons e imagens para fazer a sua ambientação no enredo. The 39 steps está mais para uma estória interativa do que para um game, onde quem define o que o narrador vai contar e quando vai contar é você. Necessita de um inglês pelo menos mediano, visto que não possui tradução em PT. O enredo é muito interessante, bem escrito e os sons fazem uma ótima ambientação. Recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977673898', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1507401663}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268115996', 'num_games_owned': 1736, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1507540729}
review:
[spoiler] Внимание! Игра может быть интересна, только для тех, кто чисто или выше среднего, говорит и понимает английский язык. Не портите им праздник, бессмысленными обзорами, как "спасибо за карточки" или тому подобное. [/spoiler]
The 39 Steps - это игра в стиле визуальной и логической новелы, методами исследований и расследований местности, помещений, только на английском языке. Полностью её играть рекомендую, только тем, кто чисто чешет по-английски. Сам стиль игры от первого лица и прохождение идет, показами нам графических объектов, в виде кадров. Полностью я её не играл, считаю это, бессмысленно с моим познанием английского языка.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274950775', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1505898590}
review:
"The 39 steps" tiene un título y logo sugerente, y además lleva la etiqueta "aventura", que eso hace que alguna glándula de mi cuerpo empiece a segregar sustancias aún no descubiertas por la ciencia. El caso es que me encontré con un libro que ni siquiera es interactivo. Sencillamente vas avanzando clic a clic. Nada de opciones. Un libro de "Elige tu propia aventura" es más interactivo que esto. Es el peligro de los bundles, que casi sin pensar añades un cargamento a tu biblioteca sin saber muy bien qué estás almacenando. En cuanto al argumento pues es rollo espías a comienzos del siglo XX. Un título que si no hubiera existido jamás, lo único que habría conseguido es ahorrarme unas horas.

PD: Me ha hecho gracia ver que uno de mis amigos también lo tiene y ha jugado, exactamente 0.1 horas. Vamos, el tiempo justo de abrirlo, ver el percal y cerrarlo.

¿Un libro? ¿De verdad? A ver, salvo alguna chorrada, es así: sale un párrafo o frase, lo lees, coges el diccionario porque tu inglés no es tan bueno como esperabas, haces clic y aparece el siguiente párrafo o frase. ¿Divertido? No, ¿verdad?
Quizá el libro no esté mal del todo... Yo valoro juegos, y como juego, esto es una xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx (tranquilo Steam, ya me censuro yo).

review:
An atmospheric visual novel with a terrific presentation: the hand-drawn visuals, the music, and the sound effects/voice acting are all fantastic, lending to the establishment of the mood of the story.

That being said, the actual book it's based on is pretty poorly written and this is reflected within this VN. While I did enjoy it to a certain extent, I felt a better novel choice would have made the material soar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165474826', 'num_games_owned': 2321, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1505103112}
review:
The 39 Steps

The 39 Steps is a beautiful visual novel, with very subtle game play elements. It is based off a paper back novel so needless to say it has a great story. I started playing The 39 steps for something to relax with. A bedtime story that I would read my self. By the second chapter I realized I would not be going to bed until I finished this story.  

Talk about amazing screen shots, the 39 Steps provides them. Page after page of jaw dropping visual stills, newspaper clipping and old timely photos will keep your eyes entertained. The presentation of the story its self intrigues me, you have the option to be as involved or not in the actual interpretation of the story as you want. Some parts are voice acted others fade onto the screen in the form of text and lastly you can dig around for newspaper clipping and note pads that contain even more information. It is up to you if you read any of it, listen to the story, or just aimlessly click through.

That being said there is some game play mechanics, like moving your mouse in circles to open doors, or up and down to search a box. Most your thoughts will go into reading and listening. It is not a CSGO  trainer that is for sure. 

 I have not previously read this story, as I mentioned above I intended to put my self to sleep with The 39 Steps. Well here we are 2hours and some coffee breaks later, writing a review because it was that great. I  shame my self for not having read it before, and deep down makes me ask, what is it about video games that keep me entertained for hours while the thought of reading a short 300 page novel makes me dread life? As another user mentioned in there review, there should be more books converted into “games” like this. 

I know this one is not for everyone, but for those of you who like to read, like history or epic screen shots I recommend this one for you. 

P.S I got this in haste thinking it was The Running Man by Richard Bachman a.k.a Stephen King. It seems I mixed the characters name and the authors to read Richard Bachman.  The 39 Steps is just as good. I am still happy with the purchase. FYI this is not the Running Man.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997887116', 'num_games_owned': 1938, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1493041568}
review:
Крайне удачная адаптация книги Джона Бакена, послужившей в свое время вдохновением для создания персонажа Джеймса Бонда, а так же экранизированная Хичкоком.

Хочу сказать, что если бы все «визуальные новеллы» были исполнены в подобном духе, то только выиграли бы. Поясню: звуковое и визуальное оформление — весьма качественное, но лишь дополнение к очень сильному тексту. В других жанрах зачем-то делается сильный акцент на прорисовку персонажей и детализацию фона. Здесь этого нет. Сама история затягивает и держит в напряжении до последних минут. Прочла на одном дыхании за несколько часов и спустя долгое время частенько вспоминаю эту книгу и ее уникальную атмосферу.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002184679', 'num_games_owned': 3159, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1503606359}
review:
I'm still struggling to see what the point of The 39 Steps is.

This is not a game, it's a "Visual Novel" which translates into "reading and clicking to advance the story"

And there is the "busy work" added to make the whole thing feel more like a game. Open a door by dragging the mouse around the screen in patterns. WHY? 

Enter a room you get the option of looking around and clicking on items, or maybe choosing topics on which to think about. Yeah, you COULD do that, but again WHY? It serves no real purpose, again it just prolongs the experience. You can just as easily ignore that and click "DONE" to advance the story. 

If you have an interest in The 39 Steps story, read the book, listen to the audiobook or watch one of the many movie adaptations. If you want to play a video game, play one, but not this.... It has great voice acting and music, but ultimately it just seems so.... pointless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081501738', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1503095898}
review: An excellent story with superb atmospheric music. It reminds me of the story games from my childhood, only it's not aimed at children, thus does not contain the requisite minigames for such an audience. I appreciate the attention to detail, the well researched effort, the charming silent film segments, and united thematic artwork. A well executed idea from start to finish. The only blemish would be the desired mechanic of circling the mouse to move forward - well meaning I'm sure, but definitely more for a mouse pad on a laptop or a touch screen than for a hand held mouse. Fortunately, the work around is an intuitive left click.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027409026', 'num_games_owned': 850, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1602529195}

This is a visual novel. If you don't like reading novels or things like that, don't even try.

However this visual novel has a fantastic atmosphere, and is a great retelling of a classic thriller novel. In particular, I give great praise to the sound atmosphere, the writing/adaptation and the historical immersion.

Heartily recommended for literature enthusiasts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102761464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1558159544}
review:
This is a lovely little gem of a visual novel that takes a classic spy novel and transports it to a modern platform that hopefully helps keep it on the radar of the latest generations.

This is a breath of fresh air in the visual novel genre that is abit too saturated by anime offerings. Dont get me wrong plenty of good ones but few really rise to more then copy and pasted back grounds and  paper doll characters that all look mostly alike right down to poses.

This one does some different things. You dont really ever see your character. They mix it up with narration, dialogue and reading bits yourself. As well as a few fun little cut scenes that all add to the atmosphere imo.

Some of the backgrounds and sound effects are so enjoyable Ive been on more then one occassion happy to leave the game on one while doing other things just to enjoy the art and soothing sounds.

I really cant see any cons unless you just dont like classic turn of the century writing in general or spy plots where the main character isnt some super unbeatable spy type.

Wait for a nice steam sale if your on the fence and get it on the cheap, Well worth it for a few bucks. Maybe not at full price but I never buy VN at more then a few bucks a pop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097525937', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1450471373}
review: 동명의 소설을 원작으로 하는 게임인데 요즘 자주 보이는 몇몇 어드벤처 게임들 처럼 게임으로써의 매력이 떨어진다는게 단점인거 같네요.한글 패치가 없기 때문에 플레이를 하면서 스토리를 명확히 이해하는데 다소 어려움이 있을지도 모릅니다. 전반적인 분위기와 원작을 게임으로 표현하고자 한 점은 높이 사지만 추천하고 싶은 게임은 아닌거 같네요. 개인적으로 소설을 읽고 재미를 느꼈다면 게임을 한번쯤 접해 보는것도 나쁘진 않아 보입니다. 영화와 소설에 비하면 게임은 좀 약하단 생각이 들긴 하지만 한편으론 게임으로 인해 반대로 다른 장르로 39계단을 즐기고 싶단 호기심을 들게 할 수 있다는 점이 장점인거 같네요.
