author: {'steamid': '76561197999858314', 'num_games_owned': 2397, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1501737842}
review:
There are not many games that are set in the eve of WW1, this game is one of those.
The story is set in 1914, at England, at the eve of WW1 where the main protagonist, Richard Hannay, has gotten himself involved in a plot to start a war between Germany and Russia.
The story itself very intriguing and the artwork is beautiful...but this game is a missed opportunity.
The game could be more: it could use more animation, free movement to explore the different locations, read more interesting texts from the era, interact with items that where unique to the time and get more info about them (interesting trivia, who invented them and what were they commonly used for).
The game lacks player interaction with the world and what it is in the end is just a regular book with pretty pictures that could have been on a PDF file.
I get it that they wanted to tell just the story but you could also add some more freedom to the player, more interactivity with the world like another game called The Last Express did.
This game is unique since not many games cover the colonial/pre-WW1 era and I would still recommend this game for the story but not at 15$, it's just too much,  maybe if it was 2$ or lower then I would say get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5444, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1465374957}
review:
The 39 steps is more like a story telling novell than a game. It let you decide about the flow of the story a few times. The story isnt bad, but it dont worth 9.99 i think, if its on sale then yes, worth the 4-5hours entertainment.

Its hard to review a novell without spoilers, but lets see what i can tell about it:
Our hero is framed for a murder so he need escape and solve the case to prove his innocence. The story involve murder, drama, treachery! All these mixed with suitable music, realistic sound effects, decent voice acting and nice artwork.

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill write some infos about achievements aswell:
This game got 20 unlockable steam achievements. Except one awarded for the story, for visitinng alternate story lines but as you can choise story "steps" its not hard to get the missed ones. You also need watch credits at the end of the game to unlock extra scene for the last achievement.

ACHIEVEMENTS WORKS ONLY ON WINDOWS VERSION!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054259138', 'num_games_owned': 1193, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1502276849}
review: First off this is a visual novel with minimal interaction, which may not be for everybody, but I enjoyed it. I loved the envirnoments and the voice acting was great. The plot was also interesting, but it was a bit slow at the beginning. If enjoy visual novels, I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046170939', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1501630866}
review:
Nietypowa gra przygodowa, choć rzeczywiście bardziej pasuje tu określenie forsowane przez jej twórców, czyli "cyfrowa adaptacja" książki Johna Buchana.
W grze tej nie znajdziemy interfejsu znanego z typowych przygodówek Sierry czy Lucasarts, nie ma łamigłówek, przy rozwiązywaniu których można poczuć frustrację lub satysfakcję - po prostu kilkając (czy też kręcąc myszką) przechodzimy przez kolejne rozdziały tej "książki". Historia w niej przedstawiona jest ciekawa, choć z racji ograniczeń gry - pewnie dość okrojona względem oryginału. Mimo to chce się wiedzieć jak się dalej potoczą losy bohatera i z czym przyjdzie mu się mierzyć.
Technicznie gra jest wykonana z dużą starannością, lokacje cieszą oko, są zgrabnie wykonane, zwłaszcza kwestie mówione są dobrze dopracowane. Na plus można tu wymienić to, iż w grze mamy okazję posłuchać kilku różnych akcentów i dialektów angielskiego.

Czy gra jest warta polecenia? Według mnie raczej tak, aczkolwiek trzeba mieć na uwadze fakt, iż nie będziemy chcieli pewnie do niej wracać po raz drugi. I jeśli ją kupować to raczej po obniżonej cenie.

PLUSY:
+ ciekawa fabuła, skłania do poznania książkowego oryginału
+ starannie wykonana (żadnych zawiech podczas gry)
+ dobre udźwiękowienie
+ ładnie narysowane lokacje
+ artykuły prasowe w grze sprawiają wrażenie autentycznych odpowiadających tamtemu okresowi

MINUSY
- nieco krótka, ale za tę cenę raczej nie ma co narzekać chyba
- ze względu na jedyny możliwy przebieg historii raczej nie będzie się do niej wracać (czyli replayability - 0 pkt)

author: {'steamid': '76561198255408767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1490830744}
review: One of the few games out there in the espionage genre. It 's very linear, lacks more "decision taking" - maybe to avoid straying from the original book - but anyway, it's really nice to play a game with a nice story and in a rich genre that's rarely explored in games.

review: A game which resembles more a book than an actual game. As so, it is very well written. The voice acting is quite good, and the attention to detail extreme. I adored the maps of imperial Great Britain and very much enjoyed reading the mock newspapers which had me convinced that the information they yielded was fact for the day. With all this said however, I would not value this game at any more than $5. Overall, a solid 8/10. Very well made for an indie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353366202', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1499712332}
review:

К сожалению из-за не знания английского языка в полной мере я не смог оценить сюжет сего инди. Если вы владете языком, то здеь он очень пригодится. Проэкт представляет собой фильм с приятной музыкой, нежели игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041847294', 'num_games_owned': 999, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1558750869}
review:
[h1]Would have rather read a book… oh wait[/h1]
The only thing I enjoyed about this visual novel was the free 100% achievements and trading cards I could sell. 
I did not feel a sense of thrill or immersion in the story. 
I did not like the time or location setting, the only parts that were somewhat interesting to me was when they were talking about a war between themselves and Germany before it had happened and if it was possible. 
The story just felt so dry and the whole middle of the game was just him running through the country side and going from house to house, all the interactions seemed copy pasted and the bad guys had UAV or something because they always seemed to know where you were which makes no sense because you need 3 kills to get UAV unless you run hardline and even then we were only shown 1 kill so I don't get it. 

The visual novel itself felt so inconsistent. 
Switching between audio voice overs and text you have to click through to progress.
No video, only image switching. 
Random parts which allow you to search through things for no point other than lore maybe? Like newspapers.
Pointless mini games for opening doors and windows and doing some tasks by drawing lines on the screen. 

Can't see its a "bad" game or novel or whatever its meant to be but I think its meant to be aimed at people who are still into books and crime/ thriller/ non-fiction stories. 

[h1]2.5/10[/h1] 
[i]- Not for me but I appreciate the free achievements & cards[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198108770161', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1507584182}
review:
This game was unexpectedly good. It's a sort of visual novel (not a japanese-style one) with some interaction in it and few collectibles (awards).
I didn't read the original novel, but the plot has all the ingredients of a classic of this genre.

The art and sound suit the narration and the scenery isn't just a background but something where the camera can move to highlight.

I would suggest to include more interaction with the player in future games, in example, instead of those useless "events", where you have to draw shapes with the mouse to open a door, i think some quick-time events would've suit better sequences of the story, like the runaway ones. Also, as the plot pivots all around the decoding of a journal, some of the enigmas could've been left to the player to solve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310619271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1499325508}
review:
买了这个游戏蛮久的。之前一直忙都没有玩。
没想到打开之后是这样一个视觉互动小说。小说的原著据说还非常出名。于是查了一下，距离我们现在还是有点历史了，但作为一部小说而言，情节跌宕起伏，是非常合格的。平凡的人在无聊的日子里闷久了，总是想搞个大新闻，于是，大新闻就来了。
为了玩这个游戏，请随时准备好词典。这个游戏中出现了很多原汁原味的用词用语，有一些甚至可能有点古老？（因为好像我不太常见到，哈，虽然我也没有多厉害地完全了解了现在的英语用语，只是猜想）你让我老老实实读一本英语小说我可能挺累的，又可能嫌麻烦，就不会读下去，然而这个游戏的音乐，场景（好多幅绘画我都很喜欢！），配音，氛围渲染都是超级棒的（那个黑白录像机播放的有噪点的剪纸动画真的超级棒！堪称艺术品！）！你可以享受到一个不一样的，不会太难读的英文小说！
从操作来说，基本上就是鼠标点点点，有时候有一点小小的互动，如果看中游戏性的话有的人可能会失望了，但是对于那种闲暇时光，想读读英文小说，又不想太无聊的人，真的是无比合适。对来学英语说的人也很合适吧哈哈哈。

I went back to try to get the rest of the achievements, but no matter what I do, I can't get 5 of them to work. I don't know where the problem lies, but it's really silly to have any issues in a "game" like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241002334', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1490562641}
review:
Nicely done hand drawn pictures, particularly of the Scottish countryside. But what surprised me was the quantity and quality of the sound effects with each picture, good voice acting and music. A trailer would have been nice to show this off. 

I played 10 hours the first time through, not rushing, reading everything including many of the newspaper articles. Also you can play it in short intervals and always get good entertainment. The story was good, based on a book, a classic man on the run with some complexity. Like others, I am sorry the developer no longer exists, I would've like to see more. It was well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375029180', 'num_games_owned': 1492, 'num_reviews': 919, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1497052327}
review: Essa obra é literalmente um livro em forma de jogo, sei disso pois após terminá-lo fui olhar um resumo na wiki e em 1915 um livro com o mesmo nome e exatamente a mesma história foi publicado no Reino Unido... e sinceramente amei toda a trama, que parte de um misterioso assassinato de um espião para um enredo muito mais profundo que acaba englobando até mesmo a Primeira Guerra Mundial... fora isso, sobre o jogo em si, é uma narrativa cheia de lindas ilustrações como background para cada partícula do drama e contém alguns diálogos com vozes dignas de um filme, pois vcê sente o realismo das conversas e os sentimentos de cada personagem pela fala... superou minhas expectativas, impossível não recomendar...

author: {'steamid': '76561198154910289', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1496586557}

author: {'steamid': '76561198246965134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1507276241}
review:
I love The 39 Steps! One of the most best things I've played in a really long time. A fair warning for y'all looking for "choices matter" games, this isn't it. The 39 Steps is more of an interactive novel than an actual game, but it's nevertheless entertaining. It has incredible soundtrack and voice-acting, the art is, as well, brilliant.

The only con I can think of is the fact that the in-game achievements aren't appearing on Steam even after completing a playthrough. It's rather frustrating, but otherwise there really isn't anything unfavorable about The 39 Steps.  Like any great novel that's worth re-reading, The 39 Steps is an interactive novel worth replaying.

I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys more fun, interesting ways of reading. (And, if anyone's looking for the most story-faithful adaptation of Buchan's The Thirty-Nine Steps, my friend, this is the game for you.  You will not regret playing it.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030905002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1681472910}
review:
This is not a game - just an [b]interactive book[/b]. All of the acrions are set - no decisions are needed; nor are there any puzzles to solve.

For a senior citizen, the mechanics are good:
[list]
[*] Fonts are clear and readable
[*] There is enough slackness in the controls for impaired hands
[*] There is no need to rush things as there are no timers involved
[/list]

The gore and violence is somewhat muted. This would, perhaps, deter some younger players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145416535', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1496014417}
review:
This was on a 90% sale recently and I decided to give it a try; I wasn't disappointed!

It is a visual novel with minimal interactive moments, but with rather pleasant music and realistic sound effects. Also an interesting story, [spoiler]an adaptation of the adventure novel written by the Scottish author John Buchan in 1915,[/spoiler] great dialogues and voice acting.

Apart from the 20 achievements, there are cards and awards within the game, which explain parts of the narrative and can be gathered by paying attention to all the details [spoiler]e.g. at the initial crime scene.[/spoiler] 

Overall, it was a quite good 4-hour experience and I enjoyed it thoroughly.
I recommend it, especially if it is discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970814274', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1495988616}

author: {'steamid': '76561198159841686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1492048663}
review: Incredibly boring if you are not into early 1900 England or Bond-type of movies. I must have got this in a bundle because it sounded awesome... the title makes it sound like an actual game, which it's not. Also did not expect it to be so "old high society English men" but then I only went through the first 20 minutes or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044052305', 'num_games_owned': 464, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1422025879}
review:
The 39 Steps é um jogo do tipo livro interativo (não sei se esse é nome correto) que te leva a desvendar um caso. A primeira impressão é que é um jogo que não garante muita diversão, mas com o tempo jogando vai ver que a estória é envolvente. Se você não sabe nada de inglês não recomendo pois a tradução é algo dificil de se encontrar e você vai se frustrar com uma certa facilidade pois a maioria dos Puzzle dependem da interpretação do texto, se você sabe alguma coisa é bom para treinar e se você já é fluente vai valer a pena e ficará fácil.

Recomendo

NOTA 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999046040', 'num_games_owned': 1225, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1492622521}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1561, 'num_reviews': 845, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1492439399}
review:
Ever wondered what it would feel like if you read a novel with accompanying artwork, plus, each conversation was acted out by voice actors? This is what "The 39 Steps" feels like - the so-called "digital adaptation" of a Scottish novel by the same name. 

The "game" shows us texts telling us the story of Richard Hannay. One picture follows another one; when watching these we hear the corresponding sound effects: horse carriages moving in front of Richard's house or the sound of a stream just under the bridge where he's having a conversation with a stranger. This is an interesting genre - I do not know what to make of it but 39 Steps was a good example to give it a try for the first time.

The plot revolves around an expatriate who returns to London and meets a strange fellow who starts babbling about a plan to assassinate the prime minister of Greece. Apparently, getting rid of this person can result in such a chaos that may bring World War I forward (historically, we are just before when the actual war broke out, in the spring of 1914). Richard takes in Scudder who is later found dead in his room. This comes as a surprise as Scudder explained it to Richard in detail how he actually arranged his death a while ago so that nobody would come looking for him (since he already knew too much of this plan to create anarchy).

So, Richard is on the run and while doing so he meets quite some people and uses a couple of aliases in order to hide. As mentioned, you essentially read texts to follow his story - these do not appear all at once but as you move your mouse clockwise you receive your next batch of sentences on the screen. As you complete certain sections (the game calls these events) you earn achievements; this is an easy way to get 100% since you just need to complete the game. 

Occasionally, Richard finds himself in a room that he can investigate. This simply means that some objects are highlighted and once clicking on them the corresponding (explanatory) text appears. Diamond symbols in the lower-right or -left corner of the screen indicate how many items we can find and interact with. I do not know if they are a must for the achievement but since you rarely get more than 3 or 4 it is really easy to find everything.

If I remember correctly there are 19 chapters altogether and bookmarking any section within a chapter is possible so that you can pick up right where you left it off. There's some great voice acting done here and also I liked the accompanying music. The story was also interesting - mainly because I was eager to find out what exactly the 39 steps meant. 

Like I said this is an interesting genre to pick - some might say it's best to just pick up a book and read it. Since I like the concept and the execution (casual gameplay and simplistic, but great looking menus and beautiful artwork) I give this one a thumbs-up. Unfortunately, upon checking if there were more from this developer I did not find any but this novel was already released 4 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135311697', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1490414217}
review:
+画面光感处理很好
+全对话语音比较舒服
+气氛营造不错
+op（职员表）设计美感惊艳

-顺时针、逆时针的操作处理导致文本阅读的节奏拖沓
-文字间太长的过渡动画和特效导致阅读不流畅
-主界面的美工略显粗糙
-唯一的QTE要素在于一些动作处理，但是美工依然不舒服。略像impossible draw，但是荧光特效有些廉价。而开门需要进行3-4个QTE，有点多余
-与物体互动设计的不是很科学，甚至无法旋转查看物体，且放大物体时有锯齿感

总的而言，作为视觉小说它无疑是合格的。但作为一款游戏不值得推荐，互动设计略显多余，值得进一步推敲。

author: {'steamid': '76561198152240484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1456220598}
review:
동명의 원작 소설을 비주얼 노벨화한  작품 .
플레이어는 그냥 나오는 텍스트를 읽고
선택지도 없이 정해진 루트를 가기만 하면 된다.
이런 수동적인 진행이 따분하긴 하지만
진행만하면 거저 생기는 20개의 도전과제와
책을 싫어하는 사람들에게 조금이나마
접하기 쉽게 게임화 시켰다는거에
의미를 두고싶다 .
도과쟁이들에겐 필구 품목이다.

6 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081249669', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1489739812}
review:
Attention : ceci n'est pas un jeu mais un roman graphique interatif. 

Alors d'abord :  si vous n'êtes pas anglophone un minimum, vous n'allez rien comprendre. 
Au début je me suis dit : mais c'est QUOI ce truc ? Et puis la magie a opéré : les graphismes sublimes, les voix des acteurs, les accents écossais, et surtout le son, les musiques, tout participe à l'immersion.  Je n'ai pas trouvé l'histoire palpitante, bon c'est assez simple et comme ce n'est pas un jeu , il n'y a rien à résoudre, mais bon, c'est quand même sympa, c'est une belle promenade, voilà. Je me suis régalée. Je le referai un de ces quatres, comme on relit un roman (en testant le gaelique cette fois ). Je recommande, parce que franchement c'est pas commun et quel boulot derrière, l'air de rien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216778473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1489675655}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063256789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1489654771}
review:
Если не приходилось бы изредка подавать признаки жизни, клацая на мышь, я бы уснул, а проснувшись, обнаружил уже  пройденную игру, со всеми открытыми достижениями.

Сюжет мне так же не близок по душе, и все события происходят в 1914 году и нашему персонажу приходится скрываться от ложного обвинения в убийстве, об этом подробнее немного позже.

Читать нам придётся много, полностью на английском языке, попутно просматривая типо красивейшие арты событий, и слушать ну очень качественное звуковое сопровождение, голосов, и фоновых звуков, как например поезда, щебет птиц, реки, голосов на заднем плане и всех всех всех остальных событий, которые были ранее описаны в основной книге Джона Бакена “39 ступеней”.
Так же, нам будут более подробно описывать каждые события, и давать информацию о разных местах, событиях и например о том как выглядели жандармы того времени.

Если не знать на четвёрку,ну или хотя бы на троечку Английский язык, то мы с трудом сможем разобрать по сюжету все основные заметки и догадки о том, как наш главный герой, разгадает замысел подставы, и то кто именно его решил убрать, и в каких целях. И это повлияет частично на мою отрицательную оценку о игре.

Основная часть сюжета расскажет нам весьма доступно и понятно, основную суть и роль главного персонажа и его новых знакомств. Если же совсем будет не понятно, то в руководствах возможно найти Краткое содержание истории.

В игре достойные АРТы, и не менее достойное звуковое сопровождение, но в целом получился своего рода типа фильма состоящего из картинок, где нам рассказчики озвучивают аудиокнигу.
Сказать честно, игру можно было бы разбавить элементами поиска предметов, и хотя бы вставками три в ряд, хотя сама книга о серьёзном, и вряд ли бы это было бы уместно!

Вот почему мне трудно её рекомендовать для большего количества игроков, предпочитающих тока русский язык.

И так, кратко о сюжете, и основная причина Отрицательного мнения:

Ознакомившись ближе, нам повествуют о событиях проходящих до первой мировой войны, кратко говорящих о Европе, народе и о разных событиях разных людей.
Но самым основным остаётся наш Главный Ричард Ханней, который проживал в Лондоне, пока не пришёл неожиданный гость в его дом, и рассказавшем о страшных событиях, а именно об убийстве и предположении того, кто мог это сделать.
И вот в один из моментов, вернувшись домой наш герой видит, что его гость убит с торчащим ножом в сердце. Все подозрения лягут на Ричарда Ханней, и тому приходится бежать через всю центральную Европу в Шотландию. Из всех подсказок об убийстве ему остаётся лишь неизвестная книга с записями, лежавшая в коридоре.  Из неё мы узнаем о Чёрном камне и других членах банды, а остаётся пока лишь бежать.

Вот тут то, как мне показалось, всё самое интересное и закончилось,
путешествия не впечатлили, а второстепенные персонажи, были на столько второстепенными, что не успев с ними познакомится как читателю, приходилось привыкать к новым второстепенным персонажам. И каждому доводилось рассказывать свою трогательную историю о предательстве,обмане, алчности и в конце концов подставе с убийством!

И так до самого почти конца книги, пока мы не встречаем самого лидера Чёрного камня.

Чем всё закончится, и кто подставил нашего героя, и как раскроют преступление, узнавайте сами,
В целом мне было бы приятно играть, если бы это была истории более подобающего для меня писателя,
а не детективное приключение о бегущем через Европу герое. А моё не богатое знание английского, не позволило в полной мере насладиться историей.


В общем, если вы не фанат английского языка, детективный историях с убийствами, и просто не фанат игр без гемплея, то обходите стороной!
Если же наоборот, вас устраивают все эти качества, то добро пожаловать в 1914 год! Вам понравится!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089832243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1424614895}
review:
The application is more of a click through novel than a game. There is just the straight story line. You can not walk around neither shoot nor build anything. Though it has limitations, the novel is not bad. Maybe a bit long-breathed at the beginning, but catches up some speed in the end. Even the replay value is low the story is decorated with nice drawings and voice lines.
I originally bought this game, because I was able to play it on my Linux system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027310663', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1487973403}
review:
This is a visual novel based on a novel published in 1915.  Interaction is mentioned a lot in this game's reviews, but it's minimal even by the standards of other narrative heavy games on Steam.  I didn't feel like I missed out because of that, but a lot of people do.  What you're getting if you do stick with it is a lot of nice art, voice acting that suits the writing style, and a look at a book that's considered a classic among the espionage and thriller genres.  I was impressed more by what the writing suggests was taken for granted by well to do people in the UK at the time and how people apparently spoke than by the story, but the story was still good enough to keep me interested.

It might be a little overpriced at $14.99, since the book itself can be had for less than that, and the game's descriptoin seems to oversell the interative bits, but I still have give it a thumbs up for bringing a classic novel to Steam as well as it did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046546799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1487893990}
review:
If you're interested in the story of The 39 Steps, you might be better off buying the actual book. Just to make things clear, this isn't really a game, but rather a visual novel. Personally I think the story was intriguing and the visuals were nice too. But I finished this 'game' in under 3 hours, so I guess a bunch of details of the original story have been left out in this 'digital adaptation' of the book. 

So, if you're really interested in the story: Get the book. And if you're not really into reading books, but do want to know about The 39 Steps: Get this 'game'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003878190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 833, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1451513213}
review:
-: herná doba, herná náplň, cena, neinteraktivita, len pre dobrých angličtinárov

+: príbeh, atmosféra, audio, hudba, dialógy a dabing, artworky a fotografie, zábava pre fanúšikov žánru alebo kníh, dizajn

Verdikt: Určite si pamätáte hru Dear Esther. Ok, označenie hra je asi prisilné, ale to isté platí o The 39 Steps. Skôr než hru ju možno označiť za interaktívnu knihu. Kto čakal akciu, ten bude sklamaný. Naozaj sa jedná skôr o knihu s krásnym dizajnom, artworkami a dobovými fotografiami. Tematicky je prispôsobená aj audio stránka hry. Dobová hudba a audio efekty príjemne dotvárajú atmosféru jednotlivých častí príbehu. Naopak, čo už nebude pochuti väčšine hráčom, je doslova neinteraktivita danej hry. Až na pár pohybov v podstate len sledujete príbeh po dobu približne štyroch hodín. The 39 Steps si taktiež neužijete, ak nie ste dobrým angličtinárom. Áno, toto interaktívne dielo je určené veľmi špecifickému publiku, čiže jeho prípadnú kúpu, si poriadne premyslite.

65%

author: {'steamid': '76561198130795748', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1496251323}
review: Очень интересная новелла, но конечно без знания английского делать в этой игре нечего. Сюжет отличный, но все же цена за товар завышена.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986302693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1486053581}
review:
Just to be clear this isn't a game; taking that in, its far from perfect, if you plan on clicking 2000 times; dedicate your entire pc b/c switching windows glitches your save point so you have to start all over again. 

if i wasn't so tenacious i would have discovered that if you ever lose your save point when you switch back to the window click the add button and that creates the save point you need to contiune where you left off (tedious and annoying, but works..). 

The most interactive you ever get is drawing mouse gestures to open doors, i was super disappointed not to be able to at least have a mini-game to solve the pocketbook cipher!?!

I don't know where these other reviews came from, but they failed to mention all the bugs and repetitive music, and bland scenes, sometime you don't even know when to click, because it switches from voice actors and back to reading again so frequently.

I'd rather read a 20 page short story and fill the rest in with my own imagination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076356819', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1561557070}
review:
[h1]8.5/10[/h1]

This is quite unexpected. I didn't know anything about this game until not even halfway through. I thought the gameplay was boring and the interactions felt forced and plain. That was until I realized it was actually just a digital adaptation of a famous novel [b](shame on me)[/b].

Gameplay was just about clicking your way through like any other single-route visual novel. The text transitiions was pretty delightful and varied. There was also some [i] quick time events[/i]-like moments, only without time limit (maybe for the sake of variation).

Soundtracks were pretty satisfying, at times enhancing the atmosphere especially the thrill of the last chapter. Still can't get the main OST out of my head though :p

Arts were very pleasant, if not beautiful. What was exceptional was the maker's attention to details. When you inspect a newspaper's page for just one or two canon article, you can see that every single obligatory article stands on its own context. [strike]If only I had time to read them all.[/strike]

All in all, it was a quite an amazing ride. Not an expert myself, but I'll say it was a well made literature digital adoption. 

---

author: {'steamid': '76561198056698823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1485046228}
review:
This is a game that tells a story about spies and conspiracies in England right before the first World War. It is based on a book and it shows since it has a great story and it has a great voice acting to match.
It is more of a book than a game to be honest since it doesnt have puzzles or choices, it instead has optional stuff that you can inspect like newpapers that feel like they are from that time with ads that characteristic from that era. And the way the game shows you someone telling a story is made through a silent movie cutscene which just makes the whole thing feel like  something of that era.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062798061', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1483143166}
review:
I have nothing against narrative-based games and it is cool that James Bond apparently was inspired by the 39 Steps, you can clearly see that. And the voice acting is amazing! The game had its moments.
But the story isn´t thaaat good and all in all it often felt like a history book. Maybe I should  not have rushed through this game like I did [I still read every dialogue] and should have treated it like a book, only reading when I want to and stopping when I feel like it. But the intro, even though very atmospheric, gave me a history-book like feel, so I didn´t have a good start at all and from then on just wanted it to be over...

author: {'steamid': '76561198072901812', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1484428449}
review:
Para empezar no es un juego en sí, es una adaptación de una novela en la que tienes que hacer click para ir leyendo y escuchando la historia, y de vez en cuando, hacer alguna interacción para abrir una puerta, libretas o cosas así... Una vez que sabes esto, la historia está bien, es entretenida y atrapa al lector.

La cinemáticas y transiciones están bien trabajadas, junto con los sonidos de ambiente.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995622909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1484264614}
review:
An excellent game, thouroughly enoyed it. A very well told story of a very influential novel. There isn't too much interactivity in the game but if you like stories and have patience, you will enjoy it. If you like adventure games but get frustrated at puzzles, buy this game.

Beautifully atmospheric, not played a game with such a feeling for a long, long time. This game will have you looking up the prices of cottages in rural Scotland, it's that beautiful.

It is short though, around 4 hours or so but it's time well spent as you would probably just be playing with yourself otherwise.

One sad fact remains though, the developer seems to have gone under - a travesty as I was looking forward to their next project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321411011', 'num_games_owned': 4216, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1484112055}
review: This game is based off of the 1915 novel by John Buchan. The novel is also named "The 39 Steps" and is an intriguing story about espionage, crime, adventure, and action. It is quite a rollercoaster of a story! As someone who has read the original novel, I was very pleased with this game. Also, this isn't really a game, per se. This is an immersive story that relies heavily on text and imagery to draw you into the plot. Thus, if you get bored reading books, then, this definitely won't be up your alley. You cannot change the outcome of the ending, you don't really have choices, and you aren't really playing anything. You are merely (for the most part) reading a lot of text and going along for the ride. However, the artwork in this game is STUNNING. Absolutely stunning. I have rarely ever seen such rich and vibrant artwork in games. Also, the voice acting in this game is superb. It's essentially a visual novel with voice acting, more or less. The voice acting, as I've mentioned, is very well done. The scenes also change often, and, each new scene offers more beautiful art to look at. It was overall an extremely satisfying experience. Book lovers will adore this game. Art lovers will, too. I was captivated with it from start to finish. However, if you are the type who doesn't like to read or gets bored easily with games where there's "not much to do", then, this may not be your cup of tea. It was most certainly my cup of tea, though, and I adored every second of this beautiful game! I only hope that the developers bring more works of classic literature to life. They did a splendid job here and the makers of this game should definitely make more of these literature-based games. 10/10 from me, without a doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045462879', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1484083525}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027392807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1483660598}
review:
Avevo acquistato questo titolo parecchio tempo fa durante gli sconti, ma ancora non l'avevo iniziato. 
Oggi l'ho voluto provare e come gioco merita.
La storia è basata sull'omonimo romanzo di John Buchan.
Un thriller dallo svolgimento molto interessante, accompagnato da un design grafico particolare per un punta e clicca e una colonna sonora davvero azzeccata ed immersiva. 
Il gioco si porta a termine nel giro di poche ore però rappresenta un'adeguata pausa da titoli più frenetici ed impegnativi.

7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004707803', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1483650215}
review: Oj trzeba lubić tego typu gry, trudno mi ocenić fabułę, świat, historię, przywiązanie do szczegółów i wierność oddania początków XX wiecznej Anglii bo po wielu próbach nie przetrwałem nawet 2 godzin. Przyjemna grafika i klimatyczna muzyka - to na plus. Lecz trzon gry polega na: czytaniu 5 linijek, przycisk w prawo i na podświetlone przedmiot, w prawo, tekst, w prawo i tak na zmianę... Okropnie nużące. Nie polecam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002592758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1483417363}
review: Please don't get me wrong, I'm all for interactive narratives, but this feels a lot more like a VERY slow-paced Powerpoint presentation that doesn't even let you skip a slide when you're done reading it. Interactivity goes as far as unnecessarily making you click 4 times in 4 different directions just to turn a door knob (as if that would make it 4 times more interactive I suppose?), so you'll find yourself mindless clicking along until you reach the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121927012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1483401777}
review:
The 39 Steps is an interactive fiction game or experience where you play as Richard Hannay, a regular British citizen in 1914 who was living his normal life till he meets a character by the name Scudder. After being introduced to Scudder at that time, that's when Hannay's life went downhill a few days later when [spoiler] Scudder was found murdered in Hannay's home	[/spoiler]. This caused Hannay to leave Great Britain for the time being to run away and hopefully prove that he's innocent and he did nothing wrong. After all that, he gets caught with a shadowy enemy group who want to kill Hannay to cover the whole murder up. Then Hannay becomes a free-man with the help of some allies but he still must be on alert for the evil shadowy group. 
All in all, I highly recommend this game or interactive fiction experience because it's intense, action-packed, and filled with mysteries/questions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260655724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1490764149}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079584921', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1482981803}
review: No se si pudiera o no recomendarlo. A pesar de que la historia pueda ser interesante, el modo de juego no lo es. En steam una de sus etiquetas es "point and click" y aunque califique en ella tiene muy poca interactividad. Me recuerda más a una mezcla de audio-libro y novela visual, hacer click para pasar el texto, abrir una puerta o una libreta (solo cuando te lo indican) y nada más, disfrutar de la historia. Si uno va a buscar solo la historia como si fuera leer un libro de Conan Doyle, es recomendable. Si lo que se busca es resolver un misterio haciendo realmente cosas (buscar pistas, ir de un lado a otro, etc), estan en el juego equivocado, no lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022425833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1482996880}
review:
Very torn on this one. It's a "digital adaptation" of Buchan's espionage story [i] The 39 Steps, [/i] and it's about as well-made as a visual novel can get. The voice acting is superb (performed by a real theater company, I believe), the gorgeous hand-drawn artwork really makes you feel like you're in pre-WWI Britain, and the overall interface is sleek without betraying the lovingly-rendered throwback aesthetic.

Unfortunately, the story itself is the main thing holding me back from giving this a more enthusiastic thumbs-up. It's essentially an innocent-man-on-the-run thriller, and the middle 3/5ths or so of the game basically have the main character escaping one sticky situation after another, with little in the way of actual plot or character development taking place. Because this is a straightforward novel with no player choice involved, this middle section really dragged for me as chapter after chapter of near-misses began to give me deja vu. The story picks up some momentum towards the end as the main plot finally begins to unfold (there's a global conpsiracy involved, which is always fun), but don't expect much in the way of action or suspense; the climax felt appropriately genteel for this most old-timey of British thrillers. (The original novel was written in 1915, so what do you expect).

With those caveats, I do recommend this game to visual novel fans, both for its production value and because the story does ultimately maintain some interest even during its repetitive middle chapters. 

[i] P.S.: [/i] This was the first project of a development team called The Story Mechanics, and it looks like their intention was to produce "digital adaptations" (their term) of various literary works, beginning with this one. I went looking for them online and was sorry to see that they appear to be defunct, which is really a shame given the amount of skill and obvious enthusiasm they brought into making this game. Hopefully they'll return in another form?

[i] P.P.S.: [/i] I've never actually read the novel this is based on, but I have seen the Alfred Hitchcock movie version, which is fantastic and you should definitely watch it regardless of whether you get this game. (Though I was confused why the main character in this game didn't have a woman handcuffed to him while he was on the run... only to realize that Hitch probably threw that in there just to spice things up. Not a bad call, really)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035757748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1482939195}
review:
A fantastic tale of espionage and skullduggery wonderfully put together in a digital format. I have never been a fan of visual novels but this i enjoyed immensely. It has taken the original book and given it a new lease of life in the digital age. The artwork is superb. Acting throughout is very well done. If you've read the original tale, it'll want to make you re-read it, if you haven't, i'm fairly confident that you will be picking a copy up from the local bookshop. 

Great Tale, Great Fun.

9\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198215172371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1482933101}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024124740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1467144809}
review: There is so much potential in The 39 Steps! As a game it is absolutely horrible. This is a piece of interactive fiction in the vaguest sense of "interactive". That being said, the story is very good and the voice acting is great. If this could be branched into a true game with branching choices then it would be even better. Still, compared to some of the interactive fiction out there The 39 Steps is among the best. All that said, get it on discount. Do not pay full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198181887919', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1481089342}
review:
这本小说很吼看，只是：

的确适合老年人玩耍，没有充满乐趣的成就系统鞭策你创新或者琢磨小说的多变玩法，说到底就只剩下翻书页的沙沙无聊了（残念的文本量(΄✹ਊ✹‵)），况且一帧帧的画面还会不时晃动，眩晕体验好厉害啊（笑~

author: {'steamid': '76561198271159831', 'num_games_owned': 3081, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1480917122}
review: This is very good for what it is - a digital adaption of a novel. It took a little while to get going but once it did, it delivered on its promise. I very much enjoyed this and can happily recommend it to others. Though if you're looking for a game - you won't find it here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1480438170}
review:
Comprendo il disappunto di alcuni utenti. Essendo su Steam ci si aspetta un videogioco. Ma questa opera videogioco non è. e non come i giochi narrativi in RPG Maker o l'esperienza alla Chinese Room, questo proprio non ha nulla a che fare con un videogioco. Si tratta infatti di un vero e proprio romanzo illustrato. Anzi, oserei definirlo romanzo multimediale. Mi ricorda gli esperimenti degli anni 70 con i libri con le figure e la narrazione su vinile. Mi ha un poco riportato indietro nel tempo. Io reputo questo tipo di prodotti interessanti perché sostengono la lettura, gli danno una dimensione in piu senza perdere il gusto del leggere. Con illustrazioni su molti livelli di buona fattura e un soun design incredibilmente di qualità, questa storia si porta via in non tantissimo tempo. Per i non abituati alla lettura in inglese ci saranno dei passaggi, soprattutto quelli in dialetto scozzese, veramente ostici e in generale non è per l'inglese scolastico. Sarebbe meraviglioso che venisse tradotto in Italiano compresi i pochissimi doppiaggi. Sarebbe ancora più bello che in Italia, editori e realtà multimediali si unissero per trasposizioni digitali di questo tipo dei romanzi moderni. Secondo me sarebbe di incentivo alla lettura e all'approccio delle buone storie dato che oggi si legge veramente poco.
L'unico vero difetto di questo prodotto è che spesso il testo si confonde troppo con le immagini rendendo sanguinosa la lettura. Per il resto ottima veramente la realizzazione tecnica. Chissà se ci sono altre opere simili.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012317545', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1519896420}
review: Игра так себе

author: {'steamid': '76561198001308733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1443611297}
review:
"The 39 Steps" ist in dem Sinne kein Spiel, sondern eine vertonte und bebilderte Geschicht. Das Gameplay besteht also quasi nur im "Durchklicken", die Errungenschaften erhält man folglich ohne Mühen. Die Geschichte jedoch ist sehr spannend erzählt, mit guten Synchronsprechern ausgestattet und mit überaus pittoresken Bildern versehen, sodass es mir wirklich eine Freude war, die Geschichte zu sehen/hören.
Besser als Fernsehen, aber auch besonders gegenüber dem einfachen Lesen oder Hören einer Geschichte. Mir hat es sehr gut gefallen und ich würde es begrüßen, mehr "Spiele" dieser Art auf Steam zu finden, die sich gerade durch die gute Vertonung und ästhetische, graphische Untermalung von "Visual Novels" unterscheiden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157212401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1479422379}
review: Öncelikle hareketli bir oyun beklemeyin, çizgi roman okur gibi sabit görüntülerde objelere tıklayıp incelediğimiz bir oyun. Sanki sesli çizgi roman demek daha doğru olur. Her bölümde görseldeki adamlar konuşuyor sadece. Bize de hikayeyi dinlemek ve bir sonraki bölüme geçmek için tıklamak kalıyor. Ayrıca ingiliz aksanlı konuşmalar ciddi ingilizce gerektiriyor. Hikayeyi uzun uzun yazmayacağım ama 1935 ALFRED HITCHCOCK yapımı gerilim filmi ile bağlantısı var. Tabi biraz uyarlanıp biraz değiştirilmiş sanırım. Eğer derseniz ki ben uzun uzun hikaye dinleyeceğim sıkılmam, alın. Ama nerde aksiyon nerde gerilim... bir tane bile yok. Benim için güzel bir tecrübe oldu sadece (4 saat dinledim tek yaptığım mouse click)

review: Like all other reviews have stated, this is not a game, but rather a visual novel. Do no expect a game.  If you feel like reading a book, this purchase is for you. The story is compelling and the voice acting is well done.  I was pleasantly surprised and entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014881208', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1439485169}
review: This is a beautifully-drawn visual novel based on a classic work of literature. It does not really count as interactive fiction, in my opinion, as there are no choices: you are experiencing the story of the 39 Steps as written by John Buchan. But if you want a beautifully-drawn novel rather than a choose-your-own-adventure, you will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034498735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1486139627}
review:
Adaptación de una novela, parecido a un point and click pero lo más que vas a clickear es para la leer la historia, pensaba que iba a ser tipo puzzle.

El juego va en la misma dirección todo el rato no vas a poder hacer nada solo leer la historia, buena historia pero poco más.
Escucharás hablar entre personajes y puedes recojer objetos de colección pero que no dan a lugar a minijuegos solo es clickear para obtenerlos como trofeo de caza y para ti mismo.

Sólo lo recomiendo por la historia y si es en un bundle como lo compré yo poco más.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961185362', 'num_games_owned': 3030, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1478120209}
review: It’s a nice story, not much “game” in it but you do have to do a little clicking and mouse moving now and then. Some people say you’re better off reading the actual book, but I enjoyed the voice acting and most of the clicking to get the story going.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025823574', 'num_games_owned': 3336, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1478126032}
review:
Disclaimer/TLDR: The game is a Visual Novel based on a novel from 1915, featuring harder-than-everyday's English, strong Scottish accent, and is about as interesting as it would be to read the book - keep these things in mind when purchasing. The story itself is really nice, but it's not presented in a way that it's easy to digest.

39 Steps is one of the worst good-games I played. The story is great, but because how the story, the era, the book is, the story is not the most pleasant to be experienced as a game. The story rather features classes, than real personalities, and focuses on the present - not even a hint what will happen, barely any reflection to the past than remembering the chasers makes the game enjoyable only if you're actively progressing in it - either the story lost parts when it got implemented as a game, or it's not exactly a type of story that works greatly as a game.
The language is a potential problem for a lot of non-native English speakers: the game features a really heavy load of English expressions, as the book of origin is from 1915, featuring well... a lot of fancy-talk between gentlemen and quite some part with really, really strong scottish accent. If anyone has trouble understanding a today's series without subtitles, I'm almost sure that they'll have problem with understanding this game.
The story of the game is interesting, the controls are easy (Click to progress, and mouse-gestures in some scenes) and the voice acting is phenomenal - but with all of this,  I think the story's pacing is off, the text can't really be urged to progress, and it's just slow. There is 19 chapters, and each chapter's title is on screen for 5+ seconds, then the location and date is on screen for 15+ seconds. The game has a lot of audio cues about what's currently happening - sounds of the city, a mass of people, car being cranked up and such, all with outstanding quality, but the majority of the game has no notable background music, or not at all. This turns the game somewhat tedious, as the story is action and progress-oriented. Just as a comparison: a good visual novel has good characters, interaction between them, and an interaction with the setting. In this story the protagonist is fleeing, and he's just states what's happening, whom he is meeting instead of reflecting to them. This is a storytelling VN-like story that focuses of what's happening currently and there are barely any reoccuring characters, and most of them have only a role, a rank, a class instead of a personality.  So in short: there is something happening, but there's barely anything to think about in the game, BUT the thing that's happening. And for me, this is the reason the game took me 3 + 11 hours to finish, while it's around 4h long. It's a really interesting piece, but the presentation's way and VN interpretation makes the game harder to be enjoyed, than the book would be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177984381', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1467937628}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979922053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1477805950}
review:
This is an interactive visual novel that re-tells [i]The 39 Steps[/i] by John Buchan. I found it to be thoroughly enjoyable even though the pacing was a bit slow for me at times. And by that I mean how the game chose to pace scene transitions and such. Once the thriller part of it started, I wanted to be able to "turn the pages" much faster, but the game demanded it's own pace. Still, it's a great story and well worth the 4 hours or so if you like the spy/thriller genre.

[b]Rating: 7.5/10
Excellent story, great visuals, but could be a little faster in execution to keep the excitement up.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198115827371', 'num_games_owned': 918, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1477662284}
review:
[h1]The 39 Steps[/h1]

[i]"A smile flickered over his drawn face. 'I'm not mad - yet, say, sir, I've been watching you, and I reckon you're a cool customer. I reckon, too, you're an honest man, and not afraid of playing a bold hand. I'm going to confide in you."[/i]

Miután elolvastam magát a könyvet s megnéztem a filmadaptációt, bizakodással és izgalommal megtelve nyomtam rá a "Letöltés" gombra, és szerencsére azt kaptam, amit vártam. A játék már az első tíz percben lenyűgözött, teljesen átéreztem a könyv hangulatát (Thirty Nine Steps -  John Buchan tollából), a zenéi is valami zseniálisra sikeredtek, a szinkronról nem is beszélve. Egyszerűen nem tudtam letenni a játékot, első nekifutásra végig futottam rajta. Olvastatta magát, és a kevés mini-game gondoskodott arról, hogy aprócska izgalmakat vigyen a Visual Novel műfajba. Az irányítás először idegesített, aztán rájöttem, hogy a jobbra-balra nyilakkal is lehet navigálni, így már tökéletes volt a "moziélmény".  A The 39 Steps kötelező játék a krimi és a kémfilm műfaj kedvelőinek, és azoknak is, akik előszeretettel olvasnak intrikákról, mozgalmakról, történelemről. Nem győzöm hangsúlyozni, hogy valami elképesztően gyönyörűre sikeredett a játék. (Képek itt: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/DB5/screenshots/?appid=234940] KATTINTS IDE[/url]). Percekig képes voltam bámulni egy-egy tájképet, ilyen, vagy ehhez hasonló részletességet várnék el minden műfajban alkotótól. Na de vissza a Miatyánkhoz, mint azt minden adaptációnál megszokhattuk, itt is vannak eltérések a két mű között, így ez sem kivétel. Aki nem ismeri a történetet, annak nem zavaró, engem viszont kicsit idegsetített, de messze nem annyira, hogy abbahagyjam.  
Megjegyzés margóra: A játék angol, így aki nem beszéli a nyelvet, annak problémái lehetnek a megértésével, ők az egyetlenek akiknek nem ajánlom.

[b] Pro:[/b]
- Gyönyörű, meseszép, elképesztő... nem találok rá megfelelő szavakat.
- A hangok valami fenomenálisak.
- Olvastatja magát.
- Könnyű teljesítmények (Csak végig kell játszanod hozzájuk a játékot, de a stáblistát várd meg!)
- Szinkronok. (Misztikusak, rejtélyesek, és ez teszi őket tökéletessé).
- Száz százalékos hangulatbomba, a rabjává tesz.

[b]Kontra:[/b]
- Az újrajátszása kétes, a könyv és a film sokkal jobbra sikeredett.
- Eltérések a könyvtől, filmtől.

Az eddigi legjobb Visual novel amit olvastam/játszottam. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961768818', 'num_games_owned': 4045, 'num_reviews': 454, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1477707026}
review:
Game is literally unplayable with more than one monitor.

You need to "rotate the mouse" (by which they mean the cursor) clockwise to advance the text, but the game doesn't capture the cursor so it keeps escaping to the other monitors, where it isn't detected.  And the mouse is invisible in-game, so you can't visually keep it in the window.  [i]And[/i] sometimes you're asked to click, and if you accidentally click while the cursor is outside the game, the game minimizes and starts the whole scene over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100933002', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1476301130}
review:
I think The 39 Steps did the best job it could given the circumstances.

Pros:
- Interesting, suspenseful storyline that is true to the source material
- Nice visuals to accompany the story
- Good voice acting
- Reading was given in chunks so it did not feel overwhelming
- I liked how the chapters were broken up so I could play through the game at my own pace

Cons:
- What was the deal with drawing the arrow shapes? I didn't understand the purpose of those parts.
- The black screen reading moments were kind of annoying because the order in which you should read them wasn't ever made clear. I later found out that you should read them clockwise starting at 1:00
- At times the dialect was hard to understand

I can't say that I was very fond of the story itself, but I can say that The 39 Steps was satisfying for what it was. If you are looking for a easy and basically gameplay free story experience, pick this up.

I was a little jolted at the end there, but there are no jump scares.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023879710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1475946234}
review:
A végére értem a The 39 Stepsnek és abszolút azt kell mondanom hogy megérte azt az 5 órát amit rászántam. Messze nem gondoltam volna hogy ennyire magába fog húzni a sztori. Főleg hogy volt egy pont ami után egy ideig nem is nagyon akartam hozzá nyúlni. Na de milyen műfajba is sorolható ez a "játék" ? 

Egy vizuális novellával van dolgunk a The 39 Steps képében, így nem kifejezetten nevezhetjük játéknak a szó szoros értelemben. Viszont ennek ellenére érdemes rászánni az időt. Egyrészt a képi világa valami elképesztő, kicsit festményszerűen vannak a terek-helyszínek ábrázolva, ami elégé stílusosra sikeredett. Magukat a szereplőket nem látjuk sosem, csak szellemképeket ami elsőre egy kicsit furcsa megoldás, ennek ellenére abszolút ötletes. Hiszen megadja azt a szabadságot amit egy könyv is ad, hogy nekünk kell elképzelnünk a karaktereket a leírtak alapján. Amit nagyon kihegyeztek még az a hangok voltak. A hangeffekteket valami eszméletlen jóra sikerült megcsinálni, sokkal jobban a helyzetbe tudjuk magunkat élni. Plusz a voic acting is igazán jóra sikeredett.

A történet alapjában egy men-on-the-run thriller ("menekülő ember"), ami szinte majdnem az első pillanattól kezdve pörög, folyamatosan az utolsó percig. Egyedül egy rész van benne ahol kicsit lelaposodik a dolog, de ha azon túl lendül az ember akkor utána ismét folytatodik a pörgössége a történetnek. Spoilerezni nem fogom a történetet, maradjunk annyiba hogy köze van az I. VH-hoz. Plusz mivel ez egy könyv adaptációja, így ne várjátok azt hogy a sztorit befolyásolni lehet, mert nem. 

A játékmenet kimerül annyiban hogy olvasunk, kattintunk a bizonyos tárgyakra, szövegekre. (Pro tipp: Az egérrel való lapozás helyett használjátok a nyíl bill-eket, könnyebb). Néha egyszerűbb motivumokat kell az egérrel rajzolnunk (nyílak), de ennyiben kimerül az interaktívitás.

Egyedül a karakter visszaemlékezések megvalósitása nem tetszett. Itt ilyen kisebb rajzos "filmeket" láthatunk, amik szerintem nem nagyon passzoltak bele ebbe az egészbe, kilógnak teljesen belőle. Ha csak simán szöveggel elmesélték volna a szereplők jobbak lettek volna mint így. Az újságokért meg plusz pont, mert nem csak a számunkra fontos szöveget tudjuk elolvasni, hanem akár az egész oldalt is.

Bonuszként vannak achievementek, amikért csak végig kell játszani a játékot. Illetve kapunk kártáykat is.

Vizuális novellák között szerintem az egyik legjobb, az ára viszont megegyezik egy könyv árával, így érdemes megfontolni hogy megér-e egy 5 órás történet ennyit nektek. Fele ennyiért abszolút must buy lehet, bár aki kedveli az ilyen jellegű műveket annak megérheti a teljes árat is. Az árazás és videós részlet miatt nem tudok 10/10-et személy szerint adni rá. 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032805288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1475879683}
review: Ce n'est pas vraiment un jeu, plutôt un roman d'espionnage interactif. Les artworks du jeu sont très beaux, les doublages trés bons, l'histoire interessante. Attention bon niveau d'anglais requis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048295454', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1475691834}
review:
This is an extremely well done interactive experience, bringing to life an interesting story full of intrigue and suspense. The art is excellent and really gives a feel for the beauty of Scotland's countryside. The music is well done, and the voice acting is quite good, reminiscent of a radio drama. The plot is well written and it seems to be well served by its new format.
This isn't really much of a game, as there is only a singluar path to go down, with no player choice or real consequences for interaction but I thought it was unique enough in its storytelling methods to receive a heartfelt recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131947571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1475236996}
review:
"The 39 Steps" is, down to its core, a slightly-interactive-novel. That being said - it's not "bad" by any means. For what it is, it's incredibly well done, and a means in which I would love to continue consume various forms of classical fiction.

Based on the original espionage thriller "The 39 Steps" by John Buchan, you can definitely see where modern day spy stories came from - predating popular fictional characters like James Bond by at least 30 years. This story takes place on the verge of WWI and introduces a character named Richard Hanny, a man on the run after a young American spy divulges sensitive information to him. The game is presented mostly in beautifully painted backdrops, fuzzy silhouettes and the occasional shadow puppet show (of which are quite entertaining). These backgrounds take you from inner-city London, to the moors of Scotland and back again. There isn't much gameplay to be had (to my slight disappointment), but what is present is likened to that of a game like "TRAUMA" - drawing shapes and clicking on things to carry through the cutscene-like chapters.

Simply put - the game is awesome for what it is - but it really needs a bit more interactivity. There is one part that involves the character decoding a notebook. I got really excited, thinking that I'd at least have a mini-game or a puzzle to figure out the code, but alas - the game just carries on like the book. They allow you to zoom in and out on objects you see in the environments - here I am, thinking that I'll have to do some Sherlock Holmes work and pick out clues from the zoomed-in objects, but alas - there isn't much to discover but a few timeline-appropriate advertisements and newspaper articles.

I would love to digest all sorts of fiction this way. From Sherlock Holmes to H.P. Lovecraft to Franz Kafka - I would love to have this sort of artwork and voice acting and sound effects, mood, pacing, attention to detail, and the ease of taking it in via separate chapters (just incase I need to leave and come back to it) - albeit, more interactivity would be preferred

author: {'steamid': '76561198011949271', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1475224666}
review: My god this is dull. The standard of presentation in terms of the interface, the artwork and the voice acting is excellent. If only it could have been used in service of a better story. The first couple of chapters put the pieces in place for a potentially interesting tale of political conspiracy, however the ensuing several chapters squander this potential by taking our unlikeable protagonist on an endless run through the Scottish countryside, stopping to have a natter with whomever he accosts. In between the banal smalltalk, I struggled to remember what exactly the plot was, and consequently had little idea what was happening when it finally picked up the pace in the concluding chapters. This game represents a brilliant execution of an awful story. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1473717862}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

I love reading, I love reading physical books. The 39 Steps is a book, and it's one of my favourites... so there

The 39 Steps is a digital adaption (visual novel) of John Buchan's classic of the same name. Developed by The Story Mechanics and published by KISS Ltd. This game has gotten a lot of mixed reception with gamers, however the game has gained critical acclaim with reviewers and critics across the board and I can understand both sides of the picture

The 39 Steps is a very faithful adaption of the book, you experience the story through beautifully designed landscapes and good voice acting with very little interaction

It can get boring and yes the length of the game is extremely short (I finished it in over three to four hours and in one whole sitting) and the asking price is a bit too steep, however, The 39 Steps' story, although not originally written by the developers, and visual recreation of the novel are nailed perfectly in the game

I can understand the mixed responses from gamers about The 39 Steps and I can also understand why critics and reviewers gave this game a near perfect score and to me personally I really enjoyed playing through The 39 Steps. Yes, I have read the novel before and yes it is one of my favourite books but that does not effect the way I play the game. True, the length of the game is ridiculously short and you hardly do anything just listen to a story, however, John Duchan's novel is so well written that I just wanted to continue playing it to the end

The 39 Steps will and has mixed reception but if you are reading this review, then you are dying to know my recommendation. The 39 Steps is a game everyone should try and play and finish in one whole sitting even if you don't like reading books (which you should!) and would like another way of seeing this interesting story, then the game is the other option, however, for the retail price it is offering, I would not recommend it at its full price and rather wait for a price drop or a sale

The 39 Steps is not the game for everyone, but a majority of gamers should at least give it a try and see John Bucahn's vision come to life

I cannot wait to see what other digital adaptations The Story Mechanics have in store!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!) [/i]

review: Grając w The 39 Steps możemy się zastanawiać czy to już gra,czy jeszcze książka.Na wstępie trzeba zaznaczyć,że w tej produkcji nasz wkład będzie naprawdę mierny.Jedynie od czasu do czasu gra poprosi nas o wciśnięcie jakiegoś przycisku lub narysowanie kilku symboli,ale czy to sprawia,że należy sobie tę grę odpuścić?To zależy.Jeśli szukacie strzelanin,pościgów i dubstepu w tle to niestety tutaj tego nie uświadczycie i po prostu uznacie grę za zbyt nudną ,ale jeśli po ciężkim dniu w pracy lub w szkole chcecie się odstresować i usłyszeć dobrą opowieść to z pełnym przekonaniem mogę stwierdzić,że na grze się nie zawiedziecie i z całym sercem mogę ją polecić.Na szczególne uznanie w tym dziele zasługują piękne krajobrazy(które są jedynie serią obrazów ale uroku im odebrać nie można :)) i zaskakująco dobry voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130932508', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1528797411}
review:
[h1]39 ступеней[/h1]

The 39 Steps - не просто игра, это книга. В основу игры заложен роман "39 ступеней" Джона Бакена. На этом уже можно отсеять добрую часть геймеров. Не любите читать диалоги (а игра состоит только из них) - брать игру не стоит. Ну и об игре:

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]
Как я уже сказал, игра состоит из диалогов, и некоторых действий (к примеру, нужно повернуть ручку двери и войти, для этого рисуем полукруг и вертикальную линию). Диалоги можно пропускать.

[h1]Музыка:[/h1]
Музыка "The 39 Steps" передает всю атмосферу того времени. Музыка, звуки, диалоги - всё на уровне.

[h1]Графика:[/h1]
Великолепно! От некоторых пейзажей просто дух захватывало. Поля, поезда, горы, огромные замки - вы только взгляните на скриншоты. Да, сами персонажи здесь показаны словно тени, что добавляет игре атмосферности.

[h1]Обобщение и мелочи:[/h1]
1) Нет русского языка. Я бы не сказал, что в данной игре это минус, ведь слушая чистый английский, читая диалоги на английском, смотря на виды того времени, мы словно оказываемся там. Для погружения самое оно.
2) Достижения. Всего есть 19 глав, 19 достижений + одно за полностью просмотренные субтитры.
3) Коллекционные карточки.
4) Сюжет. Я не стал описывать сюжет выше, ведь это значит, пришлось бы просто проспойлерить всю игру. Того, что игра сделана по роману вполне достаточно.
5) Низкая цена в 29 рублей по скидке.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Игра на любителя, и если вы такой любитель, то игра вам понравится. Сборщикам достижений игру тоже стоит приобрести. Остальным - по желанию. Лично у меня от игры остались только хорошие впечатления. Рекомендую!

[code][i]Подписывайтесь на [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33161518/]кураторскую страницу[/url]! А также я буду рад видеть вас среди участников группы [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/korukagames]Koruka[/url], где можно найти еще больше обзоров и руководств! [/i][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2558, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1471214557}
review:
"The 39 Steps" ist eine Visual Novel, basierend auf dem gleichnamigen Roman des schottischen Schriftstellers John Buchan aus dem Jahre 1915. Der Roman war auch Inspirationsquelle für Alfred Hitchcocks (sorry Steam Textfilter, er heißt nunmal so^^) gleichnamiger Verfilmung, die allerdings recht frei mit dem Stoff arbeitete. Dieses Spiel folgt dem Roman, nicht dem Film.

Wir sind Richard Hannay, ein Ingenieur, der lange in Afrika lebte und sich nun in London langweilt. Eines Tages, wir schreiben das Jahr 1914, werden wir von unserem Nachbarn in eine unglaubliche Geschichte eingeweiht. Eine Geschichte voll Verschwörung, Agenten, Geheimdiensten, Attentaten Politik und Morden. Eine Geschichte, die möglicherweise in einen großen Krieg münden wird, einen Krieg, in den wohl zum ersten Mal die ganze Welt involviert sein wird...

Der Roman ist hochspannend und reflektiert intelligent und unterhaltsam den Weg zum ersten Weltkrieg als Räuberpistole und gehört damit unbestreitbar zu den großen Werken des letzten Jahrhunderts.

Die vielen Negativbewertungen scheinen daher zu rühren, daß manche etwas anderes erwartet haben. "39 Steps" ist kein Adventure, auch kein Game, es ist die Visualisierung eines Romans auf dem Medium Computer und als solches sollte man es auch bewerten.

Und als Buchumsetzung ist es herausragend. Intelligent, stilsicher und erwachsen. Das Artwork ist qualitativ hochwertig, die Grafiken liebevoll und gekonnt, das historische Setting realistisch und überzeugend umgesetzt.

Aber was macht man jetzt eigentlich. Nicht viel, meist klickt man nur weiter oder schaut sich Briefe oder Zeitungsausschnitte an. Unspannend? Gameplaytechnisch sicher. Aber die Zeitungen sind realitätsnah und auf einer Zeitungsseite kann man auch andere Artikel als den relevanten lesen oder die Werbeanzeige für die neueste Hutmode betrachten. Die Story hält dabei alles zusammen, treibt vorwärts und nimmt einen mit. Erinnerungen werden durch grandiose, liebevoll kunstvolle Scherenschnitte erzählt. Und noch ein Kniff: die Protagonisten sind auf den Screens nur als Geistschatten sichtbar, bleiben schemenhaft und können somit, wie im Buch, vom Rezipienten mit seiner Vorstellung gefüllt werden.

Besonders zu erwähnen: die Akustik. Teile der Texte sind (englisch, teils auch mit stark schottischem Akzent) vertont, mit richtig guten und professionellen Sprechern. Dazu sind Sounds hochatmosphärisch und tragen wesentlich zur Immersion bei. Das Akustische des Spiels könnte leicht auch als eigenständiges, qualitativ hochwertiges Hörspiel durchgehen.

Die Macher von "39 Steps" sind nicht nur kunstvolle Könner, sondern man hat den Eindruck, daß sie stets genau wußten was sie tun, stilistische Entscheidungen weise hinterfragten und durchdachten. 

Nur Lob? Nein. Denn im der Mechanik haben sie zuwenig an den Benutzer gedacht. Oft dauert es ermüdend lange bis Screens abblenden oder aufblenden, das Erzähltempo ist provozierend langsam und die Bedienung per Maus ist gern mal hakelig.

Dennoch: die vier bis fünf Stunden Lese- und Erlebniszeit sind fesselnd und bleiben einem im Gedächtnis.   

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
10/10 Atmosphäre
10/10 Story
9/10 Grafik
9/10 Sound
3/10 Spielmechanik
-/10 Balancing
9/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Sehr hochwertige Visual Novel eines wichtigen Werkes der Weltliteratur.

[h1][b]9/10 Gesamtwertung
