author: {'steamid': '76561197996550048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1452977153}
review:
this is the most effort i've ever had to put into reading a book — a very pretty book with great voice acting, mind, but the "game mechanics" included are both so simple and sparsely utilized the whole project probably would have been better off as an animated comic book or video of some sort. 

the text itself, over a century old at this point, has not aged favorably either. those who appreciate highbrow literary concepts such as "character arcs" and "themes" will not find much to be engaged with here — this is pure thriller fiction, focused solely on the protagonist staying one step ahead of those dastardly germans whilst conceiving a way to stop their nefarious plot. it honestly wouldn't feel out of place in today's AAA video game market.

for something that's supposed to be suspenseful, the meat of the story falls into a sort of trite cycle as well, mostly consisting of the protagonist putting on disguises just clever enough to fool his would-be captors and/or chancing upon the most trusting and kindhearted people he could possibly meet to aid him at the exact right moment, only for him to be discovered again and forced to repeat the process. perhaps back in the day the suspension of disbelief was a little easier to uphold, but as of today i'd hesitate to call the haphazard feats of the protagonist anything but hilariously miraculous.

allies regularly pop up for a scene or two before never being seen again, and i honestly can't even remember if the villains have names or not, because they barely had presence outside of being bad and scary. events that feel like they should be shocking revelations fall flat because i have little to no investment in any of the characters or their motivations. even the final confrontation, which should have been climactic, was over and done with within seconds, the epilogue equally as rushed.

i was actually going to give this a positive recommendation at first, but looking over what i've written, yeah, the only compliments i could give this book are to its art and voiceovers. so in the end, i guess the biggest twist of all, was myself. dang. the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111263669', 'num_games_owned': 1173, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1452370331}
review:
As a fan of visual novels, I really enjoyed The 39 Steps, as that's basically what this game is. There's not much to do but read along, occasionally clicking a few things for some extra information, and as such the game may not appeal to traditional adventure-game lovers. However, the casual interactivity is more than made up for with the excellent story; I wasn't aware of John Buchan's novel previously, as I'm normally not one for espionage tales, but I was thoroughly engaged by this on-the-run spy thriller. The game follows the story of restless gentleman Richard Hannay, who forges a new friendship which rapidly plunges him into a world of deception, cover-ups and murder. The artwork throughout the game is attractive, with decent music and ambience, and great voice acting. While the theme of the story is dark in nature, there are some amusingly light-hearted quips well-delivered by the cast, and in the form of a few shadow-puppet style scenes.

Pros:
- Consistently good art style and sound
- Excellent pacing, it neither drags nor feels rushed at any point
- Has the old-timey feel of a classic book, without feeling dated
- Decent playtime (over 5 hours for me) 

Cons:
- It's a few pounds more expensive than I would expect for this sort of game and play time

Overall: 
The achievements are almost entirely unmissable, presenting a lack of challenge in that department, but it does make for a relaxed, enjoyable experience where you can really focus on the story-telling. I found no faults with the gameplay, and highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a strong story-driven experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165829247', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1452697561}
review:
I can only imagine two kind of persons liking this game:
- Either total fans of the novel "The 39 Steps" by John Buchan
- Or persons wanting to learn English, maybe?
If you don't belong to one of these groups, don't buy it.
Just to be clear, this is no game, this is just a visual novel. Summarising: you "watch" the story on screen while subtitles are displayed. For getting to the next part of the story (AKA more text to read), you have to click. And that keeps going for around 3h, which takes to complete the so-called "game". 
I bought this game for 1 € and still wouldn't buy it again. I do love thriller and I was expecting this story to be catchy. But even though the graphics are kind of nice, the story is dull.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054637506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1452688547}
review:
One of the point and click I enjoyed because of the story and design of the game. And art, of course. The minimalistic shadowy humans while in conversation, that is one of the most creative things. The actig is so good, you feel them. All in all, it is a very good game and I recommend it if you're a point and click player.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198195032457', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1587833144}
review:
Что же представляет из себя эта игра?

The 39 Steps – это своеобразная интерактивная книга, выступающая в роли адаптации приключенческого романа шотландца Джона Бакена “39 ступеней”.

Коротко о сюжете

Действия игры разворачиваются в Лондоне начала двадцатого века. Наш главный герой Ричард Ханней оказывается обвинен в убийстве, которого не совершал. И Ричарду ничего не остаётся, кроме как сбежать из города и скрываться от полиции. В то же время он пытается найти настоящих убийц, чтобы доказать свою правоту и добиться истины.

Геймплей

Как и во всех визуальных новеллах, на протяжении всей игры нам придётся прочитывать текст, слушать диалоги или аудио, кликать на мышь, чтобы пролистать дальше и тд. Также присутствуют мини игры, например : найти вещь на сцене или рисовать мышкой фигуры, чтобы сделать конкретное действие.

Музыка и звук

На мой взгляд, в этой игре прекрасная музыка, погружающая в атмосферу Великобритании 1914 года. Также на некоторых сценах есть звуки природы, звуки проезжающих машин и тд, что тоже погружает в атмосферу игры. Кроме того, немаловажным компонентом погружения игрока в этот мир является то, что есть возможность слушать диалоги и повествование на чистом английском и с акцентом шотландского.

Картинка

От прекрасных рисованных пейзажей в «The 39 Steps» порой попросту захватывает дух. Все они выполнены очень и очень красиво.

review:
Привет! Моё мнение об этой игре...
-
Итак, в переводе эта игра называется "39 Ступеней".
По первому взгляду на скриншотах ясно, что это интерактивная игра, которая больше напоминает интерактивную книгу, по сюжету больше похоже на приключенческий роман-детектив.
-
Плюсы:
-Красивая графика.
-Интересный сюжет.
-Озвучка.
-Пейзажи.
-Достижения.
-
Минусы:
-Отсутствие русского языка.
-
9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172755715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1450830779}
review: Novela virtual de la obra de suspense de John Buchan. Como lector del libro original, me ha encantado esta adaptación, con un artwork muy trabajado y un ritmo bastante acertado. Recomendado sin duda.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024039656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1456227325}
review:
All visual novels i’ve come across seem to follow that choose-your-own-adventure line while catering to a very certain, slightly perverted, teenage fanbase. 

This instead is what you could call a multimedia thriller, combining the classic narrative with beautiful hand drawn backdrops, fitting audio and some basic animations. All combined it makes for a very immersive experience, and with the excellent quality of the source material writing there is an actually gripping story driving the game forward. 

It was a captivating 4 hours experience that changed my conception of what can be done within the rigid structure of a visual novel. Highly recommended as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008414212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1450380764}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058390931', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1451318655}
review: Polecam każdemu fanowi zagadek logicznych! W tej grze znajdziecie nie tylko ciekawe łamigłówki, ale także niespodziewane zwroty akcji, dzięki którym nawet mruganie przyprawi was o strach, że przegapicie jakiś ważny wątek. Kolejnym plusem tej gry jest wspaniały DARMOWY dodatek pt. "Mass Effect", w którym dane nam będzie się wcielić w komandora Sheparda i zwiedzać kosmos w super nowoczesnym statku SSV Normandia SR-1. Na uwagę zasługuje także tryb mutliplayer, który przenosi nas prosto na front wojny między Rosją a USA. Oczywiście jak każda gra, nie może obejść się bez wad. Największą z nich jest to, że nie będziecie się potrafili odciągnąć od rozgrywki! Z niecierpliwością czekam na drugą część tej wspaniałej trylogii.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067666432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1375943431}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072450805', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 791, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1444439347}
review:
Jednym zdaniem: Gra ma klimat, ale... brakuje w niej grywalności. 39 kroków zapowiadała się jako niezwykle obiecujący interaktywny kryminał, ale szybko okazała się średnio wciągającą szpiegowską historyjką typu runaway story... A mogła być z tego fajna przygodówka, gdyby była bardziej dopracowana i gdyby zaistniała emocjonalna więź z głównym bohaterem gry.

Plusy:

+ obiecujący pomysł na grę
+ zabawny szkocki akcent części bohaterów
+ ładne rysowane statyczne grafiki
+ detaliczne udźwiękowienie
+ czas akcji w 1914 roku i fabularny pomysł związany z rozpętaniem I wojny światowej
+ dobrze oddany klimat wysp brytyjskich (angolstwo aż wylewa się z ekranu ;))

Minusy:

- słaba interakcja (de facto jedynie ilustrowana i udźwiękowiona książka czyli audiobook)
- bardziej thriller niż detektywistyczny kryminał (Angol ucieka przez Szkocję przed zabójcami)
- w grze nie ma ani jednej postaci na ekranie (wszystkie osoby są w formie duchów)
- grafika w grze to niestety tylko statyczne obrazy (ładne, ale statyczne)
- kompletny brak emocjonalnej łączności z bohaterem gry
- irytujący, podręcznikowy angielski akcent głównego bohatera
- niezbyt dobrze przemyślana mechanika gry (np. te otwieranie drzwi)
- słabe, niby zabawne filmiki mające ożywiać statyczną rozgrywkę
- brak wciągającej muzyki
- dość przewidywalna intryga
- gra strasznie przynudza

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam? 

+ polecam miłośnikom interaktywnych literackich oldskulowych thrillerów szpiegowskich
+ polecam zwolennikom angielskich klimatów (tudzież filologom brytyjskim;))
- odradzam graczom szukającym identyfikacji z głównym bohaterem
- odradzam graczom szukajacych ciekawje postaci w przygodówce
- odradzam tym, którzy nie lubią gatunku visual novel

Rada: 

Jeżeli chcecie dobrą grę detektywistyczną związaną z wywołaniem I wojny światowej z mocną fabułą i dobrze zaprojektowaną interakcją, to kupcie sobie znacznie lepszą szpiegowską przygodówkę The Last Express.

==============================================

➥ Obserwuj mnie jako kuratora ⤵
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/10437106/

author: {'steamid': '76561198141388005', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1451135477}
review:
[h1] Что же представляет из себя эта игра? [/h1]

The 39 Steps – это своеобразная интерактивная книга, выступающая в роли адаптации приключенческого романа шотландца Джона Бакена “39 ступеней”.

[h1] Коротко о сюжете [/h1]

Действия игры разворачиваются в Лондоне начала двадцатого века. Наш главный герой Ричард Ханней оказывается обвинен в убийстве, которого не совершал. И Ричарду ничего не остаётся, кроме как сбежать из города и скрываться от полиции. В то же время он пытается найти настоящих убийц, чтобы доказать свою правоту и добиться истины.

[h1] Геймплей [/h1]

Как и во всех визуальных новеллах, на протяжении всей игры нам придётся прочитывать текст, слушать диалоги или аудио, кликать на мышь, чтобы пролистать дальше и тд. Также присутствуют мини игры, например : найти вещь на сцене или рисовать мышкой фигуры, чтобы сделать конкретное действие.

 [h1] Музыка и звук [/h1]

На мой взгляд, в этой игре прекрасная музыка, погружающая в атмосферу Великобритании 1914 года. Также на некоторых сценах есть звуки природы, звуки проезжающих машин и тд, что тоже погружает в атмосферу игры. Кроме того, немаловажным компонентом погружения игрока в этот мир является то, что есть возможность слушать диалоги и повествование на чистом английском и с акцентом шотландского.

 [h1] Картинка [/h1]

От прекрасных рисованных пейзажей в «The 39 Steps» порой попросту захватывает дух. Все они выполнены очень и очень красиво.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=574640415
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=576060088
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=577997624
Также присутствуют черно-белые вставочки а-ля старая кинохроника. Очень интересно то, что все персонажи выполнены в виде прозрачных расплывчатых силуэтах. И это очень даже необычно, ведь это заставляет нашу фантазию работать на полную катушку, чтобы представить облик героев.

[h1] Краткие итоги [/h1]

[b] Достоинства : [/b]

+ Прекрасный сюжет
+ Чудесное музыкальное сопровождение
+ Полное погружение в атмосферу Великобритании 1914 года
+ Красивейшие пейзажи
+ Профессиональная озвучка
+ Возможность улучшить свои знания английского
+ Легкие достижения ( Достаточно пройти игру и все достижения ваши )

[b] Недостатки : [/b]

- Скучноватый геймплей
- Отсутствие русских субтитров
- Требуется хороший уровень владения английским, чтобы понять сюжет

 The 39 Steps – очень необычная и интересная адаптация книги. Лично мне очень понравилась эта игра. Поэтому однозначно рекомендую к покупке лингвистам, любителям детективов и красивых пейзажей, а также любителям получения легких достижений в играх.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100943931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1451567306}
review:
Bardzo wciągająca gra na dwa wieczory, a w zasadzie "powieść interaktywna", gdzie naszym zadaniem jest klikanie w interaktywne przedmioty aby dowiedzieć się, co się stało dalej.

Zalety:
* ciekawa i wciągająca historia szpiegowska
* dobrze utrzymany klimat z przedednia pierwszej wojny światowej
* interesująca grafika i głosy aktorów

Grę mogę polecić z czystym sumieniem każdemu fanowi przygodówek w dawnym stylu, szczególnie jeśli uda się ją upolować w jakiejś promocji lub, jak w moim przypadku, dostać za darmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161758080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1451024632}
review:
[h1]1.[/h1] [b]Сюжет[/b]: Из первого эпизода мы видим, что играть будет не за одного персонажа. Нам предстоит расскрыть преступление, а также выбраться из здания, решая головоломки. [h1][8/10][/h1]

[h1]2.[/h1] [b]Графика[/b]: Интересное решение - сделать игру в виде сериала с живыми людьми. [h1][10/10][/h1]

[h1]3.[/h1] [b]Геймплей[/b]: Всего на 40 минут плюс минус - это первый эпизод. Но где продолжение? И будет ли оно? Из этого можно было бы сделать действительно интересную игру. Думаю, эпизодов на 10-12 (стандарт серий по 40 минут одного сезона, к примеру). 
Головоломки несложные, больше на внимание. Здесь было бы тоже неплохо поработать.
Я столкнулась с багом после решения "кроссворда", где должна была появиться подсказка, но увы и ах, пришлось лезть в интернет. 
В общем и целом, игра может получиться интересной, особенно с учётом того, что это детектив.. с элементами Пилы (без кровожадности, разумеется, но что-то в этом есть). Будем ждать следующих эпизодов (если они будут, конечно). [h1][9/10][/h1]

[h1]4.[/h1] [b]Музыка и звуки[/b]: Не могу сказать, что музыкальное сопровождение на высоте, особенно клишированная музака с саксофоном, когда на место преступления приезжает детектив... Но в целом, нормально. [h1][7/10][/h1]

[h1]5.[/h1] [b]Оптимизация[/b]: Я понимаю, что эта игра сделана на телефоны, но раз уж она приспособлена к ПК, то стоит доработать временами подтормаживающую картинку, но опять же, в целом - хорошо. [h1][8/10][/h1]

[h1][b]Итог:[/b][/h1]
8 детективов из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126959057', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1451446590}
review:
3/10 objective rating 

PROS:

- Moderately interesting story
- Moderately nice visuals (static scenery only - people are white silhouettes and interactive elements are average)

CONS:

- Boring gameplay, barely anything to do
- Sound design is underwhelming
- Voice actors don't do the source material justice.
- Everything takes forever to get through
- Lots of reading

-----------------------------------------------------------------

When I got The 39 Steps, I was expecting a visual novel adapted into a point and click type adventure game. What I got was various blocks of text I had to click with small bits of "click here to read this" and "do this to open that" type gameplay. Needless to say I became bored VERY quickly. I like casual games, and I like to do things at my own pace, but this snail's crawl was too slow and uneventful for my liking. I actually fell asleep at my keyboard twice during a 1 hour session.

The sound design is mediocre and the voices are too similar - it's overall very disjointed and not cohesive as a whole.

Adjust expectations before starting this game and I think anyone who just wants to read a story in small bits will enjoy The 39 Steps. If you expect any sort of action, you will likely be disappointed!

If The 39 Steps would have had a narrator instead of the player needing to click for each paragraph, I may have enjoyed it more. I feel like they should have chosen to go 100% visual novel instead of 90% visual novel and 10% gameplay. It makes the whole experience unsatisfying. I will simply read the original book when I feel like it. I will not revisit or complete this "game"

author: {'steamid': '76561198031435144', 'num_games_owned': 1797, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1451409745}
review:
Was pleasantly surprised although I had no expectations. It's not much of a game, there's hardly any gameplay. First thought was that was gonna be annoying but it wasn't. Interactive movie? Interactive novel? You hardly had to do anything and it was a cool spy-adventure, which I enjoyed. You could probably get it for under 1€ at either steam or some other site. 

Was it a good GAME? Not really. Was it enjoyable? Very. Make more of these please.

review: This is a very weak recommendation. Anyone who considers buying this needs to know that it's not a game; it's basically reading a novel, with very minimal interaction. I wasn't going to recommend it, but I was drawn into the story enough to enjoy myself. The art was great, but I wish they had included the characters instead of just making them silhouettes. As long as you know what you're getting into, it might be worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081189956', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1451512728}
review:
İlk bölümü bitirmemin ardından size görüşlerimi aktaracağım. oyun bitirdim mi düzenlerim.
Oyunun başlangıcında cast vermişler. ama ilginç olan ki yanında verdikleri animasyonlarla hepsini izletti. (+)
Oyunun müziği acayip geriyor insanı, öyleki menu bile çok fazla gerildim,bana duyguyu hissettirdi. mesela apartmana giriyorsun ayak sesleri,kafede insan sesleri vb(+)
Oyunun içindeki menude(space,sağ tık la çıkan)  tekrar tekrar çıkan enstrumantel müzik var. tekrarlanırken  düzgünce saracağına bittimi "dıng" gibi durması can sıkıyor, düzgünce bağlasana abi (-)
Oyunda çok fazla incelenecek nesne yok(-), olanlarda çok hafif parlak veriyor. bu iyi bence diğer oyunlar gibi ekrana iki saat tıkla tıkla uğraştırmıyor(+).ben şahsen nesneleri çok sevdim.gazeteler filan hepsini okudum, bir de eski ingilizce ağızı kullanılıyor. para yerine half-a-crown olsun.bu da ayarlardan kapatılabiliyor.(+)
Oyunu diğer tıklamalı,bulmacalı oyunlardan ayıran ince detaylar var bence. sabit değil ileri geri gidiyor sahneler,seslendirmeler çok iyi düşünülmüş(+)
ingiltere yi ve o zamanları bildiğin bana yaşattığı,iyice betimlediği doğrudur.(+)
bence oyunun zevki adamın geçmişini  çocukluğunu,kariyerini,notlarını okumakla çıkıyor.mesela outlast olsun notları,kağıtları okumasan bir şey değişmez oyununu oynarsın yinede zevkini alırsın ama bu oyunda farkettiriyor. ingilizcesi olmayan kesinlikle almasın(ki banada bir yerden beleş geldi)
zaten oyun john bucan ın the thirty-nine steps kitabının oyuna adapte olmuş hali.(beni okuduğunuz için teşekkürler.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095186045', 'num_games_owned': 620, 'num_reviews': 256, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1451077621}
review:
Я ничего не ждала от игры The 39 Steps, ведь она досталась мне совершенно бесплатно.
- Отличная адаптация детективного сюжета. Целая книга перенесена в небольшую игру, но сюжет остается по-прежнему увлекательным и интригующим.
- Привлекательная графика. Особенно понравилась работа со шрифтом (всё же, это скорее история с картинками, чем игра)
- Замечательный саундтрек.
- Отличный тренажер английского языка (теперь с диалектами!)
- Профессиональная озвучка
Рекомендую всем, кто по-настоящему влюблен в детективный жанр и английский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973044527', 'num_games_owned': 1016, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1451001503}
review:
I finally finished this game and overall I didn't really like it much.

Pros:
1. Great voice acting
2. Nice painted backgrounds
3. Nice sounds

Cons:
1. Incredibly boring story
2. Story relies on way too many coincidences, hardly believable.
3. Storytelling is extremely slow. I kept nodding off every time I tried to play it.

This is one of those games which I just wanted to finish as soon as possible so I could remove it from my computer and never see it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019169430', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1450887205}
review:
The 39 steps n'est pas un mauvais jeu en soi, c'est pour cela que je lui attribue une évaluation positive. Cependant, à moins d'être un octogénaire associal, vous trouverez sûrement ce jeu très long et chiant, avec une quantité incalculable de textes à lire, le tout en anglais.
Je note aussi une abscence totale de menu d'options, ce qui m'a empêché de changer la résolution.
Heureusement que le style graphique est impressionnant, et que l'ambiance est prenante, sinon ce jeu n'aurait rien pour lui.
Je recommande ce jeu uniquement si vous parvenez à vous le procurer à très bas prix.

EDIT: fautes de frappe

author: {'steamid': '76561198043835726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1450795377}
review:
If you don’t mind a game with almost no gameplay elements and you are looking for something diferent to relax in the cold winter, 39 Steps might be the game you are looking for. Sit back, get warm and grab a cup of tea or coffee because you will only need to move your mouse every now and then. You play as Richard Hannay, a man from London during 1914 with a boring life whose fate changed after a certain event. Now, he’s being chased by a crime he didn’t commit. And that’s when the story gets interesting. 

The game reads like a book, and you won’t have any choices to make like, say, a Telltale game. You just explore your surroundings, read some descriptions, and move on with the story. The game does not lie about this, their premise is really honest and you should know what you are getting into, you will be reading a digital book with some clicks here and there. As the story goes, tension will go up as things may get troublesome in the road making Hannay finding different means to get what he want weather by escaping, stealing or using his wits and words with strangers. The visuals of the game are calm with vibrant colors. They are hand painted with minor movements like the wind and it will remind you of some old point & click adventure games. During your play through you will also find some collectibles by explorations. These are very hard to miss, especially if you are playing the game carefully and take your time to look at the scenario before being done with it. 

After 4 hours I finished the game and I do not find any reason to play it again. It’s a different experience and it was something I rather enjoyed. The final chapters make the conclusion satisfying and I was engaged in the game from start to finish. When I finished a chapter I just had to go to the next one as I was too curious to know what was going to happen or how Hanney is going to find a solution for his current problem. Because there’s almost no gameplay mechanics involved this games ended being quite relaxing. You can be very tired after a long day at work sipping your hot beverage while playing 39 Steps and it’s going to be a nice experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164013730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1451159351}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046357734', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1450495597}
review:
The 39 Steps é um jogo que conta uma história de um conto policial, com um engenheiro que quase se tornou um detetive (com a sorte e ajuda de outrem) e com um pouco de  mistério. Este jogo tem um quê de Sherlock Holmes (inclusive faz referência ao personagem, à saga e ao autor Arthur Conan Doyle). A história é bem interessante, mas demonstra faltar alguns pontos chaves com elementos não tão detalhados e simplificados (subjetivos).

Sobre a jogabilidade em si, você não precisa fazer muita coisa. Basta ler tudo o que o narrador-personagem vai contar (que é o protagonista) e clicar em coisas brilhantes que te chamam a atenção e que o personagem vai notar e usar junto aos seus conhecimentos para dar continuidade à história (semelhante a um Hidden Object). As cutscenes do jogo mostram ambientes bonitos e bem feitos (que parecem telas pintadas ou fotos antigas de lugares a céu aberto ou ambientes bem mobilhados). Você ainda tem a possibilidade de fazer desenhos com o mouse (nos momentos em que o personagem vai abrir portas - normalmente, nada de arrombar - ou abrir janelas, garrafas. O jogo indica no canto da dela a quantidade de coisas que você pode encontrar no ambiente para ajudar seu personagem e a quantidade de parágrafos que você também vai passar por . Além disso, a história contada pelo personagem só dá continuidade quando você dá um clique com um mouse para ela passar ao próximo texto narrado. No mais, a história segue seu curso e você não faz muitas interferências (no máximo pular as cutscenes e entender nada da história e perder conquistas do jogo por causa disso).

A OST do jogo, apesar de não ser tão diversa nos diferentes momentos da história é boa. Acho que se encaixa bem no que o jogo propõe e os sons utilizados também. 

Por fim, eu gostei do jogo, porém acho que ele foi pouco explorado. Ele tem uma proposta muito boa (pelo menos para mim) e poderia ter sido mais legal ainda com poucas mudanças. Mas entendo que a proposta talvez tenha sido essa desde o início, e é um modo de contar uma história. 

7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042998141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1450576230}
review: Not terrible for an interactive story sort of "game." A bit slow but the music sets the tone rather well and once you've adjusted to the pace it is well executed. Story is part entertaining spy yarn, part silly patriotic English mumbo-jumbo. I got it on sale - otherwise I'd have never bothered. For those that like this sort of thing, this is the sort of thing they'd like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025115329', 'num_games_owned': 11784, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1561539320}
review:
동명의 원작 소설을 기반으로 제작된 그래픽 노블에 가까운 게임입니다.

개인적인 선택에 의한 이야기 전개 변화는 없으며, 

플레이어가 할 일은 단순히 물건을 찾고 배경을 감상하며, 스토리에 빠져들면 됩니다.

동명의 영화도 있습니다. (히치콕 감독/1935년작)

삽화가 아름답고 중간중간 컷신이 재미난 게임입니다.

한글화는 되어있지 않으나, 어렵지 않은 영어로 플레이하는데 큰 지장이 없을 듯합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082809570', 'num_games_owned': 2048, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1450468208}
review: I don't feel like this game is as interactive as it could be, or at all. It feels more of just a visual novel, the other annoying aspect is whenever I Alt-Tabbed out, it would completely start over from the very start and not let me skip through cut scenes and that I had already watched. Never been a huge fan of visual novels, this game is visually easy on the eyes, the art is fantastic and the voice acting is very good, I also really enjoyed the soundtrack. But the gameplay itself is severely lacking and the constant starting over if I had to alt-tab out really ruined it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139638075', 'num_games_owned': 773, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1450297813}
review:
«Куда ведут эти ступени?» ⒸThe 39 Steps

Итак, перед нами годный инди-детектив на подобие Rooms (только если учесть что у нас не одна коробочка для того чтобы ее открыть, а нечто большее, включающее эти самые комнаты и различные мини-игры, плюс сюжетные вставки), созданный по довольно таки старому британскому фильму 1935 года выпуска (Да, да фильму на данный момент уже более восьмидесяти лет). Итак, разберемся с сюжетом:

"Ричард знакомится в Лондонском мюзикхолле с Аннабеллой, которая просит укрыть ее от идущих по ее следу убийц. Ричард не воспринимает это всерьез, но разрешает ей переночевать у него. Той же ночью девушка вваливается в его спальню с ножом в спине… Бегущего в панике Ричарда принимают за убийцу-маньяка и полиция всей Англии начинает охоту. Чтобы доказать свою невиновность, ему придется пройти все круги Ада…" и вот тут то и начинается "веселуха" и наше похождение, а дальше играйте сами, не буду спойлерить.

Итак, как уже было сказанно игра очень даже не плоха в своем жанре, да и со скидками цена очень даже привлекательная.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058662607', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1450246367}
review:
Иногда обидно, что редко говорят о играх такого плана, как 39 Steps. И зря.

[b] Главное [/b] - Это не просто обычная игра, а скорее повествующий детектив с отличными картинками и разнообразными пейзажами, где изредка, кликая, приходиться что-то выбирать или больше узнавать информации. Игра сделана по книге Джона Бакена - 39 Ступеней. Так же есть фильм Хичкока, который, к сожалению, мне так и не удалось посмотреть. Она стоит все свои 5 баксов, а сейчас даже меньше 30 - СРОЧНО БЕРИТЕ!

Игра не для всех, т.к даже с субтитрами иногда сложно разобрать почти чистый английский. Наикрасивейшие рисованные пейзажи, честно. Хоть бери и в рамочку вешай. Сюжет, как раз для типичных детективах, не говорю о русских.
Рекомендую, тем кто замешкался в сюжете игры, прочесть книгу. Я не мог разобрать, что происходит ближе к концу и мне книга помогла. Отличное игра на выходные, чтобы скоротать в ней пару тройку часов, для удовольствия.

[h1] 8 из 10 [/h1]. Не пойдет, для тех, кто вообще не любит такого жанра игры  - без геймплея. Знание английского хотя-бы чуть выше базового. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=513477694

author: {'steamid': '76561198122451548', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1446924218}
review:
Edit: I had to cut down my review a bit because it seems Steam is experiencing a bug.

As someone who hadn't previously read the book or seen the play/movie, I have to say this definitely made me want to read/watch. 

It started off pretty slow, (again I'm sure someone will pick up this game having no prior knowledge of this story) I had a problem where whenever I would alternate to a different window to do something, even when pausing the game, it would not let me continue, instead it would restart the chapter I was currently on, which can get annoying as I'm a very easily distracted person. Nonetheless, solving that would just mean putting your undivided attention into the game, at least until the end of that chapter (which is a good thing as this is more of an interactive story rather than a game, you wouldn't want to miss precious plot)

Anyway, the water colour landscape art is absolutely stunning, and added suspense in a way that really made you listen to what was being said and at times forced you to visualize the situation yourself, with the help of some awesome first person narration. I bought this game a while back on a third person game bundle site for a few bucks at most. Would I spend $15 on this game? No. But I am broke so I'm speaking from the stance of an empty walleted person.

All in all this game is relaxing, suspenseful, and to a degree educational. I'd recommend this game to those who want something that they can casually unwind to, without much effort on their part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058514011', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1450094499}

author: {'steamid': '76561198194459855', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1454949231}
review:
This is an interactive adaptation of John Buchan's book. I can see this game as a nice way of introducing literature to teenage readers or anyone who isn't into books, really. As a teacher, I know I could use this game with students of many ages.

PROS:
The story is great, full of interesting characters.
Both the music and the voice acting are very good.

CONS:
The gameplay is too simple, making you wish there was more for you to do.
Achievements don't work on Mac (hopefully this will be fixed).
A bit expensive for such a short experience. If you can get it on sale or a bundle, do it.

That being said, I'd still recomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991955953', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1573428011}
review:
Better than Alfred Hitchcocks version.

This is a fun little adaptation of a classic mystery. The virtual novel approach was an interesting take and has a distinct feel all to its own. This distinctly western game paints in interesting picture of early 20th century europe.

There are a couple sections of the game with somewhat jarring changes in artistic style, but overall the variety was nice. The whole experience was very cohesive and kept a feeling of suspense during the entire playthrough.

Overall would recommend. It's the enjoyable paperback novel of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174487591', 'num_games_owned': 1813, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1561535493}
review:
The 39 Steps is a famous adventure thriller novel by John Buchan that released in 1915. This novel had several movie adaptation, and the first movie adaptation directed by Alfred Hitchcock in 1935. And this game is a digital adaptation of John Buchan's novel, it is different to compared to another Visual Novel games. This game is not like that.

I like The Story Mechanics  treatment about this game, they presentation of this game made me feel that I watch a thriller movie than playing a game. The storytelling is masterpiece. The soundtrack is very good, it blend with the atmosphere of the scene and sometimes made me nervous about the next scene. The voice acting is superb, especially english gaelic accent of the scotslands peoples.

Well, this digital adaptation is an alternative way to read a famous literature, I'll hope The Story Mechanics made another adaptation of famous literature by famous writer. And I'm highly recommended this game to anyone interested in good storytelling games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080707121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1441795367}
review:
I actually got this game in a giveaway and because it sat at the top of my library I thought I'd give it a go when I wanted a quiet night in. I'm not new to visual novels I've been playing them for years but this was the first one of it's kind that I'd read. 
After the initial few chapters had passed I found the story to be quite interesting, I got through it in one sitting or roughly <4 hours and that was with my random breaks to make tea as I read.

I have no complaints about it and as I did receive it for free I'm quite pleased with it.
If you're interested in this kind of genre and enjoy an interactive visual element when reading I think it's worth giving it a go :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168716605', 'num_games_owned': 3117, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1516884320}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970506824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1448274148}
review:
This visual novel is based on a book.  I probably wouldn't have picked up the book, but as a 'game option', I figured why not...  It's easy to get 100% percent achievements as long as you view all of the content. There are a few scenes where there are objects to click for a closer inspection and cinematics (which should be viewed for the achievements). I came up short an achievement at the end. This achievement can be gained by watching through the credits until the next scene. 
There really wasn't much player interaction, with the exception of several scenes requiring a series of mouse swipes across the screen as indicated by a row of different pointing arrows. At first I was confused and tried to get all artistic, overthinking the whole thing, but it just required pressing the left mouse button and drawing swipes in the direction arrows are pointing. 
This isn't a choose your own adventure. It has a set path. I'd recommend it if your mood is somewhere in between... 'Should I read a book? or watch a movie?' I enjoyed the story, the artwork and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103090723', 'num_games_owned': 3002, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1455502822}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063489127', 'num_games_owned': 2158, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1450293330}
review:
Ein Point & Click-Adventure mit guter Story, guter Grafik und sehr guter Vertonung.
Das Gameplay ist dagegen langweilend, unabwechslungsreich, sehr simpel gehalten und kein einziges Mal anspruchsvoll bzw. herausfordernd. Man muss immer einfach nur die Dialoge weiterklicken, "Done" drücken, Pfeile nachzeichnen (ohne erkennbare Logik) oder etwas anklicken. Alles andere geschieht von allein. Am nervigsten ist dabei, dass man Dialoge oder Filmsequenzen nie überspringen kann.
Zu bemängeln ist auch, dass die Umwelt statisch wirkt und alle Charaktere nur weißer Nebel sind. So haben sich die Entwickler das Charakterdesign sowie Bewegungen und Emotionen derer gespart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097038029', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1451805528}
review:
Absolutely recommended, it was a very well written and composed work. From newspaper articles to clues and music, it was a very enjoyable tale to listen and read, and adapted to the time of the facts that transpire in it.

As with other titles like this one, the only real complain to be had might be the duration, for I wished it to last a bit longer, but it more than served it's purpose and made the afternoon I spent on it a very interesting one.

(Tips hat)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1491826285}
review:
Es un trabajo que ha sido financiado con recursos y capital por los ministerios de cultura y educación de Escocia sobre temas de la Primera Guerra Mundial. El juego y su realización tiene una o mucha trasparencia en general. Supongo que super recomendado que haya juegos así te toquen temas tan interesantes, y con buena atmósfera.

Su dificultad es casi nula pero ante todo es un juego antes que una novela. La gente que ha hecho este juego son jugadores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163370321', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1451222491}
review:
游戏画面使用的是老照片与现代色彩混搭，颜色偏灰暗。字幕若隐若现，让人感受到一股莫名的压抑，游戏处于紧张的压抑之中。BGM更是诡异万分，悬疑片都特色音效，游戏全程，除去汉内的思考世界，都有语音，并且无需与GalGame一样选择自动播放也会像电影一样完整的播放下去。习惯了美式英语发音，游戏中纯正英式英语觉得正统许多，也更加舒服容易听懂。游戏中还会不断穿插一些78年版《三十九级台阶》的电影片段，与其说是游戏，不如说是用鼠标看的电影。
------------------------------------------------------------------以上内容均来自网上摘抄，能够很好的表达我对这部游戏的感想

author: {'steamid': '76561198113900048', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1465984168}
review:
Сама по себе игра The 39 steps весьма неплоха. И я бы рекомендовала ее другим, но все же для себя я нашла больше минусов, чем плюсов. 
Начнем с самого главного - сюжет! Сюжет основан на новелле Джона Бакена с одноименным названием, а именно 39 ступеней. И если честно, сюжет нисколько не интересный. Хотя это произведение входит в топ 200 по версии ВВС, но на лайвлибе, например, у книги оценки около 5-6 из 10. Я к тому, что изначально для игры разработчики взяли неверное произведение. Оно скучное и нудное, полное диалогов, за которыми следить неинтересно, мне надоело где-то к середине. Если уж хотите ознакомиться с произведением, лучше саму книгу почитайте. Может, на меня оказало влияние то, что мне не понравились ни главный герой, ни атмосфера 1914 года. Не хватает этой игре экшена и действий, а то действительно "никакой это не триллер, а просто невнятный шпионско-приключенческий бред. Большую часть книги герой скачет по сельской местности, прячась от полиции и злодеев. Логики в его действиях нет вообще. Зато он суперкрутой горный инженер, маскируется лучше Шерлока Холмса и ловит подброшенный нож за ручку зубами" (это обзор на книгу с лайвлиба, но я с этим полностью согласна). В общем за сюжет минус!
Далее, геймплей. Навязывание каких-то ненужных движений мышкой совсем не к месту. Чтобы игроку было не скучно? Чтобы время потянуть? Чтобы оправдать отсутсвие геймплея? Непонятно... Да и вместо героев какие-то призраки без лица, как-то теряется вовлеченность в процесс игры.
Из плюсов, очень богатый язык. Определенно помогает развитию английского языка. Многие слова редко встречаются в современном разговорном языке, что весьма интересно. Хотя порой в диалогах реплики довольно быстро сменяются, но в общем это не критично. P.S. Шотландский акцент это ад, но субтитры к нему нормальные.
Еще плюс, игра очень красиво нарисована, она радует глаз, и я сделала довольно много скриншотов. Порой, на некоторых кадрах в помещении чуть ли не фотореализм, а пейзазжи как будто акварелью нарисованы. Здорово!
Кроме того в игре очень легкие ачивки, нужно просто пройти игру и всё. а проходится она довольно быстро, у меня ушло около пяти часов. Не нужно даже все внутриигровые ачивки выбивать, достаточно лишь пройти сюжет.

В итоге для меня, несмотря на все плюсы, минус за сюжет стал самым главным. Но, как известно, на вкус и цвет все фломастеры разные, кому-то сюжет вполне может понравиться, так что я рекомендовала бы глянуть сначала книгу, и если уж заинтересует, спокойно играть в игру. А я ей ставлю 5 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247940658', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1643927592}
review:
Итак, на дворе начало двадцатого века. Европа как никогда близка к войне, обстановка накалена, повсюду шныряют шпионы, но в старой доброй Англии все так же подают на завтрак яичницу с беконом, а порядочные джентльмены все так же пьют чай из фарфоровых чашек.

Вероятно, любому такому джентльмену не очень бы понравилось, если бы у двери собственной квартиры его схватил за локоть полузнакомый человек и истерично зашептал: «Я — покойник, помоги мне».

Но наш главный герой и по совместительству рассказчик, Ричард Ханней, не благовоспитанный денди, он совсем недавно приехал из полной приключений и опасностей Южной Африки и в уютном Лондоне ему изрядно скучно. Поэтому он соглашается выслушать нежданного гостя, предлагает ему кров, постель... и совершенно неожиданно для себя оказывается втянут в хитросплетения интриг, обвивающих Европу не хуже щупалец гигантского кракена.

Любопытно, что все персонажи, включая самого Ричарда, представлены в игре не портретами и не живыми актерами, а полупрозрачными силуэтами. Вероятно, разработчики решили, что фантазия игроков будет работать на полную катушку и каждый сможет представить себе действующих лиц так, как сочтет нужным. На практике же дымчатые призраки, появляющиеся на фоне старинных квартир и переулков Сити, вызывают недоумение и изрядно отвлекают от сюжета.

Разработчикам стоило слегка адаптировать историю для более удобного чтения. Многие фразы кажутся нарочито обрубленными, описания — чересчур короткими, а самых внимательных игроков заденут опечатки и периодическое отсутствие точек в конце предложений.

Способ подачи сложно назвать изобретательным — простые статичные картинки. Хотя стоит сказать, что они неплохо справляются со своей задачей: изображения, похожие одновременно на фотографии и на акварельные наброски, полноценно передают атмосферу и обстановку. Кликать в поисках активных зон здесь не нужно, крупная стрелка или круг покажут, куда надо нажать, чтобы перейти на следующий... этап?

Пожалуй, скорее — на следующую страницу. Это все-таки не игра, а книга. Книга, безуспешно притворяющаяся игрой. Даже сохранения здесь зовутся «закладками».

Разработчики попытались разнообразить неторопливое течение рассказа с помощью карикатурных роликов и приемов из Heavy Rain. Здесь тоже есть возможность в некоторые моменты просмотреть мысли героя о том или ином событии, а все его действия — открывание дверей, наливание виски или бритье заросших щек — необходимо «рисовать» мышкой. Только вот даже в игре Дэвида Кейджа подобные рутинные задачи раздражали, хотя там требовалось крутить геймпад в воздухе, трясти его и зажимать разные кнопки, а не просто елозить манипулятором по коврику.

Главная проблема The 39 Steps в том, что разработчики попытались представить свою игру такой, какой она не является, введя совершенно лишние функции, и где-то приняли странные решения (те же привидения). Но мы все равно рады тому, что литературная классика перебирается в видеоигровой формат. Было бы неплохо увидеть больше хороших книг в нестандартном изложении.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006812040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1498396493}
review:
This is an adaptation of a book I really enjoyed reading. Please note that this game is more of a narrative, rather than a point-and-click adventure with choices. In this game you live its story.

If you've read the book: this game complements it nicely.

If you haven't read the book: this is an interesting story to be played through.

It also works on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010459360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1445546320}
review:
I’ve not read the book on which this game/visual novel is based, however being a huge Alfred Hitchcock fan I have seen the 1935 film called The 39 Steps (obviously also based on the book). I wrongly thought that was enough to make me completely familiar with the story that inspired the creation of James Bond. I was very surprised when I played this and realized how vastly different it was from the film. I’ll give some examples. In the film, Richard Hannay is Canadian. In this game, he’s a Scot. In the film, the agent he encounters at the start of the story is a mysterious lady. In this game, he meets a male American spy. In the film, he eventually encounters a love interest. In this game, he does not. Also, the entire enemy plot in the movie is different. Upon doing some research, I learned that the movie took many liberties with the story (possibly to make it more entertaining for movie audiences at the time). This game is supposedly more, if not completely faithful, to the book. 
However you should know that while this story is of historical note, it was only innovative because of the era in which it came out. It’s hardly a masterpiece. It is just a simple man-on-the-run story, in which the hero lucks his way through numerous tricky situations and eventually defeats the rather cliche villains at the end of it. There are also some ridiculous coincidences that you’ll just have to suspend disbelief to accept. Then it ends somewhat abruptly. I could see why Hitchcock made certain changes for his movie.
Still, despite it’s flaws, it is rather enjoyable. The character of Richard Hannay is extremely likable and his voice actor in this game is spot on. The Story Mechanics present scenes with beautiful art and offer enough variety in their storytelling to keep the player engaged. This is a great way to experience John Buchan’s novel. I personally got it during a weekly Steam sale at 90% off, so it was almost free. If you’re thinking about getting it, I recommend that you wait for it to go on sale as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051376939', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1454092342}
review:
The Story Mechanics сделали великолепную работу по созданию атмосферы 1914 года за счет великолепных иллюстраций и интересно написанного текста. Однако если Вы желаете насладиться геймплеем, то отнюдь - Вам это не удастся, поскольку перед Вами приключенческая новела.

Тем не менее, если Вы любитель детективов или визуальных новелл, то данная игра более чем достойна вашего внимания. 

reVote 7/10

P.S. К сожалению, для прохождения нужно знать английский язык, либо быть готовым к работе со словарем.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120216065', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1452521805}
review: Esse jogo tem uma arte maravilhosa e história empolgante. Mas para os que não gostam de jogos onde tem que ler, esqueçam. Além de ser quase 80% texto/imagem, você tem que entender bem o inglês pra conseguir acompanhar. Além disso, é o Inglês Britanico na grande maioria, que difere do americano bastante. Na parte em que o Hannay está na Escócia, ficou completamente impossivel pra mim acompanhar os diálogos, sotaque demais e referencias muito locais. Resumindo, ele precisa muito de uma tradução, se não encontrar, boa sorte! Vale a pena

author: {'steamid': '76561198084674862', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1451510429}
review:
The 39 Steps jest opisywana jako interaktywna adaptacja. Jednak nie licząc kilku momentów, gdzie musimy rysować myszą ruch otwierania klamki, interaktywności w niej nie ma. Jest to po prostu liniowa książka z obrazkami, w której co jakiś czas musimy kliknąć drzwi lub przedmiot, żeby ruszyć opowieść do przodu. Większość treści to fragmenty opowieści wyświetlające się na bardzo ładnych, choć niemal całkiem statycznych tłach bądź w towarzystwie fotografii z epoki. Co jakiś czas raczeni jesteśmy nagranym dialogiem. Tu muszę pochwalić twórców, bo głosy są bardzo przyjemne, a szkocki angielski jest tak zabawny, że niemal niezrozumiały. Także podkład muzyczny jest przyjemny dla ucha. Fakt, że nie wyświetlają się postacie, tylko zamglone sylwety, jest dla mnie plusem, bo sama najlepiej umiem wyobrażać sobie bohaterów. Ale dla osób nie będących molami książkowymi może być to wada.
Polecam, bo lubię oryginał Buchanana, poza tym lubię książki z obrazkami. Ale z pewnością nie jest to gra. 
Przeczytanie całości zajmuje 3,5 godziny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119808516', 'num_games_owned': 1854, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1450498530}
review:
This is a refined VN from England, whose original novel was published in 1915. 

It has a fine detailed graphic and effective text showing method that will certainly immerse us into the atmosphere. I could image the living of people a decade ago and the conspiracy towards the first World War vividly. The voice acting and sound effect are also great. Although I had some difficulty reading the strict English and Scottish dialect for I don't speak English as my native language, this game made me finish itself and it was fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015500132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1449998045}
review:
Best narrative, story driven, point & click adventure game ever, period.

A chapter a day keeps the player away. Preferred playstyle for games like these. Keeps it refreshing when you return to it.  

The cast of voice over characters are beautifully executed.

Narrative + Artistic work + soundtrack = 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041153724', 'num_games_owned': 2807, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1451473751}
review: There are not many video games that follow the plot of a classic novel (leaving aside Sherlock Holmes) and even fewer from this period of the early to mid 20th Century. This rendering of John Buchan's simple soldier turned First World War hero and post-war clandestine government agent allows for some sumptuous hand-painting of Edwardian splendour and grandeur. It's a well realized puzzle and hidden object solver and I wish there were a few more imaginations of similar writings such as the novels of Dorothy L. Sayer. Sadly, this is a crowded market and I don't imagine that sales made it likely that follow-up Hannay stories set during and after the Warwould appear, more's the pity

author: {'steamid': '76561197969301810', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1444231236}
review:
The title of this interactive story can be read as a subtle allusion to its gameplay - it is one of the most lineair and simple games I have ever played. Its gameplay is never much more complicated than turning the pages of a book.

Yet, there is something wonderfully charming about it all. 
Richard Hannay, our protagonist, can easily be identified with, and the sketched characters he meets along his fortnightly enterprise are lifelike and intrigueing. Sound and vision have an imaginative minimalistic approach to them; voice-overs are of high standard overall, and the digital paintings, though lacking in places, are atmospheric and convincing. 

The downsides are that at several moments the game didn't seem to register my input to continue, which is something that might be worked out with a future patch, and that the replay value of this already very short game is almost non-existent.

Verdict: [b]The 39 Steps is an uncomplicated, but innovative and engrossing interactive novel.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198084191057', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1474995343}

author: {'steamid': '76561198123194054', 'num_games_owned': 2839, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1450261563}
review:
8/10

PROS:
-Great background score and event specific sound
-Immersive hand drawn scene sketches
-Great combination of reading and voice acted scenes
-Quite a great adaptation from original novel, covering great many details
-A nice fleshed out 4-6 hours gameplay time (If you are not trying to rush through events merely for achievements)

CONS:
-A little more of interactive elements would have been great
-Even better if some interactive choices would have led to a little different path taken
(A scene where you could write "Thank you" on a piece of paper to the landlord of the INN seemed non-consequential I was expecting it to have some impact on game)
-Gameplay seemed a little sped up and missing on details from the novel after Hannay meets Sir Walter and gets his title cleared, before that the game was going so much in depth with each emotion he goes through and describing each little character in detail (like the old shephard in the train). I wish the level of immersion was continued after the point he meets Walter.

All in all an excellent adaptation, I am really looking forward to get my hands on any other novel adaptation from this DEV.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041626313', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1443777389}
review:
Adaptation d'un roman d'espionnage du même nom, The 39 Steps est une très bonne Visual Novel (ce n'est pas réellement un Point & Clic, car il suffit de cliquer où et quand on nous le "dit", il n'y a pas de choix à effectuer, juste à suivre l'histoire).
Situé dans la Grande-Bretagne de 1914 (le tout très bien retranscrit, entre multiples références à l'actualité et aux personnalités existantes, le cadre, les coupures de presse, les images d'archives, de petits films animés parfois et même jusque dans les accents parfois très appuyés), ce jeu bénéficie d'une très bonne mise en scène ainsi que d'une direction artistique plus qu'honorable.
De quatre à cinq heures de jeu, c'est plutôt correct (un peu court peut-être, mais plus long le suspens aurait sans doute perdu de sa densité). C'est plutôt donné si vous arrivez à avoir ce titre en promotion (il est à l'heure de mon évaluation à -90%, soit seulement 0.99€).
S'il faut y trouver des défauts, je déplore le manque de musique de fond la plupart du temps, mais surtout l'absence de sous-titres FR. En effet, ce titre ne plaira clairement pas aux anglophobes, sachant que le niveau de langage est assez élevé. Certains passages se font dans un écossais "agricole" de l'époque, non seulement à l'oral mais également retranscrit ainsi dans les sous-titres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1454107000}
review:
[h1]Short version: 67%[/h1]
Cross-media experiments are always risky, and this unique adaptation of ‘The 39 Steps’ is a good example to show it. There was a lot of thought and care put into it, but in the end it just didn't succeed. It’s a shame, really.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
If you didn’t know already, ‘The 39 Steps’ was originally a serialised pulp novel published in 1915. Its protagonist, an involuntary adventurer, Hannay, gets caught in a web of German conspiracy against the power structures of Europe, only to be chased through half of Scotland, eluding his pursuers only by his quick wits and a few friendly locals. It was sort of a forefather of the spy thriller genre that was so popular in the 1970s.

This adaptation tried to do something other than the numerous others by being a cross between a visual novel and an audiobook. Sadly, it fell between the two stools.
For a radio drama, it is good, and the actors are especially adept at portraying all the various British dialects, but there are so few recorded sections that you sometimes forget that these characters have voices.
For a visual novel, it is just dull. Everything is a still image background with an occasional grey silhouette. The drawings look spectacular, but their stillness completely fails to capture the supposedly fast pace of this century-old action thriller.

I wish I could give a better rating, because the amount of work put into this adaptation is more than admirable. But in the end, I must say that if you are interested in ‘The 39 Steps’, just buy the book instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163478934', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1443402334}
review: This was a great story and I looked forward to playing through a few chapters each day.  I would love to see other books created in this fashion.  If you are looking for an interesting story then I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043179243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1443312684}
review:
Я ничего не ждала от игры The 39 Steps, ведь она досталась мне совершенно бесплатно. И напрасно.
- Отличная адаптация детективного сюжета. Целая книга перенесена в небольшую игру, но сюжет остается по-преждему увлекательным, интригующим и ничем не уступает полновесному литературному произведению.
- Привлекательная графика. Особенно понравиась работа со шрифтом (все же, это скорее история с картинками, чем игра)
- Замечательный саундтрек.
- Отличный тренажер английского языка (теперь с диалектами!)
- Профессиональная озвучка
Рекомундую всем, кто по-настоящему влюблен в детективный жанр и английский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017924360', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1450657667}
review: Premetto che ho ricevuto questo gioco gratuitamente e non ho mai letto il libro di cui è un riadattamento videoludico. Il gioco, che è più simile ad un audio libro, si comporta quasi come un punta e clicca se non fosse per il fatto che nn ci sono enigmi da risolvere. Si tratta di pura e semplice storia da seguire, e a giudicare da come lo "giocato" io, direi che svolge il suo lavoro in maniera molto buona! La storia riesce a coinvolgere tantissimo, grazie alle immagini create a mano (e alle poche sequenze animate che richiamano molto l'epoca in cui si svolge l'avventura). Il titolo scorre molto velocemente andando subito al punto. Contiene anche sequenze in dialetto scozzese e gallese che possono essere disattivate dal menù. Consigliato sopratutto a chi ha letto il libro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182593165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1437926893}
review: Boring game

author: {'steamid': '76561198118392184', 'num_games_owned': 3465, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1450727921}
review:
[h1]Les + :[/h1]

- Les graphismes, les atworks sont magnifiques et très travaillés
- L'histoire, dynamique, et extrémement bien écrite (après, ça vient d'un roman, donc....)
- La bande-son, les bruitages sont immersifs, avec un son de très bonne qualité
- Les voix, très soignés, on y retrouve les différents accent de l'époque (paysan, écossais, anglais, français, etc...)

[h1]Les - :[/h1]

- Pas de traduction française, va falloir s'acrocher pour bien comprendre les nuances de certaines situations
- Pas de choix dans l'histoire, on doit juste suivre le mouvement
- Un 100 % des plus simpliste

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Une très belle histoire, c'est le but d'un jeu narratif, donc n'espérez pas avoir un jeu à la TellTales Games, c'est juste un livre, et un bon !

Je le recommande ! 

15/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198108899326', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1450211763}
review: It`s nice to see such a great adaptation since most games based on books and tv shows or movies end up failing. It`s a nice atmospheric point and click adventure with excellent storytelling and casual puzzles that actually keeps you playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061172632', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1417975977}
review:
[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[i]James Bond minus the shooting and add World War 1.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
++Great concept! Turning a book into an interactive story with backgrounds and voice acting
+Richard Hannay is a badass
+Voice acting is very good
+Backgrounds are detailed and colorful
+Story is thrilling and involves plenty of mystery
+Keeps the entire story and setting of the original book (Never read the book, but I read some reviews and summaries of it after playing this)

[h1]The Ok Stuff[/h1]
=It's not 100% like a book, you miss the aspect of reading an actual book but nonetheless get the story and atmosphere
=Written in early 20th century so it's a harder read

[h1]The Bad Stuff[/h1]
-A visual novel, not a game. That's a warning to you if you believe this is a point n' click or a puzzle game, it's stricly story

[h1]The Truthful Hard Facts[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198035560545', 'num_games_owned': 3961, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1451635856}
review:
Though somewhat primitive, The 39 Steps is an ok alternative to just reading a book. While more gameplay features would be nice, it tells the story just fine and does attempt to keep the reader engaged.That being said, it certainly can drag on in certain areas. Sometimes the music and visuals are just not enough to brighten up a passage.

It's not the must play game of the year, but if you are mildly interested in Buchan's The 39 Steps but don't want to read it dry, this might help a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023246857', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1466345409}
review:
I must say, The 39 Steps really impressed me. It presents the perfect blend between video games and books. The game is essentially a visual novel, but a rather special one. It's a digital adaptation of a espionage thriller, where the main character is Richard Hannay, someone who is put on the run due to certain events to which I won't spoil for you. The story is engaging, and the way it's told is creative and original. Besides the beautiful hand drawn art design, the sounds effect are splendidly united with the phrases you'll be reading throughout the main events. The progression is linear, something expected. Simple actions are executed by dragging your mouse in certain directions (such as trimming Hannay's beard, for example), and those end up adding immersion to the game. The voice acting is remarkable and the only problem I had with it was due to the not understandable scottish accents, but that was easily fixed by turning on the lyrics. Various objects can be explored and viewed from different angles, and The 39 Steps, at times, even is educative in a way that it provides information on the history at that particular time, around 1910. The achievements are easily obtainable, as they are completed by finishing event after event, which function like a chapter in a book.

[h1]Conclusion: The 39 Steps changed my perception of how this concept of digital adaptation of a book to a video game can be astonishingly enjoyable. It is rather unique amongst this genre, and I expect more of these by the same developer. Absolutely worth your money!

Screenshot: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=518883366 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999706674', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1451430446}
review: The 39 Steps to przygodówka, a raczej interaktywna książka, która została stworzona przez studio The Story Mechanics w oparciu o powieść Johna Buchana z 1915 roku. W grze nie będziemy strzelać, skakać po wieżowcach czy też prowadzić szybkich samochów, jedyną rzeczą którą musimy robić jest czytanie i klikanie. Druga czynność pozwala wyświetlić kolejne fragmenty układanki. Czasami zostaniemy zmuszeni do wykonania QTE, lecz nie są one zbyt trudne. Fabuła opiera się na morderstwie, fałszywym osądzeniu oraz pościgu za podejrzanym, więcej nie zdradzam, bo byłoby to głupie biorąc pod uwagę typ gry. Muzyka towarzysząca nam podczas czytania jest świetnie dobrana, tam gdzie akcja nabiera szybszego tempa, w słuchawkach słyszymy żywsze utwory. Grafika? Cóż, myśle że nie można jej ocenić, jako iż The 39 Steps opiera się na wyświetlaniu obrazków, bądź animacji, które jeżeli mielibyśmy być szczerzy są całkeim nieźle wykonane. Gra jest krótka, przejście jej zajmuje 4-5 godzin. Niestety ze względu na swój specyficzny gameplay nie przypadnie ona każdemu do gustu. więc jeśli lubisz książki możesz śmiało zakupić produkt, jeżeli natomiast czytanie jest Ci obce, radziłbym ominąć ten tytuł szerokim łukiem ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157198557', 'num_games_owned': 5894, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1456782308}
review:
The 39 Steps ist ein Point & Click Spiel welches irgendwie einen ganz eigenen Charakter hat.
Es unterscheidet sich von den meisten Spielen des Genre.
Der Grafikstil und die Darstellung der Charaktere ist manchmal recht eigenartig.

+ eigenwilliges Spielkonzept
+ gelungene Steuerung
+ Grafik in Ordnung
+ sehr gemütlich

- manchmal schwer mit den Gegenständen zu interagieren
- an manchen Stellen wird die Story künstlich in die Länge gezogen (viel gerede, wenig Sinn)

author: {'steamid': '76561198141651090', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1454528221}
review:
The 39 Steps is a digital adaptation of John Buchan's incredible book following the story of Richard Hannay, a man framed for a murder he didn't commit and his path to solve the riddle of The Thirty-Nine Steps.
The game combines literature, gaming and film concepts perfectly, providing an astonishing experience.
The gameplay is simplistic, the visuals are wonderful, the soundtrack is excellent and the story is superb.
The 39 Steps provides an amazing experience and I certainly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072540709', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1442429906}
review:
This is a really good visual novel.

Storywise this one was way better than i thought since i got it for free. The story was very interesting and exciting, it's one of the better ones that makes you want to discover more. It's told in several chapters that always ends on a high note with a cliffhanger making you want to play the next chapter.

The background art is nice and felt high quality for being a visual novel, it suceeds in telling you the mood of the scene and leaves enough to the imagination to let you see it in your way.

Atmosphere is the best in any visual novel i've played, the background music is very well made and the background sounds like footsteps and waterdrops is something that makes it even more immersive and interesting.

This visual novel is a must play with a interesting story, good music and the best ambience sounds i've seen in a visual novel.

10/10 

Must buy if you are a fan of visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142846942', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1455474648}
review:
"39 Шагов" Книга-Детектив которую сделали в виде интерактивной игры. Уже интересно. Довольно таки оригинально. Сюжетку я не буду спойлерить, хотите пройдите сами.
Плюсы:
+ Мне она досталась бесплато
+ Графика в стиле "Арт-Хаус"
+ Сюжет (что понять обсолютно все нужен скилл английского языка)
+ Интерактивность
Минусы:
- Не затягивает
- Легкие достижения
- Нет русской локализации (Даже субтитров!)
- Геймплэй
- Скучно
Долго думал - рекомедовать ее или нет? Решил
Итоговая оценка 6/10
Стоит пройти только ради сюжета.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045427992', 'num_games_owned': 1886, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1450880688}
review:
39级台阶真正意义上来说并不算是一个游戏，应该是一本电子小说，比起GAL更纯粹的小说。
全游戏过程只需要你点击就能过，而且看完之后也能拿到全成就。[spoiler] 可以理解为什么Indiegala作为大赠送的礼物了……[/spoiler]

本作改编自1915年John Buchan的同名小说《The 39 steps》，讲述了一名平民被卷入英德谍战之间的悬疑故事。同时1935年由导演阿尔弗雷德·希区柯克翻拍为同名电影上映。

谈谈游戏本身，说白了一部电子小说能有多大游戏性……？相对于GALGAME还能有妹子CG看亮点，本作出众之处只能在于剧情。剧情就不剧透了，为了作对比我还去把电影下来看了一遍。不过可以确定的是电影改编得太多，基本就不是原作样貌[spoiler] 但是电影有未经PS的女主和脱袜秀腿福利我会和你说么？[/spoiler]……

相对于那个年代应该算是一部不错的悬疑小说，有闲空的人可以去看看原作。

最后唯一吐槽的就是里面的英式方言和偶尔出现的德语我真是看不懂了……

4.5/10.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198110802817', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1703456006}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 1585, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1459690139}
review:
Ein sehr eigenartiges Point & Cklick Game. Es ist anders als viele andere Spiele des Genres.
Alleine der Aufbau des Gameplays und die Darstellung der Charaktere. 

Ich habe zwar nur bis Mitte Level 2 gespielt, habe aber festgestellt, das es ein sehr ruhiges Game ist. Man kann viel lesen und paar Dinge bzw. leider wenige Sachen anklicken.

+ einfache Steuerung
+ Grafik ist teilweise gut, aber auch etwas ungünstig gewählt
+ Soundtrack gut
+ teilweise gute und interessante Interaktions Möglichkeiten, wie z,B eine Tür aufzumachen. Man klickt nicht einfach drauf und die Tür ist auf, sondern muss mit der Maus 4 Zeichen zeichnen wie ein gerader Strich oder Kringel.
+ einige Levels (die genaue Anzahl sieht man schon am Anfang und Dinge die man gefunden hat oder noch finden muss)

- ungewöhnliche Darstellungen der Charaktere
- man sieht einige Räume, aber man kann kaum mit ihnen interagieren 
- nur  auf Englisch verfügbar
- viel "Gerede"
- für mich persönlich zu ruhig

Vielleicht ist das Gameplay nur ungewohnt für mich oder für einige anderen auch. Die Entwickler zeigen zwar interessante Aspekte, aber auch Dinge, die man besser umsetzen hätte können.
