author: {'steamid': '76561197987146417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1411829720}
review:
Просто хочу добавить положительный отзыв с надеждой на то, что положительные отзывы воодушевят авторов на создание новых "цифровых адаптаций".

Советовать игру не стану, это в принципе и не игра, а так, интерактивный комикс: красивые иллюстрации, немного анимации и озвученные диалоги. Всё что нужно делать, чтобы продвигаться по сюжету -- это клацать по кнопке мыши. Просто клацать, читать, смотреть и слушать.

Ну и ещё требуется уверенное знание английского языка. 
А история да, неплохая, временами даже затягивает, но в целом просто интересно, без восторгов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025169047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1396128983}
review:
Very intriguing narrative game.
For a couple of hours I felt like a living scotish guy fleeing from an immense conspriracy.
Could'nt stop the game until the end

Good job!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115981750', 'num_games_owned': 2504, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1452618438}
review:
Not as engrossing as I thought it would be, but overall not a bad adaptation.
A little time consuming however, and after a while gets tedious, I don't think I ever spent more than 30 minutes actually playing it at a time, and often found myself wandering AFK to do something else as it never kept my attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141833916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1411251221}
review: I agree with other reviewers there are a few pointless activities of mouse drawing BUT the thrilling story is so well presented I gasped at some events. I like the way they often seem to use authentic documents & photographs that help immerse us in the era better than the excellent films of the book I appreciated the attention to detail. The artwork is often so beautiful I took screen shots just for the sake of it. The music was atmospheric. I had a slow start but that may add to the sense of the character's discontent with his lack of purpose in life & urge us to seek adventure & making a contribution as he does.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964926767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1411220994}
review:
As this being a visual novel and not a classic video game it might not be made for everyone, but I was pretty much hooked from the first chapter onwards. This digital adaption of an english literature classic is executed pretty well, with beautiful hand drawn background stills for most of the time and an overall excellent atmosphere. The rare voice acting is good overall, the animated portions are great and the reading of the text isn't painful. There are one or two game mechanics which could have been handled better, but as this being the first of its kind that I am aware of, I must say the developers did a pretty good job and I am sure they are able to improve the really small annoyances in potential next installments.

Highly recommended if you like to read (interactive) books/thrillers on espionage in the dawn of World War I, because this one is worth it and I really hope to see more digital book adaptions in the future.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996862792', 'num_games_owned': 1560, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1411194266}
review:
I recommend this product, with some caveats ... 

First and foremost, it is NOT a "Game".  This is a digital adaptation of a book.
(Yes, this is in the description, but other recreation of books I've played had the player be able to contribute something to the course/application of the plot.)

Think of it as an eBook, with great atmosphere and some narration.

As such, the interface hoops you have to jump through ... were quite annoying.
* Mouse movements add nothing.
* Making Action/Plot choices, when there is only one option to choose.

If you get this on sale, great.  (i.e. pay as much as you'd pay for a paperback, tops)

author: {'steamid': '76561198084797161', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1659547107}
review: More towards a Visual Digital Novel than a game and it is really awesome. You will enjoy every mouse click while reading the text/stories and interacting with the game. It's unique take is something i was really impressed. Good and beautiful artwork and awesome voice acting kept it going. Looking forward more digital adaption like this. I recommend this to others!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978188676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1410946042}
review: Not so much a game but more of a digital experience.  A very good story is enhanced by the atmospheric music and artwork.  Good voice acting too!  This is really worth playing to experience the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074808906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1410839044}
review:
I am both an avid reader and gamer. Never before have a had these two interests crossover so enjoyably.

The 39 Steps, as portrayed by The Story Mechanics, is a truly gripping narrative experience based on John Buchan's famous espionage thriller. The skill in which a quite dated, albeit spectacular, written work is transformed into an interactive experience is astounding. 

While following Richard Hannay on his adventures, hours turned to minutes. After a while I was neither reading a book nor playing a game but honestly "experiencing" the story for myself. 

The overall tempo combined with the obvious artistic talent seen throughout this adaptation of The 39 Steps creates a digitial experience that can be enjoyed by a far broader audience than a simple book would allow. I would reccomend this game to any reader out there but also to anyone looking for a breath of fresh air, with substance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010147104', 'num_games_owned': 1920, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1465771600}
review:
The story is engaging, but it's tagged casual for a reason.  Having a touch of ADD, i quickly became bored with all the reading and clicking.  So about an hour at a time is all i'll be able to muster through.  I had never heard of this novel, but this game actually makes me want to read it, so it does have that going for it.  It is simple, no learning curve and kids getting into the spy phase might really enjoy this story, and the way it's presented.  You know, kind of a simple entry into the point and click adventures like Myst or Riven.

All in all, a pleasant time.

The 14.99 price tag might be the breaking point though.  If i hadn't picked it up in a bundle, this would have never seen my library... so bundle it up, or steam sale it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094496142', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1502987303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198148056197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1423754569}
review: This is my first review on steam. This game is absolutely awesome! A completely new way to experience a novel. Bought it on sale - would definitely buy more games of this kind from this developer! (I was never a big point and click kind of games fan ('till yet)).

author: {'steamid': '76561198132762380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1410507249}
review: No gameplay, no puzzles or mysteries to solve. No decisions to make. Don't get me wrong I love reading and I read a lot of books but the story was kind of uninteresting and there weren't any exciting events or real conflicts for the main character to overcome. Everything happened too easily. This game is beyond casual to the point of boring. I wouldn't even recomend this to my mother. The game can be completed in under 3 hours. (I had a lot of AFK time in menu screens - whoops). The controls are weird. Works better with my touchpad over my razer mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093178235', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1450276634}
review:
Esto no es ni aventura de click-click.

La verdad que es un fiasco, el jugador tiene 5% de participación, todo lo otro son lecturas. Supongo que la idea es novedosa y tal, pero al ser un juego, si no hay participación del jugador pierde toda la gracia. Yo llevo 6 caps y me está aburriendo muchísimo... si no tuviera logros ya lo habría abandonado.

Si lo pilláis en bundle aún.. pero no recomiendo comprarlo a su precio original por nada del mundo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049061232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1410304315}
review:
This game is a more-or-less interactive rendition of the homonymous book by John Buchan. I haven't read the book but i tend to see as more respectful to the book and therefore tending more to a storytelling version of it. Therefore the game itself hasn't a great deal of anything interactive added to it. 

The real quality added to the story itself is the mode of delivery, because both the visuals (hand painted landscapes) and the overall good voice acting add a value to the game, which otherwise is merely a travel through checkpoints with no chance left to the player. Does this completely make up for the whole game being not truly interactive as one could imagine? No, there are plenty of things (including animations, which are non existent) that could have been done to achieve a better "vision" and overall a better implication of the player. That said tho, it's an interesting experiment, which mostly turns out to be positive because of the plot itself (being exalted by the visuals and voice acting qualities), which isn't never to be taken for granted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056680830', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1416320124}
review:
Playing through the whole story took me close to 4 hours, and having paid £0.99 for the game when it was on sale, I found it to be unbelievable value for money.
It's a hard game to praise, or criticise, as it's not really a "game" in the traditional sense at all. Self styled as a Digital Adaptation, it has varying levels of interactivity, but plenty of depth.
Although I can't really praise the game makers for the story, I can say that it is beautifully exicuted. 

My one complaint is a really daft set of sequences where you need to draw shapes with the mouse in order to make Hannay do things like open doors and windows, or run. They feel awkwardly shoehorned into the game and also make it feel much more like it should have been developed for a touchscreen device.

However, this minor complaint does not take away one jot from the overall experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053062908', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1410367775}
review:
This game, hmm better to say this novel is truly great.
It almost felt like reading a book.

I'm looking forward for more good stuff like this in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968176997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1410306423}
review: I couldn't get into it.  The method for advancing the text is "rotating your mouse clockwise", but frankly it doesn't work very well.  So after getting frustrated with the primary mode of interfacing with this game plus the beginning of the story completely underwhelmed me in how gripping or interesting it is I just stopped.  Mopey guy mopes over his drink mopily... ugh, how many screens are devoted to this?  Forget it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071265962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1388702936}
review:
Es handelt sich hierbei um interaktive Fiktion - nicht um wirklich um ein Spiel. Das bedeutet entsprechend, dass man eine textlich komprimierte Version von John Buchans "Die 39 Stufen" erlebt und nur hin und wieder ein paar interaktive Elemente hat. Das Programm ist also eher etwas für Leseinteressierte als für klassische Spieler. Wer sich auf diese Art von Programm einlassen kann hat dann entsprechend aber ein schönes Erlebnis der Story. Noch ein Hinweis: Das Buch ist von 1915 - man sollte also nicht unbedingt einen Clancy-Roman erwarten.

Etwas buggy ist allerdings das Freischalten der Kapitel bzw. Errungenschaften - 2-3 Kapitel musste ich bis zum erbrechen wiederholen bis das Programm endlich den Erfolg freigab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078573009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1378176625}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025021719', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1532015125}
review: This is not really a game, as there are no actual problems to solve or decisions to make. It's more like an interactive media version of a book. I don't even think it really fits into the visual novel category.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969569846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1418182352}
review:
This game is beautiful.

While it is more of a digital adaptation of a novel then a game, the story really hooks you up.

The narrative feels light and the pace is perfect. I find myself playing it a lot when I get home after work: it works wonders to play the game in short bursts and discover the story bit by bit.

I highly recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561197985208683', 'num_games_owned': 1916, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1488869406}
review:
If you like visual novels, you should consider picking this one up. It's based on a book by Scottish author John Buchanan that was published in 1915. There is no gameplay here. This is purely a visual novel.

The story takes place in and around England and Scotland during 1914 when the United Kingdom is at the cusp of joining the Great War. It is an interesting and compelling work that drives the reader forward with good mystery elements and incredibly well-written dialog.

Please note that it is probably the easiest game on Steam to get 100% achievements for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996774629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1408606061}
review:
I think I have seen all the 39 Steps films the original, remakes and the TV series.
So I was pleased to see this game.
I have never read the book but from what I researched the game follows the book quite accurately. 
I enjoyed the game as it was like reading a book but with some added audio and interaction. 
If you want something relaxing and entertaining then this is for you. 
You do get rewarded with cards and achievements. 
If you’re looking for a challenging puzzle game then look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094083996', 'num_games_owned': 2470, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1450218174}
review:
Not a game, more along the lines of a slightly interactive novel.  Your interactions are mostly limited to dumb stuff like dragging your mouse in certain patterns to open doors and the like, so not much to say on the gameplay front.  Story-wise, the first half-hour or so of the game can drag, but it soon picks up and turns into in an interesting "man on the run" thriller.  The voice acting is solid, and the art direction can be rather nice at times.  The story sucked me in enough that I played the last 2.5 hours of this 3-4 hour game in one day.

If you're interested in a compressed version of the book, you could do far worse than this adaption.  I've never bothered with audio books, but I imagine if you like those, something like this may be an experience you'd might want to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999599511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1408325000}
review:
The first thing to note about this game is that it is barely a game; it is an interactive novel, with only a few player interactions involved in order to move the story along.

That being said, it is a bloody good interactive novel. Having not read the original book beforehand, the story was completely new to me and was very compelling. It is set in London and Scotland in 1914 and is an espionage thriller. If that sounds like your thing, then it is very well worth the ~4 hour playthrough time.

Apart from that, the art is very good in setting up each scene and the voice acting is perfect for conveying each of the characters. Pick this up if you have any vested interest in spy fiction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000232272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1408292625}
review:
This is a graphic adaption of the 1915 book by John Buchan, not an actual game.  You follow this spy yarn by clicking your mouse to progress the story.  There is a lot of reading spiced up with some good voice acting.  Occasionally, you have to perform some very simple searches of a scene in order to get all the exposition provided.

And then there are the silly mouse movements that you have to follow in order to do things like open doors, make telephone calls, or create explosives.  These consist of following the on-screen instructions and matching your mouse movements to the graphic - up, down, left, right, clockwise circle, counter-clockwise circle.

The graphics are 95% static, the only movement being the occasional smokestack spewing smoke, a flag flapping in the wind, or falling rain.  The artwork is lushly handpainted, not your typical computer game graphics.  There isn't much music, but they do a fine job with the voice acting and a few sound effects.

Even if you take your time and read every word carefully, you can reach the end in 5-6 hours.  There are achievements, but they are for completing chapters.  So if you finish the "game", you will get every achievement.

If you don't mind reading a Reader's Digest version of a 100-year old spy novel, then this might possibly be your cup of tea.  I suspect that most of today's gamers would take a pass, but I found it mildly entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049120768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1408277601}
review:
It took me roughtly 5 hours to beat this game. I mostly played offline so it only said I spent 2 hours.
This is not a game actually. It is an interactive graphic novel with lots of conversations. The voice acting, which makes up most of the game, is really fantastic. The sound effects are equalty amazing. I like how the studio treating foot steps, coin flipping, handling twisting, etc with fullhearted devotion. I really like the graphic style as well.
The plot took place in Britain in 1914, right before the First World War broke out. The story deeply intertwined with the crises in the Balkans. This is an adaption of John Buchan's 1915 novel of the same name. I won't let any spoiler bothers you. All I can say is that this game tells a conspiracy theory regarding the casuastion of the war.
This is a thriller. I enjoy every moment of it. I hate it when games trying to use all the annoying puzzles to stir the fluency of a story. You will find no part of that here. 
God I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049291468', 'num_games_owned': 4706, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1681198344}
review: A great game ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014438061', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1425798366}
review: Fantastic visual novel of sorts with a very good immersion in 1914 London and Scotland. If you are looking for a casual point and click with very good art, music and a deep story, this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136783532', 'num_games_owned': 725, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1466466826}
review:
Ciężko jednoznacznie ocenić tę grę, ciężko w ogóle nazwać ją grą. Jest to bardziej książka z interaktywnymi elementami i pięknie  namalowanymi krajobrazami. Klimat Londynu początku XX w oddany wspaniale, o Szkocji też złego słowa nie można powiedzieć. Wspaniałą pracę wykonali aktorzy, rzedko kiedy spoyka się gry z tak dobrym dubbingiem. 
Z drugiej strony The 39 Steps ledwie udaje grę. Większość czasu spędzimy klikając lewy przycisk myszy i czytając/słuchając kolejnych fragmentów histrorii.
Wobec takiego stanu rzeczy uznałem, że The 39 Steps nie będę oceniał jak gry, a jak to czym właściwie jest, czyli interaktywną książkę. W książcę najważniesza jest fabuła, budowanie napięcia, styl, a biorąc pod uwagę, że mamy do czynienia z kryminałem na pierwszy plan wysuwa się zagadka i jej rozwiązanie. I to właśnie za ten ostatni aspekt "gra" dostaje ode mnie ocenę negatywną. Zakończenie jest ogromnie niesatysfakcjonujące, a jeśli dodać do tego niedoskonałości w fabule (nieprawdopodobne zbiegi okoliczności, brak logiki w działaniu głównego bohatera, sztampowość) naszym oczom ukaże się pięknie powiedziana, lecz słaba historia. Sam pomysł na grę-książkę nie jest taki zły, ale literatura musiałby być najwyższych lotów. O The 39 Steps powiedzieć tego nie można.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054228569', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1450734373}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970821777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1406668445}
review: First off, "The 39 Steps" is not a game, it's a sort of interactive novel adapted from John Buchan's book of the same name. While there was little in the name of actual gameplay I really enjoyed "The 39 Steps". I had seen the 1935 Alfred Hitchcock movie but had never read the book and I have to say, developer Story Mechanics is on to something here and I hope future releases are of the same quality. While you do read quite a bit, all dialogue is spoken and the actors do a wonderful job in their parts. The soundtrack is also mysterious and outstanding. I can't recommend "The 39 Steps" to everyone. Especially those who aren't into reading or older books (The 39 Steps was orginally published in 1915) Even if you burn through it, you're still looking at 3.5-4 hours to finish this. But at the end of the rainbow you will get 100% achievements if you're into that thing. This gets an easy 8\10 from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4846, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1406628212}
review:
The 39 Steps is a virtual novel with very little interaction. It is 100% impossible to get stuck on this game, because you've got to left click through text or objects (with a big diamond-shaped icon right in the middle of every objects), or simply do a series of left, down, up, right, clockwise or counter-clockwise mouse movements for every single puzzles in the game.

The only part of this game I liked, are the voice acting and graphics, especially the graphics, they are truly amazing! Though, the important aspect of a virtual novel is the story and in the case of "The 39 Steps" I didin't understand much of the story, it kinda ruined it for me. Now i've got to say, my first language isn't english, but I really couldn't understand the beginning of the story. I also couldn't understand any british dialogues, because they were all slang. Some parts were also in German, with no translation what-so-ever.

Another complaint about this game, is how the game is saved. The ''chapters'' takes about 15 minutes each, but if you want to alt-tab (probably a bug) or quit the game, you might have or might not have to restart that chapter all over again. This made me replay at least 3 chapters (which, by the way, you cannot skip any text or cutscenes) and effectively made me watch all of the dialogues and cutscenes again.

I am quite disapointed with this "game" so I cannot recommend it. If you were going to purchase this virtual novel, I really hope you understand english very well and don't mind not being able to have any influence in the story nor have any puzzles to solve at all while playing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970672461', 'num_games_owned': 2234, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1456957538}
review:
As a story, The 39 Steps is superbly written and acted.  As a game, I struggle to even consider it one.  The amount of interaction afforded borders on insulting mostly consisting of click-to-continue screens and swiping the mouse to match prompts on the screen while the main character opens doors and other objects.  Occasionally you can inspect scenes to find objects relevant to the story but they have no impact on the story itself.  Nearly all the interaction feels like it was included as an excuse to call this a game rather than simply packaging it as a movie or other form of digital story.

If there was a way to turn off all interaction so you could just watch the story I might recommend this but as it stands the token interaction detracts from the story and makes it more of an annoying experience than anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044600422', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1469598336}
review:
If you're looking to take control of an action spy and punch your way to glory, turn back, but if you want to experience an excellent man-on-the-run thriller in a more compact and interactive manner than it's original form then you've found your game. Lets be clear right from the start, this is a faithful adaption of a book, you can't change the outcome, you don't become the main character, and there are no headshot bonuses. So what do you get?

First off each scene is depicted in a beautiful hand-painted style. Given that you lose most of the scene description when you adapt in this manner it's very important that the artwork properly conveys each scene, and they really hit the nail on the head. You get voice acting on at least half of the text, most of the conversations or internal monologues, as well as atmospheric sound effects to add depth to scenes without voice acting. Generally the voices are unique and well done but the "heavy breathing while a character runs" was a little off-putting, at least for me. The final piece to the adaptation is the interactivity. Mostly you simply control the pace of the story but scattered through out are more interactive moments. Completing actions by drawing simple gestures with the mouse and selecting various objects of interest out of a scene make up the most of the interaction. While simple, these moments are well placed and definitely help with immersion. The later also lead to how most of the backstory is delivered. When you pick the objects out of the scene it brings up context and filler for the story often accompanied by historical photographs or newspaper clippings that add depth to the world.

As someone who has not read the original text I felt like I got the whole story and it was much smaller time-sink. The balance between reading, listening, and interacting is precise and kept me interested and engaged.
http://youtu.be/nJgeMgw3WJ8

author: {'steamid': '76561198007695129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1406162069}
review: Jst a few words, am loving this. Having said that I could imagine the orient express being handled in a similar way or any novel by Agatha Christie or maybe even a bit of HP Lovecraft?

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2137, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1450969297}
review:
One thing that I love about video games is how they can take a story I've already heard several ways, and turn it into an entirely new experience that's just as engaging as if I was hearing it for the first time. The 39 Steps by The Story Mechanics is the first in what they call "digital adaptations", which fall somewhere between a visual novel and a radio show. The idea if simple, but the execution highly stylized and the pacing tightly wound to make what could have been a dry collection of text a surprisingly compelling and intense narrative piece.

I shouldn't have to tell you what The 39 Steps is about (as I imagine most should be familiar with the classic novel and numerous film adaptions and spin-offs), but as a refresher it follows Scottish man Richard Hannay, recently retired and now lost in a series of humdrum days and occurrences. All of this changes when a stranger barges into his life and revels a German plot that if carried out could throw the world into a war the likes of which it had yet seen. Shortly thereafter the man, now revealed to a spy known as Scudder, is found dead in Hannay's apartment, leaving him the only one alive with the knowledge of what is soon to unfold, and the only person who could possibly prevent it.

While the narrative of The 39 Steps is as intriguing and thrilling as ever, it's the way that it's told in this instance that makes it worth revisiting (or checking out for the first time) as opposed to numerous other formats you could choose. The Story Mechanics haven't settled for a simple text format in retelling Josh Buschan's tale, instead using a collection of visual tricks and clever insertion of backstory to create an brilliant interactive story that far exceeds the simplistic adaptations that have been experimented with in the past. Fantastic use of camera angles, deliberate placement of text to draw your eye toward parts of the watercolor backgrounds, and excellent voice acting from all parties make it incredibly easy to get swept away in the plot even during the slower, some may even call mundane, moments.

The only real instances where The 39 Steps falls a tad flat are the awkwardly implemented gestures that sometimes accompany moments like opening doors or reading letters. They were obviously intended to make the game feel more like, well, a game, but they're shoehorned in in such a way that feels tacked on an unnecessary. Thankfully they're infrequent enough that they never amount to more than a bit of a bother nor take but a few seconds to complete.

Though some might scoff at the emphasis on exposition and almost complete lack of traditional gameplay, those that can appreciate The 39 Steps for the bit of interactive fiction it is will be rewarded with an exciting and wonderfully paced tale of spies, murder, and more than a few close shaves. Having no real idea what to expect, I was very pleasantly surprised with the end result of The Story Mechanics's first attempt at a "digital adaptation", and it has gotten my mind spinning thinking of so many other books I'd love to see turned into future games. Hopefully this is only the first to come.

[b]You can read more of my writing on [url=http://kritiqal.com/2014/07/16/the-39-steps-review/]Kritiqal[/url].[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197977105828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1454874867}
review:
39 steps is an story-driven adventure about murder and espionage, politics and crime. The story is taken from John Buchan's eponymous 1914 book, and so well-adapted into a game - it lets you experience the story by only giving you remarkable lines and phrases and showing you minimalistic, but well-designed background pictures, thus there is some free room for your imagination (which is a plus about books, but a con when talking about films).

As critics might say, "its a text adventure with background graphics", I strongly recommend to view some videos and get some information about the game before buying it.

For there is a thrilling espionage plot to discover which speeds up after an hour. Interesting characters to meet along the journey from whom one does not know which side they are on. A hunt that begins at London, moves on to Scotland, to go back to England and has its dramatical final at the high circles of politics in London. 

If you haven't read the book yet and fancy for innovative adventure games, you should (first inform yourself about it! and then) give it a try! Oh, and the OST is available for free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040134158', 'num_games_owned': 3274, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1474980717}
review:
Not a game, but a good interactive retelling.

The storytelling itself is solid and refreshing (HOPA genre game makers take note, but also take note this is not a HOPA), but pacing does get a little let down by some of the presentation in parts. 

It is an interesting format for absorbing a text though.  For those unfamiliar with this story. You can seek out the books or the James Bond series which was heavily influenced by this.  The thrilling conclusion doesn't pack the punch that Hitchcock achieved in the film adaption, but Hitchcock rewrote the entire story and meaning of the 39 steps to get that ending.

I don't think this would take anyone 5-8 hours to complete as it says here. I missed one achievement in the playthrough I did  because I was trying more to keep pace with the story than to gain all the badges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120549296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1451815579}
review:
Игра показалась любопытной, когда увидела её в магазине.
Не разочаровала. Может, кому-то покажется скучной. Лучше всего играть без адаптации, послушать шотландскую речь. Это как шотландский виски, желательно пить безо льда, чтобы прочувствовать атмосферу. Читайте все газеты и даже на обороте. Не ленитесь и не спешите всё пролистать. 
Конечно, может быть трудновато с языком, но русификаторов я не встречала, да и мне они не нужны. 
Очень и очень порадовало звуковое сопровождение! Шаги, шорохи, звук двигателя - всё как будто в твоей комнате. Красивые иллюстрации с зелёными шотландскими холмами, серые улицы Лондона, горячо любимые мной теннисные корты. 
Не хватило действий, но оценку это не снижает.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005036424', 'num_games_owned': 2821, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1524074418}
review:
Please note that this recommendation is only based upon the work and effort put into this "piece of art".

It's NOT A GAME at all and almost no interactivity.
The only "freedom" you have is that you're sometimes able to click on objects to get a bit more of the background story,
but that's to be expected in this sort of product.

The awards "ingame" seem to still be bugged (you'll still get all the steam achievements though)
Otherwise worth checking out, especially if you're interested in one of the earliest "man-on-the-run" adventure novels.

7/10 for what it is :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012897997', 'num_games_owned': 4365, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1450446778}
review:
The digital interactive novel is still a medium in its infancy, piggybacking on the video game as its nearest cousin in the entertainment industry. The 39 Steps shows that there is great potential for this medium to spread its wings and achieve legitimacy as a distinct form of entertainment.

The presentation of the events in this work is simply stunning; everything from the artwork to the music to the way the text appears on-screen is always true to the tone of the moment.

The story itself is rather good, too. Many of the characters are absolute delights to see interacting, and the voice work for them is really top notch.

As long as you go into this expecting not a game, but a dynamic and mildly interactive retelling of a classic story, I am sure you will be pleased to play/read/watch it. (Incidentally, we really need a new verb for this.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1404234628}
review:
Si has llegado hasta aquí, probablemente sea debido a una equivocación, igual que me ocurrió a mí. "The 39 steps" tiene un título y logo sugerente, y además lleva la etiqueta "aventura", que eso hace que alguna glándula de mi cuerpo empiece a segregar sustancias aún no descubiertas por la ciencia. El caso es que me encontré con un libro que ni siquiera es interactivo. Sencillamente vas avanzando clic a clic. Nada de opciones. Un libro de "Elige tu propia aventura" es más interactivo que esto. Es el peligro de los bundles, que casi sin pensar añades un cargamento a tu biblioteca sin saber muy bien qué estás almacenando. En cuanto al argumento pues es rollo espías a comienzos del siglo XX. Un título que si no hubiera existido jamás, lo único que habría conseguido es ahorrarme unas horas.

PD: Me ha hecho gracia ver que uno de mis amigos también lo tiene y ha jugado, exactamente 0.1 horas. Vamos, el tiempo justo de abrirlo, ver el percal y cerrarlo.

[b]¿Un libro? ¿De verdad?[/b] A ver, salvo alguna chorrada, es así: sale un párrafo o frase, lo lees, coges el diccionario porque tu inglés no es tan bueno como esperabas, haces clic y aparece el siguiente párrafo o frase. ¿Divertido? No, ¿verdad?
[b]Quizá el libro no esté mal del todo...[/b] Yo valoro juegos, y como juego, esto es una xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx (tranquilo Steam, ya me censuro yo).

author: {'steamid': '76561197966244188', 'num_games_owned': 2380, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1383474412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044602606', 'num_games_owned': 7477, 'num_reviews': 542, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1450229863}
review: Alright, just played through The 39 Steps today. Took about 4 hours all told to complete, although there was probably an hour of idle time mixed in there. Anyway, I thought it was pretty stellar. A digital adaptation of a book. They say it was the inspiration for Ian Fleming style of writing, I think it bore a lot of similarities to Hitchcock's North by Northwest (and it turns out Hitchcock did in fact do a film adaptation of 39 Steps earlier in his career) as well. A very good and interesting story set in the early 1900's. Although there aren't branching paths, I thought the game till did an excellent job of immersing you into the story completely. Sort of non traditional from a point and click perspective due to a little twist in manipulating some object. The artwork was very nice, mostly done in watercolors and more traditional painting styles as well, with some silent film style cutscenes mixed in. Definitely recommend playing this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083655644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1386023650}
review:
I truly love the feel this game delivers. 
A very british feel it is.
the game is well narrated and the mechanics are fairly smooth.
But I'm too lazy to read so much content this game gives me.
So you will have to either read a lot or miss out on a few details.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983004107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1462912047}
review: Great idea, and a really interesting presentation. Like a next level graphic novel

author: {'steamid': '76561198072970122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1382755128}
review:
39 Steps is not really a full fledged game but a very well told story. It's some kind of graphic novel and has one mayor flaw: There are no real people in this game because all characters are shown as a ghostly shadow, if at all. And although this is a questionable design decision the backgrounds are well drawn and the top notch spoken dialogues help the storytelling tremendously. 

But be warned, people who expect a game, it's more like a book(rather novelle)  in a new cover. I still enjoyed the story and dialogues and it kept me interested long enough to finish it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992043944', 'num_games_owned': 1175, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1389971786}
review: Lo recomiendo a la personas que busquen una novela gráfica, tiene un buen argumento y una forma muy entretenida de exponerlo, la historia me mantuvo con intriga desde el principio, lu único malo es que no hay traducción al castellano, ni tan sólo subtítulos...

author: {'steamid': '76561198033498084', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1403995450}
review: This is less of a game, and more akin to a visual novel, nothing you do can affect the outcome, but the graphics, music, and voice acting set a very enjopyable tone. If you want something different, or if you enjoy things like this, then I would reccomend purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999919770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1402282420}
review:
Interesting. A visual novel of the classic World War One era spy novel by John Buchan. You'll follow an English gentleman who has made his fortune in Africa and has grown bored out of his mind, when he stumbles onto an international conspiracy and rapidly gets in over his head.

Beautiful art, funny and innovative storytelling techniques, great music. The interactive segments are integrated with the narration well and feel like they serve the action rather than just pad it out. That said, interactivity is not its main attraction, so if you're not content with story alone this may not be for you.

Recommended with the caveat that this is very much an experience to relax and follow rather than to try and drive forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020601209', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1451809319}
review:
I did it! I finished a campaign just for achievements. And what can i tell. My English language knowledge pretty bad to understand whole game, but it was curious sometimes. As someone said, this game is kinda "book-reading-game". But, it's better to read real book. More exciting and entertainment. Is this game for lazy people.. for those hard to get to read? (as me, yes) 
Maximum is 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043843679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1403107736}
review:
Jednoduše velké zklamání. Nejde o to, že interaktivita je prakticky nulová, ale o příběh, který je překvapivě pěkná slátanina. Mnohdy nelogické a velice často nudné vyprávění rozčeří občas zajímavé momenty. Ty jsou však suverénně zazděny dementním a nezajímavým rozuzlením. Hrdina běhá od čerta k ďáblu, když mu teče do gatí, někomu potká, tomu vše vyklopí (ale já ho fakt nezabil, nekecám), dotyčný mu uvěří a pomůže. No a takhle asi čtyřikrát. Pořád někam utíká, chodí na procházky, kouří cigarety a autoři nám musí barvitě popisovat každou jeho svačinu... Je to NUDA! Občas bezbřehá. Zkombinujme to s neexistující hratelností a naprostá zbytečnost je na světě. S formou nemám problém, interaktivní knížku s poutavým dějem bych si užil, tenhle nelogický a utahaný pokus putavý příběh však smrdí skrz naskrz. Jestli je taková i předloha, zaslouží použít jako toaletní papír pro cvičené orangutany. 4/10 

P.S. Lehce získatelné achievementy jsou fajn a některé pasáže stejně tak, vypatlané zakončení však zanechá pachuť, kvůli které se na podobné projekty budete koukat z patra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028738646', 'num_games_owned': 5753, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1450509902}
review: Çöp moruk

author: {'steamid': '76561198053070206', 'num_games_owned': 9975, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1561858031}
review:
This ain't a game..
This is interactive Visual Novel.. A novel that you watch like a movie..

Truly a masterpiece.
Try it, you won't regret.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6823, 'num_reviews': 1307, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1450572616}
review: It have it's good and bad times, but it's not a game that I can recommend. The art is nice, but story is imperfect. It's just a decent visual novel, without any way to interact in the story. Mostly than having fun time playing, I was just bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031168233', 'num_games_owned': 1631, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1465413915}
review: It just has to be said. It isn't a game. It has no game mechanics that arent obsolete past circa 1994. The lead character is a tired old pastiche of the English Gentleman that you just want to fucking punch in the face and have done with it. It barely lies on this side of plausible, and often toes the line into dangerous wtf territory. Otherwise, it's beautifully painted and by the time I got to the point of not caring, I was almost to the end. This turned into a "sure, why not" completion. And I got it through a bundle. If a pleasure for charming and static artwork and bundled game collecting is your thing, then this game is right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097148378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1404181033}
review: A Book. On Steam. With Achievements. Me likey.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987358915', 'num_games_owned': 3006, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1450885223}
review: Nice way to experience this story, sadly all the atmosphere that was so good in the game is totally ruined by the awful music in the end-game credits.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992801270', 'num_games_owned': 3933, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1394313458}
review: It's an interesting concept, but it failed to draw me in.  Some of the art and styling is indeed visually striking, but most of the voice acting just couldn't captivate my attention.  I didn't expect this to be a true "game" but even as a "visual novel" I think that this could've been a bit better paced and polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962797165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1400344952}
review: Langweilig !

author: {'steamid': '76561197989433341', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1402473274}
review: Boring story, Mary Sue protagonist with immense charisma and luck. Also awful controls (who could think it is a good idea to use moving mouse in circles for going to the next/previous piece of text?). Also those mini games where you have to do mouse gestures to open a door or make a bomb are ridiculous. The ending is very bad too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054288706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1401373241}
review:
This game marries a mixed bag of good and bad art to intrusive and dull interactive moments: you'll click a small number of objects to look at them, and you'll swipe your mouse to open a door or trim your mustache. The voice acting is sometimes okay. The gestures and clicks required to take you from one story element to the next feel intrusive and poorly chosen; the pace is significantly marred by the design.

You're better off reading the novel, or watching Hitchcock's fantastic adaptation.

1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198086061585', 'num_games_owned': 2345, 'num_reviews': 384, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1402215213}
review:
The story is ok although the first part is boring a bit.

Cinematic cutscenes are great. I like that style of this game.

And for the achievements hunters, you must play this game because it's way too easy to earn all achievements. Just play through the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003386778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1401674463}
review:
This was a delightful experience, even though there's no game in it. It is a visual novel with very little interactivity thrown in. To be honest the interactivity is actually done badly. There's no purpose for it and it's just a nuisance overall.

Still, as a visual novel, The 39 Steps really shines. The visuals are beautiful and interesting, the ambient sounds and voice acting are superb. I'd just sit in during some of the scenes and savour its ambience.

The characters are presented as outlines on top of lush backgrounds and it's fun to imagine them. As you play you unlock cards which give a bit of characters' backgrounds and show their appearance. These are accessible through the menu. I only found out about them once I was done with the story but I think it made the story all the more enjoyable to just imagine how the people looked.

If you're into visual novels this is a nice one. Just don't go looking for a game in here because there's none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028443846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1487277423}
review: In most of cases I really like point & click games. But sadly that one is very boring. I thought that game on base of book would be more interesting. In my opinion the price for this game is too high, I do not recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054415415', 'num_games_owned': 1707, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1470627968}
review: The art is really nice to look at, good voice acting, music and sound effects. The story is good. The "interactive" part wasn't really my thing (like having to do gestures to open a door) I thought it was just put in there to try and make this more of a game. An option menu would have been nice so you can change sound levels and resolution. (Unless it was there and I couldn't find it) You can really tell the developers put a lot of effort into this, I'm not even into interactive novels and I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101791859', 'num_games_owned': 1054, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1401386486}
review:
The Thirthy-Nine Steps is one of the earliest and arguably most influential novel in the history of espionage thriller. The book by John Buchan, published in 1915, is now public domain which means the devs could get away with anything in this digital adaption. But what surprised me is they were extremely loyal to the plot. This digital adaption is even told in 1st person like the original work. They did not offer any changes, which can be termed as lazy. But a novel that doesn't need change shouldn't be changed anyway. Voice acting is good. Story-telling is done right. The only thing that bugged me is the lack of character "appearance" in the artwork. But that's not a big deal. Anyway, this is a good digital adaption of the novel and I highly recommend it.

Warning - Do not buy if you're looking for a game. This is NOT a game, not even a point and click game. This is basically a audio novel with some relevant artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067359975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1450974545}
review:
Dies ist kein Game!!!
Es ist mehr ein Buch, das gelesen wird. Es wird nicht viel verlangt, nur lesen und ab und zu ein Mausklick, um Personen zu  bewegen, damit zu sprechen oder Türen zu öffnen.

Voraussetzung ist hier die englische Sprache und am Anfang habe ich mich etwas schwer getan, da ich einige englische Wörter nicht kannte oder wußte (die Sprachauswahl bietet nur zwei Möglichkeiten: Englisch (mit Dialekt oder ohne) und Gälisch!). Aber nach einer Weile ging es. Die Geschichte ist ein wenig undurchsichtig, aber sie packt einen und man möchte wissen wie es weitergeht (bei mir war es so). Die Errungenschaften sind leicht zu bekommen.

Dieses "Spiel" ist eine willkommene Abwechslung zu den anderen Games und mir hat es Spaß gemacht. Wer allerdings mit Büchern oder einer dahinplätschernden Story nicht viel anfangen kann sollte die Finger hiervon lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048860781', 'num_games_owned': 2608, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1400111660}
review: This is not a game where you have to play the game as such. It is a visual novel where you use the mouse to interact and learn more of the story (similar to TWD). Essentially this is an interactive novel. It is good and can be completed in under 4 hours. It is set in 1914 England, just before the first world war and tells the story about preventing an assassination event.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009229716', 'num_games_owned': 1440, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1450377136}
review: Nu chiar un joc, mai degraba o adaptare a unei carti intr-o aplicatie frumoasa, care te trece prin toata cartea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122058108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1399846368}
review: Bought this game on a whim on a Weeklong sale, and was not disappointed. This game does take the form of an interactive story, rather than a true action/adventure game; so those looking for that type of experience may want to steer clear. But for those of you who simply want to get immersed in an enthralling (indeed, classic) story complete with richly drawn environments, a fine score, and superb voice acting, this is absolutely the game for you. It's also a quick game, and can probably be completed in a few sittings if you find yourself with some spare time on your hands. Overally, a very good experience for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096888713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1399899313}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044757546', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1472155760}

Nice artwork and voiceover, but sometimes starts to be boring, and the interactive parts are a bit dumb and unnecessary.
Overall it's not bad, interesting adaptation of a book. The movie was slightly more fast paced where they added a female protagonist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060370983', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1399396910}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040127542', 'num_games_owned': 1911, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1561608286}
review: 约翰•巴肯的同名小说改编，游戏性一般，文本量比较大，还好对话有语音，配音一般般，配乐不错。全成就比较容易获得。

author: {'steamid': '76561197988082033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1652658983}
review:
Interactive fiction is something I've longed for for many years.  With the dawn of gaming PCs and e-books, I fully expected an explosion of the sub-genre, but very few surfaced after the era of "choose your own adventure" paperbacks and the Zork text adventure games.  Japanese manga took sole ownership of the visual novels, which left linear interactive novels without a landlord or tenant.

As an ardent Hitchcock fan, I was thrilled to see another modern adaptation of Buchan's "The 39 Steps."  Up to this point I'd never heard of its developer, The Story Mechanics, but Steam's frequent sales made for a relatively risk-free purchase.  I expected a loose narrative voiceover with a focus on visuals in the spirit of Myst and Dear Esther, but I got a fairly straightforward rendition of Buchan's work, with occasional interactivity which can mostly be ignored if the reader/player wishes to maintain the flow of the narrative.  In all, given the the modern interactive novel of this type is mostly newly broken ground, I highly recommend this simply to experience something a little different: a compelling narrative set to beautiful hand-painted visuals, with some very capable voice acting.  I hope this title finds a degree of success because I would love to see more follow in its footsteps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046710719', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1399298246}
review:
This is a digital adaptation, not a game.
It's damn good at what it does. The voice acting is top notch. I never found myself being critical of the actors. The art work was excellent and really depicted the scenes well. 
The only mark on this experience was that although the music was fitting, some of the melodic and atmospheric tracks suffered from improper looping.
Other than that, it was a truely immersive experience.
With that said, I would recommend this at $15 or less. Why? If you enjoy these sorts of productions then you can't go wrong with this one, and perhaps the proceeds will funnel into the next project, of which you may be awaiting like myself, with great anticipation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037788664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1451135001}
review: I knew a digital story would not involve much action, but here, the pace is really too slow for me and there are so little actions that it does not feel like a game a all. Books and films are definitely better suited for heavy narrative, but some games manage to use the interactivity and still be heavily story orientated. This one unfortunately does not manage to do that, so there is not much reason to play that instead of reading the book or watching the film.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083862196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1399140198}
review: good game 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198061668585', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1423354852}
review:
Der Plan war, dieses Spiel einfach nur anzuspielen. 4 Stunden später und am Ende der Story hinterließ es mich mit einem "Wow" in meinen Gedanken. Die Story wurde perfekt umgesetzt. Die Interaktionen im Spiel halten den Spieler bei Laune und machen ihn nicht nur zum "Texte-Weiterklicker". 

Wer Action erwartet, wird enttäuscht. Hier wird interaktiv eine Geschichte erzählt und man durchlebt die Höhen und Tiefen des Protagonisten in seiner schwierigen Situation. Wer auf tiefe Stories steht, der sollte The 39 Steps unbedingt spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024973406', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1452672960}
review: Extremely well-presented visual novel here. I finished the whole thing in one sitting and thoroughly enjoyed it. I hope the company endeavours to continue to bring us more of the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051705794', 'num_games_owned': 8007, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1398548287}
review:
Wo fange ich an .... was ist "The 39 Steps" überhaupt?

Genau wie bei "Dear Esther", ist die Umschreibung für dieses [u]-Gaming Experiment-[/u] sehr schwer ...
Was lässt sich im allgemeinen über "The 39 Steps" sagen?

Das Game, basierend auf eine Novelle von John Buchan, fesselt einen ab der ersten Minute,
mit einer sehr interessanten Story, wenn man mutig genug ist sich auf diese einzulassen.
Um was es geht, ganz einfach: [spoiler]**SPOILER**[/spoiler], mehr nicht.
(Spoiler = spielt es selbst, traut euch einfach xD)

Man macht eigentlich nicht viel, man klickt hier und dort, untersucht per klick, 
klingt langweilig, ist es nicht!!

Denn was viel wichtiger ist, man soll und muss zuhören, lesen, das gezeigte visualisieren!!

Wieso?!

"The 39 Steps" überzeugt, mit einem tollem, der Novelle entnommenen, Setting.
Lässt einen in ein London des Jahres 19.. eintauchen und zeigt einem ein sehr tolles Schottland auf 
und schafft durch den grafischen Stil, sehr zu begeistern.

Aber was mir bei weitem mehr gefallen hat, war die extrem gute Vertonung, mit erstklassigen Sprechern.
Vorausgesetzt man ist des englischen mächtig :)
Sie schaffen es mit jedem gesprochenem Wort, die Geschichte lebendig werden zu lassen.

Was auch dem Game entspricht, dass einige Erzählungen, in einem, der damaligen Zeit üblichen Wochenschau gezeigt werden
und somit die Atmosphäre weiter abrundet.

Vielleicht sollte ich erwähnen, dass einem die vorkommenden Personen als Rauchgestalten vorgestellt werden.
das ist nicht blöd, sondern ein sehr guter Trick um sich in die Story einzuarbeiten, ein Teil von ihr zu werden.

Selbstverständlich bekommen die Personen, durch im Game zu sammelnde Karten, später auch ein Gesicht.
Und ich muss zugeben, dass die von mir ausgebauten Personen meist ihren Karten sehr nahe kamen.


Tja, dies ist mein kleiner Einblick zu "The 39 Steps" ....
mit abschließender Bewertung .... jedenfalls mir hat "The 39 Steps" sehr gut gefallen 
und würde mich über ein weiteres Game von The Story Mechanics freuen.



Grafik: 9 von 10
Sound: 10 von 10
Spielzeit: nicht wichtig
Idee: 10 von 10
Story: 10 von 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998626930', 'num_games_owned': 5326, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1397999619}
review: good story, it gets more intresting after a few "chapters". 7/10. Definitely worth half of its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062317837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1461157133}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025188158', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1470370567}
review:
I'd never have known this story were it not a game. 
To call it a video game would be a stretch and a visual novel is still not quite correct either. 
It's an interractive book about international spy espionage and a conspiracy for war back in 1914 and it's up to a man named Richard Hannay to stop it.

It's a thrilling read. At times it's a bit confusing but I certainly loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983612330', 'num_games_owned': 2735, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1450385225}
review: 4/10, até gostei do conceito mas muito mal executado,.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970336927', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1397803026}
review: Great story adaptation

author: {'steamid': '76561198098342214', 'num_games_owned': 10621, 'num_reviews': 593, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1450453477}
review: This "game" looks an excellent adaptation of the novel. 10/10

review: I got this game from a indiegala bundle long ago. I'm glad that I got it for less than a dollar, because to be honest, it's not my type of game. Ok I admit, it's not a game. Anyways, I'm not going to downrate the game just because I don't like interactive novels. I've got to say, for an interactive novel it's pretty good, so if you're interested in mystery stories, go for it. Then again, heed my warning. If you want a game, and not a novel, then this is a no go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 614, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1458115589}
review:
I'm not gonna call it a game. It's an interactive novel with very unnecessary interactivty. It is based on another novel of the same name from the early 1900s.
Least to say the story was at least very compelling to the point where it had me hooked enough to want to know what happens next until the end of Hannay's little adventure here.

I suppose if one wishes to check it out, don't expect gameplay. Just a story with, what I feel, unneeded interacting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075190086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1396112217}
review: Very well done!  The voice acting was superb, the artwork set the proper mood, and the telling of the story kept me interested every step (pun intended) of the way.  I can only hope that The Story Mechanics are in the process of developing more of this type of entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974729809', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1395695339}
review:
I bought this as the novel is one of my favorites. Don't expect it to be anything other than a narrated story - because that's all it is. However, given the low price I paid for this game, I was actually pleasantly suprised at the enjoyment I got out of it. The music really helps set the mood for each scene and the voice acting is mostly spot on (exactly the right about of cheesy stereotypical early 1900s British accents, but they didn't do their homework well enough for the German ones, I felt). The UI was odd at first, but after a while I realised it was much more involving than just left-clicking all the time.

One word of warning to anyone who expects to be able to be allowed to work on breaking the code that is given to you: once you get the ciphertext, don't play on or the game will just give you the key without any obvious warning that it's going to do so. That was the one thing that I was sure that they would have worked on with this game, which was a tad disappointing.

All in all, good for a few hours of entertainment and bit of a nostalgic kick for me.

UPDATE 25-03-2014: I just saw this game priced at €9.99. It's not worth that at all. You'd be better getting the book at that price. Wait until it's at least under a fiver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025512901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1395695110}
review:
This is not realy a game, but a digital novel.

After my experience with another game in this genre (Dear esther) I did not think i would ever enjoy one.
That's why i was even more amazed with the joy i got out of playing this one.

I realy can't find anything that could have been improved in this game.

I give this game a well deserved 10/10.

pros:
* extremely well adapted digital novel
* superb immersion in the story
* superb arstyle
* although the kind of interaction is very limited, it seems just right to add some value.
* it has plenty of convenient stopping points, but the way i see it, those will only be very short intermissions

cons:
* not realy a game
* no replay value

author: {'steamid': '76561198125816359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1450624368}
review: A clever adaptation of a gripping story, beautiful artwork and great atmosphere. I thoroughly enjoyed playing through The 39 Steps and look forward to seeing more from The Story Mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034163291', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1450413188}
review:
Gameplay - The 39 Steps is like an interactive combination of a book andmovie with very limited gaemeplay.  Essentially, there are parts where you have to click and drag the mouse up, down, right, or left and in a clockwise and counterclockwise manner.  In addition there is pointing and clicking similar to point and click adventure games but without any puzzles.  This undoubtedly sparks a debate as to is it a game or not?  In my opinion it is, because you do have some interactions and you can miss achievements if you don't try to experience all of the options in the game.  If this lack of gameplay does not sound good to you, I would recommend avoidng this game.

Story - The focus of 39 Steps is the story which is set right before World War I in England and Scotland.  It is a spy thriller, but feels close to Sherlock Holmes in my opinion.  Much like in Dickens, there is a lot of happenstance or good fortune that you don't see in modern stories, but I think that is part of the charm of a story like this.  I love many things set in World War I and appreciate British literature so for me this was a very enjoyable combination.  The story starts a little slow, but once it picks up, it is really good and I had trouble not wanting to play through the whole story as fast as I could to find out what would happen.  There are some thick Scottish accents and a few British words that Americans don't know or use, but overall, if this story sounds at all appealing to you, then you will enjoy the story.

Presentation (Graphics and Sound) - There are a few simple cut scenes, but most of 39 Steps is painted background images with text over top.  Fortunately, these are all very attractive and help you "see" the story.  There are also authentic looking maps and pictures from this era of history which was also appreciated.  The sound is really solid and the voice acting is well-done.  Hearing the protagonist pant after running or yawn after waking up makes the story come to life.  For an Indie game, I thought the presentation of the game was very good and it enhances the story.

Overall - The 39 Steps may have limited appeal because of its lack of gameplay and historical setting, but I loved the four hours I played and thought it was totally worth buying on sale.  If you're looking for perfect games, the achievements are very easy to get and only require that you play through the game and look at/inspect every item or option as you go through the story.  It doesn't get any easier or quicker than this.  If you think this game sounds fun or interesting, then I highly recommend buying it because I really enjoyed it.

8.0 (Out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071746682', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1450356683}
review:
Hard to believe this well-written story is almost 100 years old :o

+Better story than [insert generic vampire/zombie novel here]
+Amazing backdrops!
+Great voice acting (although I could not understand half of it even with subtitles ><)
+Chapter-based "play" makes progress manageable (easy to pick up where you left off)

o Maybe the story could be a little more interactive? (eg. walking around, having animations, actually decoding the notebook)

- After the intense build-up the conclusion seems a little abrupt
- Lack of actual gameplay may turn some people off

DISCLAIMER: I have not read the actual novel

10/10 Looking forward to the next adaptation by The Story Machanics

review: 超级棒的小说改编游戏，在日常紧张的生活之余。如果你懒的翻动书本，以及懒的去找原著汉化版来翻阅的话。当然也有电影的说。就是一部小说而已。32个赞！另外我想起了AVG类型的GALGAME...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996552495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1394921013}
review:
The 39 Steps is a digital adaption of a John Buchan's espionage thriller.
And since I don't want to spoil the story for anyone still waiting to enjoy it, I won't reveal any story details.
But I will say this, the story is brilliant and has a lot of twists and turns and will keep you hooked till the end. At least that's how I've felt. 
The art in the game is absolutely gorgeous and the sound design is spot on as well. This is like reading a book, but you interact ingame with a mouse at certain situations and click objects on screen such as newspapers or items of interest. There are also times where you have to imitate real movements with a mouse ( sort of like in Fahrenheit / Indigo Prophecy if you have played that game).
There are also cards to collect and awards to unlock while playing the game, which is a nice touch for all those people like myself who enjoy collecting things.
All in all:

+ Great story
+ Beautiful art design
+ Good sound effects and acting

- If you dont like reading a lot, this game is not for you

If you are looking for a great thriller story accompanied by great art design and acting, you are going to enjoy this game. 9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197969208726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1394855371}
review:
Just finished this after buying it some time ago. I've never read the book or seen any of the adaptations, so the story was brand mew to me. 

The story was fantastic. The atmosphere that was created by the music, sound, art, voice acting, and UI is top-notch. It was an immensely enjoyable experience. I'll be purchasing the next adaptation (when's that coming?). 

Thanks for taking a chance on buildiung this (Unity *IS* a great tool), and also thanks to the Scotland Innovation for funding it. We need more experiences like this to go along with the conventional games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009732559', 'num_games_owned': 1580, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1464474840}
review: It's hardly a game, but it's a pretty good story. The sound sets it apart though from other visual novels. The sound of the rain, the sound of Hanney eating biscuits, and even the Scottish dialogue that I could only understand half of really pulls you in to play another chapter.
