author: {'steamid': '76561198101802351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1471996109}
review:
Трудно дать оценку The 39 Steps, ведь она больше похожа на интерактивную книгу, чем на игру. 
В основу игры лег сюжет одноименного романа Джона Бакена "39 ступеней", который до этого был не раз экранизирован в кино, в том числе Альфредом Хичкоком. История довольно интересная, несмотря на скомканую концовку, и представляет собой шпионский детектив в лучших его традициях. 
Большую часть геймплейного времени составляет чтение, которое изредка разбавляется вставками для действий (поиск предметов в помещении, рисование стрелок для открытия замков и прочие простейшие действия).
Радует художественное оформление - иллюстраторы постарались на славу и смогли создать отличный визуальный ряд, который гармонично дополняет чтение.
Также порадовало озвучивание диалогов - прекрасная передача английского и шотландского акцентов.
Подводя итоги: игра явно на любителя, но я не могу дать ей отрицательную рекомендацию, так как разработчики выполнили все на должном уровне. Если вы не знаете английского и/или не любите читать, то вам не стоит брать эту игру. Если же вы с английским на "ты" и не прочь разбавить свой игровой опыт подобным произведением, то, возможно, вам стоит обратить внимание на The 39 Steps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088093310', 'num_games_owned': 2726, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1394575982}
review: Well what can I say about this game then? I will never get those 3 hours back. Bottom line is this is THE most boring "game" I have ever played in my life. I thought Dear Esther was a bad game and couldn't even consider that as a game. This, well this is just rediculous. The only reason I bought this was to get the 100% achievements as they are so easy (not that I don't mind a challenge) but in hindsight, if I had known how boring this would be I probably wouldn't have even bothered and put those 3 hours I spent on this into a game worth my while. It isn't even a game! It's more like a point and click interactive book!! So bad. And what made me laugh was how many people were actually involved in creating this game from having to wait for the credits to finish at the end to get the last achievement. Dust An Elysium Tale had 1 person only make the whole game and it's about a million times better than this crap! Please don't waste your time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969408128', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1675520316}
review:
It was a very special experience to play this game. The digital adaptation added much to the atmosphere of the story. Playing the game or rather clicking my way through the episodes was actually as thrilling as pure reading of the book would have been, but it was nice watching the brilliant illustrations and listening to the dialogs and to the background noises and fine music. 

For me personally it was definetly not the last game of this kind I will be playing. Thumbs up. Thank you.

Sincerely,
Frank

author: {'steamid': '76561198122754668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1394127629}
review: Отличная интерактивная книга. Жаловаться на геймплей в интерактивной книге - все равно, что жаловаться на геймплей в обычной. ) Персонажи озвучены с душой, пейзажи прекрасно прорисованы, все декорации крайне правдоподобны, авторы активно сотрудничали с библиотеками и прочими просветительскими учереждениями. Есть еще забавные анимационные вставки. ) Хорошее знание английского обязательно, для господ знающих толк в извращениях, есть еще галльский язык.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000861562', 'num_games_owned': 3271, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1450628284}
review:
This is an interactive novel by John Buchan. I would describe it as a mixture of reading a book and listening to a number of conversations. There is NOT much gameplay envolved, except clicking a few items here and there, and to draw some patterns. The story is about Richard Hannay and his escape from London. Many things happens along the way, and this is where the story shines. Its a little bit hard to understand what some scottish and english people are saying due to dialects and use of old words.

If you enjoy reading books and you want a good story, without gameplay getting in your way, this is a great game. If you like other "non-games" like Dear Easter, Proteus or Gone Home this might be the right experience for you as well.

Many others will however HATE this, because they will not see it as a game. Other people in my age will also dislike this game because they thing reading is boring, and games without gameplay is a waste of time. 

I really liked this visual novel and its story, and the art is absolutely fantastic. The voice acting is top-notch and also the music.  The developers obviously put a lot of time and efford into this project and therefore it earns my recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050967938', 'num_games_owned': 2986, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1479339614}
review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lTFPyWYmCsk

author: {'steamid': '76561198025454883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1458048204}
review:
The 39 Steps leads you on a journey through lush hand-painted backgrounds, moody music, and excellent voice-acting. You are Richard Hannay, a well-to-do British gent living a boring life in London in 1914.

Calling 39 Steps a game seems to be doing it a disservice, as it is more of a interactive story that just has you along for the ride.  There are points in the story where you 'control' the protoganists action, but you have no real power to affect the momentum of the narrative. The story is gripping, though, and these attempts to insert a more direct hand in the game are infrequent.

I have never read the source material, so cannot say how well it holds up to the original. The 39 Steps stands well enough on its own, though. 

Achievement hunters interested in 100% games will find this one easy to complete, as achievements are awarded through story progression and are impossible to miss. I'd recommend not reading the achievement list before you start the story, though, as they could spoil some future events.

So, if spy thrillers are your thing, grab up your pipe and your brandy and dive into this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988931399', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1553756631}
review: I found this to be a wonderful experience, but it certainly won't be everyone's cup of tea. You interact with the plot, but only to drive it almost constantly forward and there is no branching of any kind. However, despite that rigid structure, the presentation of the world and characters is beautiful. The graphics are generally quite static, but commonly overlaid with subtle animation, lighting effects and focus shifts so that it never feels like you're really looking at just a still image. The voice acting, music and sound editing are also exceptional and I must confess that I liked that they didn't dumb down the period vocabulary or authentic accents. It is a slow affair, however. I really wouldn't be able to argue with someone who finds the story plodding. Still, as a fan of classic Hitchcock, games like The Last Express and Dear Esther, and the works of Agatha Christie, I quickly connected with this interactive novel and consider it a very worthy addition to my virtual library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011231319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1394400844}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962810502', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1388219723}
review:
Had I understood what I was going to play before I started I might have enjoyed it a little more. I was expecting a heavily interactive adventure game but instead found myself on a linear path that occasionally asked me to poke around a bit with the mouse. This all left a rather bad taste in my mouth creating a distraction from being able to palate the storyline at first.

Albeit the story itself is easily addicting once you get past the dull introduction of the protagonist, but then again I guess that might be the point! Much like his life things start off quite uneventful but quickly snowball into a suspense filled thriller that has you truly fearing for his life every time things heat up.

That aside the scenes in this are gorgeous and immersive MOST OF THE TIME. Occasionally you are required to execute some gestures with the mouse while staring at very ugly black and white real life stills, and watch some horrendous silhouette cut-scenes. I felt these elements created random and abrupt interruptions from the world they were painting with the main styling.

It has its ugly moments BUT I found this to be a fascinating escape from what we normally consider to be a game in the end.

Feeling casual? CHECK IT OUT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008576331', 'num_games_owned': 2346, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1471957805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073413562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1463449306}
review: They've taken a good book, and turned it into a great experience. From the beginning straight through to the end the player is grabbed by the collar and pulled into the world and lot of Richard Hannay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970879514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1390160041}
review: I like reading. I read everynight before bed. I immediatly found this game frustrating. Everything just went so slow. I was ready to read. Instead, I would read a tiny bit, then wait... read a tiny bit, then wait... I'd say just read the book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078606461', 'num_games_owned': 1573, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1462598758}
review: It's an easy 20 achievements and easy perfect game to get. That's about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013591632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1387774742}
review:
This is an interactive novel that starts out slow but it can draw you in with the characters, story, and atmosphere it creates. Although it is not something I would normally listen to, I liked the music since it added suspense and matched the pace of the story. The hand-drawn scenery of the Scottish countryside helped illustrate what the author described and was enjoyable and relaxing to watch. Overall, the presentation of the story was well done and I felt the people responsible for the presentation were passionate about the story they wanted to portray.
I have not read the original book and I do not tend to read novels that have not been assigned to me. This was an exception. Not only did I enjoy the story, but I also enjoyed the way the author depicted fear and paranoia and used suspense to build up a sense of imminent danger for the main character.
For anyone considering buying this novel, I think adding this interactive novel to your steam library will give you a far different (and better) experience than adding another game. Hey! It is called a steam library, so why not add a book?

author: {'steamid': '76561198058897818', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1450553252}
review:
Non è un vero e proprio videogame, ma una libro digitale illustrato. 
La storia e i disegni sono molto belli e mi hanno tenuto incollato allo schermo fino alla fine.
Lo consiglio fortemente, ma tenete presente che non è un gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052478802', 'num_games_owned': 3342, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1393074078}
review: Take a classic thriller novel, add limited animation, mood-setting background music, solid voice acting at key junctures, and very simple point-and-click segments. You get The 39 Steps. As long as you expect absolutely no player agency whatsoever, you'll have fun clicking your way through the tale that inspired Ian Fleming to create James Bond.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985059140', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1368774000}
review:
I've played through the entire game and really enjoyed it. The dialogue, ambient sound, music, [i]beautiful[/i] artwork, and text combine well to set the mood and create an immersive experience not unlike the feeling one gets when reading a novel.

You should understand that there is very little gameplay in [i]The 39 Steps[/i]. It is a visual novel, not so much a game. But don't let that deter you from playing. While text is the primary means of conveying the story, there aren't any walls of text to read. Instead, you'll be reading a few sentences here and there while you watch and listen. (There are some newspaper clippings with long articles, but it isn't necessary to read them except to further immerse yourself in the story's world. None contain information integral to the plot.)

[i]The 39 Steps[/i] hews pretty closely to the novel on which it is based (by John Buchan), [i]not[/i] the Alfred Hitchcock movie which diverges pretty significantly from the novel.

The experience of playing [i]The 39 Steps[/i] stayed with me for a long time afterward. I later found myself seeking other similar games in an effort to recreate the experience. I never did find any quite like this one. The closest I discovered was [i]Dear Esther[/i], but that game's narrative structure is much more ambiguous. [i]The 39 Steps[/i] employs a more traditional novel-like story structure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965117944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1392491314}
review: Tycker du om att spela spel men inte har tid? Då är detta ett spel för dig, du känner dig nöjd efter 5 minuter och det är inklusive installationstiden!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024537927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1497130508}
review:
Really loved playing this game although its mostly a point-click game
but enjoyed its thrilling story which encourages you to complete the 
game in one-sitting and a good break from the modern AAA games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969256634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1391900409}
review:
Sitting down and reading a good book, immersing one self in the story, is a great feeling.  But what if you could experience a book.

This is what The Story Mechanics has achieved with The 39 Steps.

They've taken a good book, and turned it into a great experience.  From the beginning straight through to the end the player is grabbed by the collar and pulled into the world and lot of Richard Hannay.  

The 39 Steps is recommended to anybody who likes adventure games, but also loves a good story.  The latter being important as there is not much in terms of 'gameplay' in this experience, rather the player is providing a helping hand in forwarding the story at their own pace.

An excellent example of how a book can be turned into an interactive experience.  An experience that should not be missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024253308', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 574, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1450225704}
review:
Και αυτό είναι λοιπόν το The 39 Steps. Ένα τολμηρό πείραμα με τη μορφή του e-book στον 21ο αιώνα. Με την εξαιρετική του καλλιτεχνική διεύθυνση και ατμοσφαιρική παρουσίαση, είναι μια κομψότατη εναλλακτική στην απλή παρακολούθηση μια ταινίας ή την ανάγνωση ενός «σκέτου» paperback. Παιχνίδι δεν είναι, όποιος το πλησιάσει ως τέτοιο θα απογοητευτεί, καθώς κάνει το Dear Esther να μοιάζει φεστιβάλ διαδραστικότητας. Είναι όμως εξαιρετικό σε αυτό που προσφέρει και σε βάζει σε σκέψεις. Αν οι Story Mechanics έκαναν τόσο προσεγμένη δουλειά σε αυτό τον «κλασσικό» τίτλο, σκεφτείτε τι θα μπορούσε να γίνει με αντίστοιχες μεταφορές σε έργα των H.P. Lovecraft, Edgar Allan Poe και γιατί όχι, Chuck Palahniuk.

Διαβάστε περισσότερα στο www.ragequit.gr

author: {'steamid': '76561197999246473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1510169498}
review:
I purchased this game thinking it would be interactive fiction of the type I grew up with, only modernized. Obviously I hadn't researched it enough beforehand, but I was familiar with the piece it's based on which made it a quick sell.

At first I was furious! This wasn't interactive fiction! Where's my command interpreter?

10 minutes on and I was curious. Fine, it wasn't interactive fiction as I knew it. This was something else. Something worth investigating.

20 minutes in and I was hooked. It felt like I was being ushered along by a storytelling mannequin in the most stunning of garbs. The depth and nuance of the written work was there, dressed differently but most certainly there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012039630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1391429517}
review:
Don't expect too much "game"with this title.  You're pretty much relegated to bystander with occasional interraction to move the story along.

The story is a classic though and that was enough to make me at least want to play to the finish - which I did in about 3 hours.

I'd only recommend for nostalgia sake and if was cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 928, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1552904607}
review:
Bem, primeiramente, isso não é um jogo e sim uma aventura literária multimídia, um "jogo" único em seu formato. A historia é muito bem escrita e é muito envolvente, arte do jogo é maravilhosa e a parte de efeitos sonoros e musica, melhor ainda. Para quem gosta de ler um bom livro de espionagem, eu aconselho, já se espera um jogo, de o fora.

-----
Well, first, this is not a game but a multimedia literary adventure, a unique "game" in its format. The story is very well written and is very engaging, game art is wonderful and part of sound effects and music, even better. For anyone who enjoys reading a good book spy, I advise you to buy it, if you expect a game, give up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024440251', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1452674344}
review:
Let me state the obvious that most others have stated already - IT'S NOT A GAME! It's an interactive novel.

With that being said, I have seen the '59 movie of this novel (never read it) and enjoyed it back then. With this interactive novel telling the story I thought to 'play' it. And play is quite the right name thoughit's not a game. You're browsing through the interactive novel from chapter to chapter.

Sadly, I started this one with a splitting headache and had to stop uit during chapter one. I hope that the headache is over tomorrow when I'll start it again...

author: {'steamid': '76561198050101106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1390607271}
review: As the other reviews were clear about it. This is not a game in the sense we know about. As the other guys reviews also said, this is an interactive story telling. I couldn't get myself to go through it as I felt there is too much reading/listening and I would be better off using this time playing one of my many other games. If you're looking for any kind of action, then go away, it's not for you. If you are patient and like reading and have 4 hours to spare. Go ahead, you might like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052771674', 'num_games_owned': 1771, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1391131512}
review:
Not a book, and not quite a movie, The 39 Steps is hard to describe.

If you've played any, this game is probably most like playing Visual Novels, except the story is on a set course and there are no choices to be made. Instead interactivity comes from other places: You preform certain actions that have no real impact on the story, and get to choose exactly how deep you get into details and backstories. 
If that sounds a bit boring, it's really is a lot more like reading a book than playing a video game based on one, and I suggest you approach it as such.  

Visually, it's very impressive. The text is accompanied by beautiful backgrounds mixed with old photographs and very fun animations, directed in such a way that really makes the text dance.

Fair warning though, this game is quite obviously really aimed for touch devices, the mechanics would work a lot better there than on PC, and it lacks real customization options, so if you have the option go play it on one of those, if you don't it won't bother you too much though.

All in all, I'm definitely looking forward to their next work. This is a very unique and new way to experience books, so if you like reading I'd definitely check this one out. If you don't, keep in mind that this is not a video game in the traditional sense, and this might not be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997782037', 'num_games_owned': 1644, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1383832516}
review:
It's strange product, has a good plot, good voices, and fitting graphics, but...

it is not a game.

If you can finish it by clicking next dialog options and make few moves with a mouse to pick something up or open the door, you can't just expect someone to believe it's a game.

More visual novel, or interactive book/comic. If you are looking for something like that, you may like it.

But if you are looking for a game, skip this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995009108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1470920715}
review:
This isn't so much a game as a very good, well produced visual novel. 

The story is well told - a good balance between voiced, videos, and text only with the occasional point and click exploration parts. The level of detail in certain aspects of the game is outstanding; for example, any newspaper you find is completely written and interesting to read.

A solid experience but the price is a little high.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067261759', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1453205668}
review:
The 39 Steps has an incredible good story, but the gameplay is very boring. So I would suggest not to play it like a game but more like a interactive movie..
Plus it has good art style and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013115338', 'num_games_owned': 7447, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1450316775}
review:
The 39 Steps is a visual novel game based on the 1915 novel by John Buchan. You are Richard Hannay who has been framed for murder and are now on the run. You are being chased by a group called the Black Stone because you know their secret. It’s your job to expose them.

I thought the story was decent and somewhat thrilling but I would tend to fall asleep playing the game. There isn’t much interaction except for periodically clicking the mouse button and some small gestures once in a while. Most of the time you are reading words placed over some nicely drawn scenery with some small spoken dialog sections which is well done. 

You could probably finish the game in one sitting if you are able to stay awake the whole time. I’ve played a few other VN games so I know they aren’t like your typical game, but this one was just not exciting or very interesting. There are some cards and awards to collect but those are pretty much standard unlocks by playing the game. Nothing special to them at all.

I can’t really recommend this game unless you are a diehard VN person or really, really love espionage stories.

Bear Rating: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972526661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1390448433}
review: This little known gem is now one of my favorites.  It is an interactive visual novel of The 39 Steps with nice artwork, animation, and voice acting to bring the story to life.  I would love to see more stories adapted to this format!  The book is divided up into segments called events, where you advance through the storyline, examine certain objects, and perform actions to advance it.  The production quality is top notch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010962463', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1389427703}
review:
This game represents a very interesting concept: an interactive story, animated and voice-acted. Part (audio) book, part movie, part game. I have to say, it's an ambitious undertaking, but lacks the complexity of the media it combines. It doesn't have the depth and introspection of a book. It doesn't have the gripping cinematics of a movie. Its interactivity fails to draw in the player like a more fleshed-out game. I love the idea, and the story is a classic, but it really falls short on all fronts.

Beyond the presentation being not quite to my taste, the game has some glaring issues. There are a few misspellings/typos throughout the game's text. There are a couple quick milliseconds of distortion in moments where the VO recording volume peaks. I would like a final product that has more attention to detail.

If you're a big audio book/storytelling fan, I'd say it's worth a shot if you get a discount. Otherwise, if you're just an avid reader and gamer, and you're just a bit curious, you're probably better off getting the original novel or watching Hitchcock's adaptation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057726321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1390421417}
review: Tato hra se snad ani hrou nazvat nedá. Spíše bych ji vnímal jako interaktivní knihu, které ovšem chybí interaktivita :). Pokud máte problémy s angličtinou, tak se do ní nepouštějte, protože tento kousek je převážně o čtení. Nebo se do ní s chutí pustťe, chcete-li si angličtinu vylepšit. Celá hra spočívá v proklikávání jednotlivých scén, aniž byste měli jakoukoliv možnost cokoliv ovlivnit. Chybí absolutní řešení jakkýchkoliv rébusů. Na své si snad přijdou tak akorát výtvarní nadšenci, neb animance místností a jednotlivých lokalit jsou velmi pohledné, taktéž i milovníci špionážních románů psaných v originálním jazyce - v tomto případě anglickém. Neodvážím se tedy hru, dá-li se hrou nazvat, doporučit ani nedoporučit, záleží, co od ní budete očekávat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037313479', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1633780696}
review: A ideia é interessante. E o jogo tem muito bom cenário, mas a história podia ser mais interessante. Podiam fazer este tipo de "jogo" para os livros do Stephen King.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103834814', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1401712787}
review: Its a good Story Mystery Game... (y)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969484311', 'num_games_owned': 2145, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1388872592}
review:
I suppose one way of dealing with the challenges of interactive storytelling is to remove any trace of interactivity. Ultimately, this game is only slightly less interactive than To The Moon, but The 39 Steps lacks To The Moon's brilliant original story and competent pacing.

I had a tough time deciding whether or not I should recommend this game. I think maybe if it were under $5 and you are a patient person with 4 hours to spare, it might be worth the ride. The game does have some truly compelling moments of storytelling, but the slightly confusing and underwhelming climax undermine the otherwise fine story.

The biggest problem with The 39 Steps is that it has no idea what it wants to be. It's marketed as a game, but that is one of the few things it is not; it's part graphic novel, part film and part radio play, with a ton of clicking thrown in for good measure. Some elements work, others fail miserably. I found myself consistently thinking I'd rather be reading the book on which this semi-interactive experience is based. Since that book is available for free, and can be experienced at my leisure without the uneven pacing presented here, I can't bring myself to recommend this version of The 39 Steps, despite all its ambition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994570583', 'num_games_owned': 3045, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1388866775}
review: 39 Steps is a kinetic novel. Click to progress, click to look close at a newspaper relevant to the plot, do a series of ridiculous mouse movements to open a door. There's no choice, next-to-no gameplay, just text, voice acting, images, music. And in and of itself, that's all right. I'm also working through the When They Cry series, which are also kinetic novels. The problem with the 39 Steps as a kinetic novel is that it's decidedly the wrong format. You have a story about running, disguises, lying, code books, and you don't let the player do anything with any of those? Come on now. When They Cry works because it's essentially observational and relationally complex (and even then, I'd hesitate to recommend them idly). 39 Steps is an espoinage thriller, flat out. Our protagonist is driving the action, and the action is fairly active. This is not a thoughtful story, this is not an explorational story about human nature, it's a man-on-the-run tale. As such, I can't really recommend it in this format. If you want the book, read the book, if you want an adaptation, there's the Hitchcock film. This particular game format adds very little to the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011070983', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1388745858}
review:
Начнем с того, что это не игра, а интерактивная книга, жанр - приключенческий роман.
Она полностью на английском языке, поэтому лучше вам вспомнить школьную программу, которой тут, кстати, не хватит. Это довольно серьёзный, средний английский.
Сюжет - отличный, оно и не удивительно, ведь это книга.
Геймплей - как таковой, отсутсвует, практически.

Ну что сказать, чуваки. Могу рекомендовать только любителям английской литературы, ну или англоговорящим любителям романов, иначе никак.

6 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993408671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1388809136}
review: This was a great adaptation and I really hope they do more digital novels. I'm used to playing visual novels, so perhaps this minimally interactive format is not for everyone... but the design and music are excellent and of course the story itself is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011315104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1385224093}
review: This point n click game is awesome you should try it

author: {'steamid': '76561198027339790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1450684186}
review:
As a point & click adaptation, it loses something of the pacing, intensity, and imaginative power of Buchan’s rollercoaster novel, only really picking up towards the very end despite a 4 to 5 hour running time. Again, against more traditional video game experiences – even the likes of Dear Esther – it struggles to satisfy when player actions have comparatively little effect.

But it still contains many memorable encounters and if The 39 Steps can convince players to check out the original story (free from [url=http://www.gutenberg.org/catalog/world/readfile?fk_files=3539714]Project Gutenberg[/url]), or others like it, then perhaps this experimental foray has done its job well enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079623243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1388491380}
review:
The 39 Steps is based on a book by the Scottish author John Buchan and thoughout the game you will see the beautiful landscapes of Scotland. You play as Richard Hannary, an expatriate Scot who recently returned from South Africa.In the game Hannay will meet a spy Scudder who shared his secrets with him, but shortly after Scudder gets murdered in Hannay his flat and Hannay as to flee to clear his name and carry out the task Scudder had. Its 20 chapters from here, in which you will explore the book step by step. 

The only thing 39 steps might have lacked was game play, but they made up for that by keeping the story as accurate as it was originally written. And I applaud the lack of game play, as it is not really a game but an interactive novel, which i enjoyed alot, and had everything I would expect. Definetily a recommodation, and would love to see more of this. Its a very enjoyable story which will keep you entertained, and about 20 chapters in verious lenghts so you can easily stop for a bit and pick up later again.

Great iniative to get maybe more people in to some sort of reading old classics, and really wish to see more of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066836630', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1388548219}
review:
I usually don't have an interest in interactive novels but the storytelling & writing is fucking amazing, I was on the edge of my seat the entire game & I was blown away on how interesting the game is because it's based on a real book by John Buchan (I never read the actual book but I can tell the devs were big fans of this guy so I have to give Kudos to the devs for making this game, here's some info about Mr. Buchan https://archive.today/kyv1K if you want to know what other books this guy made).

Pros:

1. Interesting Story

2. Suspenseful Music

3. Good Voice Actors

4. The game is based on a real book

5. Good art

6. Interesting characters

7. It is 19 chapters long which to me is decently long

Cons:

1. Most people will complain that there is not much gameplay but the whole point of the game is story driven so I don't consider that an issue but some people will be turned off about that

Overall this game is perfect & if anyone has an interest on interactive novels then I suggest starting on this game so you can get the idea on how those novel games work (Here is some info on the original book version of The 39 Steps https://archive.today/xnbeq so I suggest checking it out).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991335082', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1629719814}
review:

Pokud neumíte anglicky, nemá smysl kupovat, hra je opravdu jen o klikání a čtení textů, který je ale pěkně nadabován, hluboký a  gradující.

Jako hru to rozhodně nedoporučuji a komplet průlez je značně repetetivní, bez jakéhokoli hráčova zásahu. Kniha..
Naopak jako příběh, knihu to doporučím, jelikož animace, dabing i krásné pozadí atmošku doladí.:)

5/10 (7/10 4 bookworms)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064687100', 'num_games_owned': 3585, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1450216735}
review: A thrilling "visual novel" with quite a few characteristics of a point-and-click adventure and a fairly faithful adaptation of John Buchan's book. I was completely pleased, and it definitely worthed every cent of its price. The story couldn't be bad since it's a adaptation of a best-seller, but the soundtrack, the awesome hand-painted artwork and the voice performances turned it into a brilliant experience which i would recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025175610', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1388188230}
review:
Easy game.. Well, this isn't really a game but a digital adaption of John Buchan's novel by the same name "The 39 Steps".

The story telling is intriguing and illustrations are beautiful and very colorful.

If you can't decide between watching a movie or reading a book for the evening, might as well play "The 39 Steps".

Still counts for my first perfect game (unlocking all achievements). :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197998048652', 'num_games_owned': 2422, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1390762378}
review:
The 39 Steps has been designed with such attention to detail that it positively oozes the stuff, which makes it more intuitive than many other interactive visual novels I've had the pleasure of reading. As per the title, there are a total of 39 chapters, each of which is a self-contained slice of the overall story, with beautifully drawn scenes and objects. Gameplay is fairly simplistic, and is no great stretch to the player - or should I say reader or watcher? - as in some other titles such as Puzzle Agent. Flowing seamlessly from one element to the next is no easy feat, and yet this game manages to accomplish it.

Maybe it's ironic that an interactive novel creates an experience that is hard to describe using words alone. Definitely a hidden gem, if any title on Steam is underrated it is this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069089358', 'num_games_owned': 1288, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1387897788}
review:
The 39 Steps war für mich eine wirklich besondere Erfahrung. Wobei "Erfahrung" hier besser passt, als die Bezeichnung "Spiel", denn das ist The 39 Steps nicht.

The 39 Steps ist eine so genannte "Visual Novel", also eigentlich die digitalisierte Form des gleichnamigen Buches. Die meiste Zeit ist man also nur am lesen bzw. zuhören -die Sprecher sind wirklich spitze, das Ganze wurde mit viel Liebe zum Detail umgesetzt-. An dieser Stelle eine Warnung: Wer der englischen Sprache nicht mächtig ist, wird mit The 39 Steps keine Freude haben, da sowohl die Sprecher, als auch Texte und Untertitel NUR in englisch verfügbar sind. Die Unterschiedlichen Akzente machen das Verstehen nicht grade einfacher. Zusätzlich wird das Geschehen durch stilechte Stummfilme aufgelockert und hin und wieder darf man selbst aktiv werden... das beläuft sich meist jedoch nur auf einfaches Klicken mit der Maus, hin und wieder muss man auch bestimmte Bewegungen mit der Maus nachmachen, aber nichts wirklich relevantes... Auch die Hintergründe sind echt schön anzusehen (die Screenshots auf der Shopseite vermitteln schon einen recht guten Eindruck, wie das Ganze aussieht).

Die Story ist auch wirklich spannend, verraten möchte ich aber nichts, da die Story nunmal den Hauptanteil des "Spiels" ausmacht. Die Dauer beträgt gut 4 Stunden, insgesamt gibt es 19 Kapitel, die je ca. 10-15 Minuten dauern. Zusätzlich zu der Kapitelauswahl, kann man sich auch jederzeit "Lesezeichen" setzen, mit denen man jederzeit ab einer ganz bestimmten Stelle fortfahren/wiederholen kann.

Das einzig Negative, was ich anzumerken habe, sind Soundbugs, die bei mir etwa 3-4 Mal während eines Playthroughs auftraten. Dabei hat sich entweder die Musik immer wiederholt, oder ein Sprecher hat einen Satz mehrmals wiederholt. Insgesamt aber nichts allzu schlimmes.

Die Achievements kriegt man übrigens auch alle beim "durchspielen".


Definitive Empfehlung für The 39 Steps. Ob man 9.99€ dafür blechen will, muss jeder selbst entscheiden, im Sale ist es aber definitiv einen Blick wert, wenn man sich halbwegs für Visual Novels oder Adventures begeistern kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005701722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1385869454}
review:
When I was younger, I wanted games that have replay value, games that give you the best bang of the buck.  But things have changed, I have grown up.  I have a job and life, and too many games(option) out there, and just too little time to play anything.  

And even for those games that have short/moderate game completion time, some of these games you just have to play at least couple hours in one sitting.  So, this is where I think this game shine, 19 chapters, each chapter is under 20 minutes.  And I managed to finish a chapter everyday, and also get a Steam achievement everyday, one of the reasons I like this game. 

This is probably the first and only digital novel I've finished playing.  I personally don't think I like the story itself all that much(I don't think I dislike it too), but I like every little things in the game, like the main theme music of the game, the voice acting(which is superb I think), and all the artwork of it.

If you are like me who are too lazy to read books, and feels guilty of never really do much actual reading; perhaps, this game will help.  I'm looking forward to the next game like this by the same developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076314179', 'num_games_owned': 2225, 'num_reviews': 470, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1499155984}
review: Настоящая интерактивная книга, цифровая адаптация романа Джона Бакена. Очень интересный проект, правда только для владеющих английским языком)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974742349', 'num_games_owned': 19908, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1103, 'last_played': 1463917482}
review: 39 шагов это не игра вовсе, а интерактивная адаптация приключенческого романа (автор John Buchan). Книга, которую интересно читать, лучше всего с чашечкой душистого чая( и покуривая трубку, шучу). Все персонажи здесь не прорисованы, видимо для работы нашего воображения по максимуму. Ну не знаю, мне эта затея не очень понравилась. Что порадовало , так это эмоциональная и качественная озвучка персонажей, и конечно пейзажи, взятые из различных музеев и галерей, очень красиво выглядит. В целом, для отдыха, можно рекомендовать, но необходимо знание английского языка на хорошем уровне.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976799778', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1490269115}
review:
The 39 Steps ist eine spannende Graphic Novel über eine Verschwörung die zu einem Krieg führen könnte...
4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197966730904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1379845069}
review:
I greatly enjoyed 'The 39 Steps' and do believe that it's a great example of digital storytelling. Do not, however, approach it expecting a lot of interactivity or normal gameplay. You'll have none of those. Think of it more like a "comic book" of sorts where you click on to read the next sentence, move to the next scene, or examine some auxiliary texts for greater immersion in the story.

The narration was very good, as were the accompanying scenario images. I haven't read the novel so I can not say if it's an accurate description of the story therein but the pace of the story felt just right except the ending which felt kind of dull.

Overall, I'd give this "graphical novel" a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976028334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1387249545}
review: This is not a game. It's an 'interactive novel'. Essentially, the whole thing is reading some text, then click to bring up more text. There are some short movies too. Fittingly enough, The 39 Steps actually seems like it might be the concept of video games someone from 100 years ago might have had. The story takes place in 1914 and revolves around a conspiracy to start World War 1 and the protagonist is the only one who can stop it. The beginning and middle of the story are decent. The main character is being chased by zie Germans throughout the country side of England. The part where he's on the lam, wanted for murder by police and being hunted down by zie Germans because he knows too much was interesting. The ending isn't all that great, and if you know any history at all, you know this story doesn't end well.  I do not recommend this game if you want an actual game. This is really just a novel with some fancy animation thrown into the mix.  Really, for the price, you should just buy a book and you'll get more out of it than this story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2058, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1450227163}
review:
This isn't much of a game as it is an interactive novel, and, at that, it does a good job. I have never read the book this is based on, nor have I watched the films based on it, so this was my first experience with the story.

This is a fairly good espionage story, set shortly before WWI broke out. The gameplay is minimal, and it mostly involves making the story progress. So, my recommendation, is that you shouldn't approach this expecting an action-packed game, but rather a passive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029329656', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1494358619}
review: Visual Novel 0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009283048', 'num_games_owned': 2580, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1463763507}
review:
The 39 Steps is (as most have previously stated) an interactive novel, and NOT a game. There are some elements of interactivity in the form of mouse clicks and even "drawing" patterns with the mouse from time to time, but that's about it.  That said, if you know going in you're going to read and occasionally watch/listen to a story, you shouldn't be disappointed.

For the most part, I thoroughly enjoyed my time in the story. I would sit down and play one of the 20 or so "chapters" at a time. Having them broken down into 10-15 minute chunks like this helped and allowed me to play at my own pace.  The art is very well done, though there is really no actual animation. The voice acting is well done and the ambient sounds and music are a plus.

Being that the story is set prior to WWI (and that I'm American and this is set in the U.K.), some of the dialects and terminology were a bit tricky to follow, but not so much that it detracted form the story itself. Other than that, my only real complaint is that the ending seems somewhat . . . abrupt. I certainly won't spoil anything, but I felt that another couple minutes of gametime could have wrapped it up a little better.

All-in-all, the playthrough was an enjoyable experience and I'm looking forward to The Story Mechanic's next project.

My personal rating for what it is: 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015807157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1386248590}
review:
Czy to gra, czy tylko interaktywna adaptacja książki szpiegowskiej? Skłaniałbym się raczej ku temu drugiemu. Nie ma się wpływu na kompletnie nic - wszystko do czego sprowadza się nasza praca to klikanie kolejnych podświetlonych elementów ręcznie rysowanych ilutstracji, po których się poruszamy przez cały czas zabawy. 
Dopóki spodziewasz się, że tak będzie wyglądać twoje kolejne sześć godzin gry - na czytaniu streszczenia książki i oglądaniu pięknych szkockich pejzaży, to śmiało instaluj te 16 mb produkcji... ;)

Jedyne co mnie naprawdę irytowało podczas całej rozgrywki to muzyka. Po prostu fatalna. Zbyt głośna, zbyt nudna (a miała pewnie mieć znamiona budującej napięcie); wręcz rani uszy. 

Nie oceniam tej pozycji bo nie wiem co tu można ocenić tak po prawdzie.
Jedno jest pewne, nie daje satysfakcji z ukończenia. Wszystko bowiem dzieje się samo.

Dostałem ją jako prezent, więc nie narzekam. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198038819052', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1386583497}
review:
Even for an interactive novel I found this quite dull and uninteresting.  Has some pointless gamey elements, like quick time events that make you move the mouse in circles to open a door.  The game even starts out by telling you that it doesn't make you click a lot of stuff, when in fact thats pretty much all you do.  

Unless you feel like punishing yourself, I would not reccomend getting this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045396350', 'num_games_owned': 2809, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1466837870}
review: Let's be fair about this.  This is a FANTASTIC interactive visual novel, but not a game.  There is almost no game play involved outside of a few unnecessary cursor movements that simulate you doing things  like opening doors.  I loved it, but I can see where others would hate this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025188068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1386486888}
review:
"The 39 Steps" is, down to its core, a slightly-interactive-novel. That being said - it's not "bad" by any means. For what it is, it's incredibly well done, and a means in which I would love to continue consume various forms of classical fiction.

Based on the original espionage thriller "The 39 Steps" by John Buchan, you can definitely see where modern day spy stories came from - predating popular fictional characters like James Bond by at least 30 years. This story takes place on the verge of WWI and introduces a character named Richard Hanny, a man on the run after a young American spy divulges sensitive information to him. The game is presented mostly in beautifully painted backdrops, fuzzy silhouettes and the occasional shadow puppet show (of which are quite entertaining). These backgrounds take you from inner-city London, to the moors of Scotland and back again. There isn't much gameplay to be had (to my slight disappointment), but what is present is likened to that of a game like "TRAUMA" - drawing shapes and clicking on things to carry through the cutscene-like chapters.

Simply put - the game is awesome for what it is - but it really needs a bit more interactivity. There is one part that involves the character decoding a notebook. I got really excited, thinking that I'd at least have a mini-game or a puzzle to figure out the code, but alas - the game just carries on like the book. They allow you to zoom in and out on objects you see in the environments - here I am, thinking that I'll have to do some Sherlock Holmes work and pick out clues from the zoomed-in objects, but alas - there isn't much to discover but a few timeline-appropriate advertisements and newspaper articles.

I would love to digest all sorts of fiction this way. From Sherlock Holmes to H.P. Lovecraft to Franz Kafka - I would love to have this sort of artwork and voice acting and sound effects, mood, pacing, attention to detail, and the ease of taking it in via separate chapters (just incase I need to leave and come back to it) - albeit, more interactivity would be preferred.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086358874', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1512245228}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993395613', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1450482366}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053292326', 'num_games_owned': 1134, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1382851992}
review:
jeez louise this is a racing romp. move over bond we got hannay in the house and he's going to teach us what espionage really means. ya see, the thirty-nine steps was written in 1915. I ain't read the original but now I'm curious to do so, someday, maybe. it's possible you're familar with hitchcock's film adaption - I am not - but with this in mind we got a real vidya gamin period piece. it even has guns and violence so it's a perfect period piece for the medium. HA!

cough, so yeah it's an adaption of something constantly adapted. there ain't much here to dissect besides the story and literary analysis ain't really my thing unless I'm impressed. so let's just go with a classic: the game is fun. awww yea boy you know what that means. it's a regular good game that's what. what we got, what we got, we got some painted scenery. gog DANG have you seen the artwork. it's bleeding brilliant, it spills all over the screen. the attention to detail is always impeccable. and that doesn't just sit with the art! the writing is mindful of the time while adeptly conveying background without awkwardly hamfisting the narration. the segways and different menus that pop in and out while you're playing to convey different information is delightful. also those newspapers, the freaking perfectly accurate newspapers. man I could write paragraphs on those newspapers

the newspapers are not only written in the language of the time but they always include timely articles and adver

yeah just kidding about writing paragraphs on the newspapers. but they're representational of the game's quality if anything. the game also delivers in sound. we got your moody soundtrack, we got your professional sound effects, and seriously the voice acting is amazing. hannay just popped, "DEAR GOD" to quote my favorite line. what, that's not really a line? gameplay involves moving forward to the next page and then reading it. le hurrdurr not a game, but wait! you get to click and interact with things! the silliest moments in the game are like OPEN THIS DOORKNOB BY DRAWING ARROWS and SERVE DRINKS BY DRAWING ARROWS basically you get to do things by drawing arrows. sometimes you get to investigate things too, but it's all so clearly marked the discovery part is soiled. they didn't want you to miss any of their precious story which is just as well

so the story? well, it rips. it ain't nothin more than a blockbuster (granted one that's nearly a hundred years old), but I'm still turning the final sequence around in my head. hannay is a proper action hero in all meanings of that phrase. if you like reading with your vidya, are interested in new and exciting directions for the medium, or are just in the mood for some good 'ole storytelling, I say play this game. it ain't a heartsopper but man is it exciting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004635948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1385817372}
review:
The story is a visualization of a novel that leaves the player (well the term is really not accurate since the player does little but to scrool through the text) between the litirary, the visual, and the audble worlds, not really doing a good job at any of these.
The texts are not the best, not nearly enough to create immersion. Not only that they are short, this being because they needed small paragraphs for a more fluent reading, while listening to the effects, and watching the very basic animation. These paragraphs are just not good literarywize. I haven't read the original novel, so I cannot say wether it's anywhere near the original text, but I do not belive it to be so.
The charachters are not really portrayed visually except in collectible cards outside the main campaighn, inside they are mere specters that appear only during dialogue sequences. Although the audio effects, the voice acting and the music are fine, they alone are not enough to bring the story to life.

I did like the news papers that were used in the game, I'm not sure wether they are authentic, having a national library in the credits raises this possibility, but they convey the feeling of the era. I'd wish there were more details like that, things that brought that time more to life.

The general idea is nice, and if done correctly can bring a book to life in a unique way. But as the game is now, it is not worty of buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031725194', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1385757822}
review:
I've been in a search of different "games", and so, this one intrigued me, specially since it didn't even advertise itself as a game, despite being release on Steam. So... if not a game, what is it? A "Digital Adaptation" is what it calls itself. It's essencially an adaptation of a book into a more visual format, with a little more interactivity. 
I've got to say, I'd rather read a book most of the time, than "playing" one, unless there's something to take from it that I wouldn't from a book. Well, in regards to that, this is a much shorter form of a book, focusing on the essential only, and at the same time, giving some additional insight into the story's time and world through journals and such, for those interested... and, again, not a game. 
I usually play games for more interactivity than this has given me, at specially choice and consequence, which is something that I can't really get from a book, and which this still doesn't provide. 
So, all things considered, I don't think it surpasses a book for those who tolerate/like reading. 
BUT, it was still really well done (for what it was), and I'd say it was a totally positive experience, with lots of potential for the future. The story was really interesting (although the pacing was too slow, at times), and the whole art design helped a great deal, it was highly stylised, in a good way.
For the developing team: I'd love to see this done with a "Choose your adventure" type of book, I think that would be the format where it would shine! Maybe do some research into old Text VideoGames and try to adapt them as well. Who knows? But experimenting is the way to go, and, for the first "Digital Adaptation", I think it was pretty good. I'll follow you closely and see what else you can provide.
Oh, and also, a little bit more exploration, maybe with Diary Pages or Audio Logs spread throughout the places one can explore to provide more information about the story and the era it's set in.
Bottom-line: Not a game, still not quite as content-full as a book, but a nice experience overall, with fitting Music and Art Style. I'm interested to see where it goes! If you think you'll take some enjoyment out of something like this, go ahead and buy it, it's pretty good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035667350', 'num_games_owned': 2271, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1660432564}
review: This is probably the best book that you will ever play, and with a series of achievements that are unlocked just by going through the story the value is definately worht the price. 10/10 must buy, must read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054393567', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1451825120}
review: The 39 Steps is a visual novel closely based on the book by John Buchan, written in 1915. The text is presented to you in small chunks, so you can follow the plot tirelessly. There is also some minimal gameplay that requires you to perform gestures, which is accompanied by an interesting retro movie photography style. The game's strongest point would definitely be its amazing voice acting that puts a lot of popular titles to shame. This title is definitely recommended for avid book readers, or anyone else that feels like giving this genre a try. However, if you expect anything more than a well presented book with a twist, this game is not for you, obviously.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960901198', 'num_games_owned': 1705, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 4503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2357, 'last_played': 1531421004}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006096953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1460394108}
review: Great game based on an intriguing book.  However, it is very low-tech, even for an indie title.  I wouldn't spend more than $5 for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990246834', 'num_games_owned': 1791, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1383936944}
review:
Actually I don't know if I'd recommend this "game". I quote because it's not actually a game, but an interactive (not that much) spoken book.

The story is good and the presentation and the art is fine enough for you to get caught into it, but if you want to actually play a game, stay away from it.

If instead you're looking for a good story with not much to think about, then it's the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002424451', 'num_games_owned': 2298, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1466631365}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991657927', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1385090105}
review: This is not a game. Although it's certainly an interesting idea I'm not really a fan of these interactive books. And given that I've already read this one several times I failed to see much benefit to owning it. The artwork and acting in this one are of a very high standard and It could be argued that audio and visual stimulus can bring an added dimension - but then the whole point of books is their utilisation of your own imagination. And, for this reason, I'm out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004532679', 'num_games_owned': 16643, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1382937398}

author: {'steamid': '76561198059032043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1451273985}
review:
有名なスパイ小説をサウンドノベル化したゲーム。内容は日々の生活に退屈していたロンドン在住の男性が、とあることをきっかけに警察やスパイたちに追われる身となってしまうお話（時代は第一次世界大戦前直前）。ゲーム自体はクリックするだけで進行していくだけの単純ものなのですが、小説の内容がすごく面白かったので一気にクリアしてしまいました。小説自体を読むよりは読まなければならないテキストは圧倒的に少ないと思いますが、それでも結構な量の英語の文章が出てきますので、プレイの際は辞書もお忘れなく。実績解除も簡単です。

個人的には、ゲーム途中に出てきたできそこないのQTEみたいなのは、完全に蛇足だと思いました。

author: {'steamid': '76561198032909096', 'num_games_owned': 509, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1450918616}

Other times you read stuff.  Just what I always wanted a game where you read stuff or it moves so mind numbingly slow you will end up just drooling on yourself.  People say its like a book, great well for those who want a book sure grab it, Id rather have a game :P

Rating:  0/10  Value:  $0.00

author: {'steamid': '76561197970359249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1381434790}
review: Not something i would have normally played, but I saw it on the Linux games list and decided to give it a go. It is a wonderful digital adaption of an older book/film. The visuals are beautiful and the voice work is perfect. It's a nice change to be involved in something based in London, Scotland and Kent rather than a US city. Immersive and captivating. Just like a good book, it's hard to put down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011647032', 'num_games_owned': 12448, 'num_reviews': 868, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1474381485}
review: This game felt like a theater play where I was just in the audience watching from a distance. It tells you a story about murder and mystery. There are not puzzles, or challenges in this game. The story was very well done, and I enjoyed every minute of it. I liked that it made you use your mind to play out each scene and to put your own thoughts into the game as to how people look and move. You don't get to see your main characters face or anyone else's face for that matter. The game does let you click from time to time on certain things to get a better understanding about what is going on. This game was fun and I loved how it played out. Getting all the Steam achievements is extremely easy, all you need to do is just play it and you'll get them all. This is a delightful game and I suggest picking it up when you have the chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093814795', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1384711439}
review:
I'd just like to start off by saying that The 39 Steps is by no means a game, but more of an interactive graphic novel, based on the book.

The art is quite something to look at, and the voice acting is as genuine as it gets. I picked it up in the Groupees Be Mine 9 bundle, and it costed a total of $0.25. At that price point, it was definitely worth it. However, I wouldn't persuade you to get it for anything over $5, as, like I said before, The 39 Steps is not a game.

To avoid any and all spoilers, I won't say much about the story itself, other than it is as good as it gets when it comes to John Buchan.

All of those things aside, there is no Steam Cloud support for this game, which isn't too much of an issue. There are in-game extras to collect, including cards and different awards, which are awarded to you by progressing through the story and experiencing all the content. The Steam Achievements are all progression-based and thus are easily achieved, similar to The Walking Dead.

Also, it took me just over 200 minutes to finish, so you can expect to finish up with The 39 Steps in around 3 to 4 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1662960812}
review: This digital book is kind of like a point-and-click adventure only there's not much interaction. The story seems truncated and trite, perhaps even a Reader's Digest version, although I've never read the original story so that's just my guess. This version is told fairly well and is nicely segmented. I think the timeline of the story is supposed to be just before World War I, but they do not make this obvious. There's some decent voice acting, illustrations, and a good story board, but it's really not something I would consider a game. If it weren't included in an indie bundle, I would have never considered purchasing it. As an interactive book, I'm not all that impressed, but there's some good effort put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049441093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1379607667}
review: Nevím jestli zrovna "Doporučit" ale je to, cos e týče hratelnosti dost nudná adventura vyprávějící příběh dle Britské klasické knihy a filmu. Převážnou většinu nezaujme leda, že se válíte rádi v Britských detektivkách.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010418983', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1452076622}
review: I got this game for free and I thought it would be pretty trashy, but I was completely wrong. It's much like an interactive book in that it requires a lot of reading, but it has amazing visuals to go along with it. I'm not much of a reader, but I still enjoyed this a whole lot. The story is beyond intertaining.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035826801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 643, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1451052954}
review:
One of the few point and click adventure games I've enjoyed

Im not fan of games like this, but I gotta say I enjoyed the story part of the game.. the gameplay not so much, as there was so little of it.

I think you can easily get immersed into this game because of the rather interesting story. The music really makes the mood and it's good. I would buy the game just for the story and soundtrack for 5€ myself, as it has about 4-6 hours of gameplay, but fans of the genre probably would like to pay the full price.

Personally I got it in a bundle for less than 1€.

8/10 just because of the story and images which make it

author: {'steamid': '76561197989446733', 'num_games_owned': 10488, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1473253075}
review: It's a stretch to call this a game by any means—it's a "digital adaptation". Despite that, the art is wonderful and the sound's (music, voice) done rather well. The source novel however, was an early work of the genre, and shows its age (bit dull and contrived). I was pleased to find this bundled, and look forward to the dev studio's next work. It's also a straightforward 100% achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066339830', 'num_games_owned': 4106, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1456556593}
review:
A visual novel, not a game.

And to be expected, the novel emphasizes alot on storyline, but half of it I can barely understand due to language barrier/accent and old English culture that require further research to understand - of which I can't be bothered.

The story itself is pretty linear, you can go backward (technically) to review the older chapters but there's only one ending and one conclusion for Mr. Hannay's case. Pretty much similar to To The Moon game (another story-heavy game).

Art is fine for my taste, audio is as good as an utter flat tone in the burial ceremony - I'm dead sleepy when playing.

For achievement whores, rejoice, can get every single achievements implemented in this 39 Steps in one get-go. Just complete the game normally.

Frankly 15 dollars are too much for this visual novel. It's short, and gives no replayability whatsoever. For all its worth, if you are bored playing normal hack and slash game, grab this on a 75% sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011154218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1382131619}
