author: {'steamid': '76561198060051029', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1382722011}
review:
Je ne suis pas un lecteur de romans, pourtant j'ai trouvé ici la parfaite alternative a ce défaut. On ne peut pas vraiment qualifier ce jeu de "jeu" pour la simple raison qu'a part une quinzaine d'action QTE (littéralement), on ne fera que cliquer pour faire défiler la narration.
Au plus il me donnait à lire, au plus j'en demandais. A tel point que je vais certainement me débrouiller pour trouver le livre afin de savoir ce qui a dut être écarté pour le jeu.
Le scénario est prennant, la réalisation impeccable, les doublage bien exécutés, tout cela en créant une ambiance ultra immersive.
Je n'avais jamais joué à un jeu comme celui là avant, et j'aimerais vraiment voir ça plus souvent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979365657', 'num_games_owned': 2630, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1377596419}
review: Very competent and elegant experiment in literary adaptation to an interactive medium. Not so much a game but an interactive novel. The voice acting is superb and the production values are great. If the developers ever decide to make another game in this same fashion adapting Lovecraft I would buy that in a heartbeat. One can only hope...

author: {'steamid': '76561197983741338', 'num_games_owned': 1577, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1377573073}
review:
Antes de tudo, "The 39 Steps" não é um jogo e sim uma adaptação digital do livro, Sem nenhuma dúvida um dos melhores Thrillers que eu já li, não chega a tanto romantismo e dispor enigmático quanto as histórias de Sherlock holmes, mas com certeza ultrapassa facilmente em questão de aventura, A história é impressionante do começo ao fim sem te deixar cair na monotonia, a desenvoltura da história me agradou mais ainda. E realmente espero que a produtora continue desenvolvendo adaptações digitais como essa.

A trilha sonora e a arte gráfica que acompanham as "Páginas" são extremamente bem detalhadas e trabalhadas, oque facilita e muito a imersão à história e a todo o contexto, desde os sons de passos na rua até a típica música de abalo característico dos thrillers. 

Esse Clássico Thriller, que foi inspiração ao criador de James Bond (Ian Fleming's) é quesito obrigatório a qualquer amante do gênero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2435, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1376080702}
review: Not so much a game as an interactive story. Really really good. Buy it now!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052517234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1611193757}
review: Relaxing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025357025', 'num_games_owned': 2577, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1462080112}
review: Such a remarkable adaptation of John Buchan's breathtaking thriller. Reading has never been so deep and exciting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1450212900}
review:
The 39 Steps isn't necessarily a great book, but the way the novel has been made interactive is a step in the right direction. Personally, for me, the story contained too much politics, which I hate with a passion. I can't help it. I just have no interest in it.  But the way this 'game' has been executed is done in a terrific way. 

I was actually talking with my girlfriend about how I'd love to read books like this, with beautiful high res pictures and dynamic text in it, and the voices recorded like you're listening to an audio book, with each person doing his/her part instead of just one and the same person.

So, basically, this is an interactive novel. Reading this novel should take you anywhere between 3 or 4 hours. Short enough to keep you interested and long enough to tell you its story.

One thing I didn't care for was the fact that there are a few Scottish conversations in it, sometimes being spoken with a certain accent. It was hard to follow at times, so it would've been nice if there were extra subtitles for those parts. I really had to concentrate to understand it. It's the only flaw I can think of, so if you're an avid reader you might want to give this a read.

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981392142', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1599629576}
review: I really enjoyed this, though it could easily be argued that it's not a game.  There are no real choices to make, just the occasional choice of things to look at and newspapers to read.  For the most part, you're just reading through the story and enjoying some nice artwork and (probably my favourite part) nice sound effects and ambiance.  If you like the time period of pre-WWI England, or a good mystery/thriller, you'll probably like this.  I didn't feel cheated that it's not really a game; it was really nice to just relax and let the story unfold.  As advertised, I completed it in 6 hours (and all in one day, as I couldn't "put it down.")

author: {'steamid': '76561197962929467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1367046000}
review: It's not really a game but it's envisioned, well presented and engrossing. The sound design was excellent and the plot was about as complicated as any 'game' gets, although perhaps with a faint scent of cheese. To be expected for a story taken from a century old thriller novel. Excellent voice acting. Great, atmospheric way of enjoying a book.
